However, this finding did not remain statistically significant after Bonferroni corrections.
title: Hepatitis B infection is causally associated with extrahepatic cancers: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs2229092, a missense variant in the LTA gene, was associated with vorinostat response, indicating its potential involvement in modulating cancer survival gene expression.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukemia patients

finding: This SNP was part of a significant association signal centered on the TNFAIP3 gene, which is known to regulate inflammatory responses in immunity and is linked to several immune-mediated diseases.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: Positioned in an intron of ATG5, this SNP regulates plasma cell differentiation and interacts with genes influencing antibody production.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: This 3' UTR variant in IRF4 was associated with multiple immune-related conditions and has implications for B cell development.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: This SNP resided in the HLA region, where many plausible candidate genes could influence atopic dermatitis.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: Associated with atopic dermatitis, this SNP was considered novel and showed associations in the study populations.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP was found within an intron of AHI1, which has connections to neuronal development and may relate to atopic dermatitis pathophysiology.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: In EPIPREG, the minor allele of rs12526070 (T) was associated with increased serum levels of folate (p=9.19x10^-5), triglycerides (p=0.006), total cholesterol (p=0.041), and HDL cholesterol (p=0.023). Additionally, mediation analysis suggested that cg07077240 mediated the association between rs12526070 and serum folate levels.
title: Epigenome-wide association study of serum folate in maternal peripheral blood leukocytes

finding: The rs6903956 SNP, located in the ADTRP gene, was found to be regulated by GATA2, which preferentially interacted with the G allele. This interaction was noted in the context of familial early-onset coronary artery disease (CAD), linking the GATA2 polymorphisms to increasedCAD susceptibility.
title: Peripheral blood GATA2 expression impacts RNF213 mutation penetrance and clinical severity in moyamoya disease

finding: The SNP rs1800562 was identified at the HFE gene as having a significant association with binge-eating disorder (BED). It represented a C288Y missense mutation, known for its pathogenic role in hemochromatosis. The study highlighted the connection between BED and dysfunctional iron metabolism, implicating iron overload as a potential contributor to BED pathophysiology. Moreover, BED was linked to neuropsychiatric traits through the associated iron metabolism pathway.
title: Genome-wide analysis of binge-eating disorder identifies the first three risk loci and implicates iron metabolism

finding: The study identified rs3253, a 3' UTR variant, as a putative causal variant for changes in FEV1. This variant colocalized with THBS2 protein expression in the AGES-Reykjavik cohort, demonstrating a significant association (P = 1.4×10^−19, β = −0.18, RCP = 0.9976). Furthermore, the same variant was also associated with THBS2 protein levels in an independent cohort (P = 2.1×10^−186, β = -0.26). Due to a consistent direction of effect across datasets and the strong evidence of colocalization, THBS2 emerged as a candidate target for chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
title: Proteomic associations with forced expiratory volume – a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The study highlighted rs2736163, an intronic SNP within the gene PRRC2A, which was associated with the severity of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). This SNP has been previously linked to obstructive spirometry measurements, indicating a role in lung function.
title: Proteomic associations with forced expiratory volume – a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The association for rs60755019 within the TREML2 gene was replicated with nominal significance (P=0.003), confirming its role as a known genetic risk factor for AD.
title: A genome-wide association study in Peruvians suggests new risk loci for Alzheimer Disease

finding: Lastly, SNP rs5029937, located at locus 6q23.3 in the TNFAIP3 gene, was found to be significantly associated with SLE, with a P-value of 4.4×10^-24, corroborating its relevance in both ethnicities.
title: Genome-wide Association Clustering Meta-analysis in European and Chinese Datasets for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus identifies new genes

finding: SNP rs9271058 was significantly associated with AD risk and identified as a significant eQTL and ct-eQTL for the gene HLA-DRB1 in multiple cell types in both blood and brain. The association was particularly notable in myeloid lineage cells.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: SNP rs9271192 was significantly associated with AD risk and served as a significant eQTL for HLA-DRB5 and HLA-DRB1 in multiple brain cell types but not in blood.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: SNP rs4711880 was identified as an eSNP affecting CD2AP expression in immune cells and was significantly associated with AD risk, marking its relevance in AD pathogenesis.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: SNP rs13201473 was identified as a ct-eQTL for CD2AP, exhibiting significant association with AD risk in NK and CD8+ T-Cells.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: SNP rs10948363 was associated with CD2AP and stood out as the second most significant eQTL linked to immune response in the context of AD.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: The study found strong evidence for the rs9275477 SNP in the HLA region, particularly highlighting it as the lead genome-wide significant SNP from the ALS GWAS. It exhibited a high posterior probability of being implicated in both Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) and Alzheimer's disease (AD), suggesting a shared causal variant between these two neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Statistical examination of shared loci in neuropsychiatric diseases using genome-wide association study summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs9271247 was identified as having the highest probability of being causal for Alzheimer's disease across the 95% credible set related to the HLA region. This SNP was noted for its regulatory role in modulating the expression of genes associated with AD, specifically HLA-DQA1 and HLA-DRB1.
title: Statistical examination of shared loci in neuropsychiatric diseases using genome-wide association study summary statistics

finding: The rs9352691 variant was associated with several heart failure risk factors, including blood pressure, body mass index (BMI), high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C), alcohol consumption, and atrial fibrillation (AF), confirming its relevance in heart failure.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The study confirmed that rs3916765, located near HLA-DQA2, was significantly associated with cytogenetically normal acute myeloid leukemia (CN-AML). The odds ratio was calculated to be 1.88 (95% confidence interval 1.21-2.93, P-value=0.005) in the replication cohort. Furthermore, the association was stronger when analyses were restricted to AML patients with NPM1 mutations, showing odds ratios greater than 2.35.
title: Replication of a GWAS signal near HLA-DQA2 with acute myeloid leukemia using a disease-only cohort and external population-based controls

finding: SNP rs910416 located at 6q25.1 showed the most significant pleiotropic association with breast cancer (BC) and COVID-19 phenotypes, with a P-value of 1.90×10−29.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: This SNP was located near HLA-B and showed a significant association with overall glioma risk (p=3.08×10^-4), indicating a potential role in glioma susceptibility.
title: The immunogenetics of viral antigen response is associated with sub-type specific glioma risk and survival

finding: Situated near HLA-DRB9, this SNP revealed a strong association with overall glioma risk (p=2.86×10^-4), supporting its involvement in glioma pathogenesis.
title: The immunogenetics of viral antigen response is associated with sub-type specific glioma risk and survival

finding: This variant was associated with both total hip and femoral neck BMD traits, corroborating previous associations established for heel and FN BMD, making it relevant in the context of bone density research.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: A strong association was found between rs9272624 in the HLA class II region and IgG responses against HPyV6, with a significance level of P=9.62e-14, emphasizing the genetic control over the immune response to this polyomavirus.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The variant rs112463084 showed a significant association with IgG responses against JCPyV, with a P-value of 2.18e-20, indicating the influence of HLA class II variation on the immune response to this virus.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The rs9271025 SNP showed strong association with seropositivity to JCPyV (P=4.31e-46), reinforcing the significance of HLA class II variations in immune responses to polyomaviruses.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: Another variant in the HLA region, rs73401330, was significantly associated with MCPyV seropositivity (P=8.49e-29), indicating important genetic influences on immune response.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The study found that the rs3957357 C>T SNP in GSTA1 was associated with a higher risk of occurrence of hepatocellular carcinoma in European individuals.
title: Identification of potential core genes in hepatoblastoma via bioinformatics analysis

finding: rs2477820 was identified as a novel risk variant within the FOXP4 gene, and though it represents a new association, it exhibited moderate linkage disequilibrium (LD) with a previously associated variant (rs2496644) linked to COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: This variant, previously linked to COVID-19 hospitalization, is in moderate LD with rs2477820, highlighting its potential role in impacting COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The SNP rs1800562 in the HFE gene was found to be associated with higher serum iron levels, potentially increasing the risk of atrial fibrillation as part of the genetically determined systemic iron status. The analysis suggested a causal link between elevated iron status and increased atrial fibrillation risk.
title: Genetic support of a causal relationship between Iron status and atrial fibrillation: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1799945, also in the HFE gene, exhibited a significant relationship with increased systolic and diastolic blood pressure, which are known risk factors for atrial fibrillation. The findings indicated that higher blood pressure due to this SNP could confound the relationship between iron status and atrial fibrillation.
title: Genetic support of a causal relationship between Iron status and atrial fibrillation: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1800562, which corresponds to the known C282Y mutation, was rediscovered in the analysis and was shown to be highly significant with a p-value of 6.93×10^-75. This variant is critical as it is responsible for most hemochromatosis cases.
title: Polygenic architecture of a novel MRI endophenotype: the “hemochromatosis brain”

finding: Included in the chr6_54 super variant, which had an OR of 1.329 (p=1.67×10^-7) and indicated association with lung-related death risk in COVID-19 patients.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: The SNP rs2627230, located in the SLC2A12 gene, was identified as the most significant lead SNP in the IVS GWAS. It was associated with increased levels of native T1 time, implicating SLC2A12's role in glucose metabolism related to cardiac conditions such as heart failure and diabetes.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs6912979, located in the SOD2 gene, was associated with decreased interventricular septum T1 times. This finding highlighted the relationship of oxidative stress with myocardial fibrosis, as SOD2 is an established gene involved in cardiac oxidative stress responses.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs115740542 was positioned near the HFE gene and was in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs1800562, known as the common hereditary hemochromatosis variant. Its association pointed towards iron overload disorder effects, which could contribute to cardiomyopathy.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs9457699 was identified as an eQTL for SOD2, indicating higher expression of SOD2 correlated with lower native myocardial T1 time. This finding further emphasized the relationship between oxidative stress and myocardial fibrosis.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The rs1050462 SNP in HLA-B was recognized as a novel genetic variant associated with NPC susceptibility, contributing to the understanding of the genetic architecture of NPC heritability.
title: Whole-Exome Sequencing Association Study Implicates Genetic Effects on Viral Oncogenesis and Tumor Microenvironment in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma

finding: The variant was identified as an independent potential causal variant for disorders of iron metabolism, highlighting its role beyond OC associations.
title: Phenome-wide association study of ovarian cancer identifies common comorbidities and reveals shared genetics with complex diseases and biomarkers

finding: This GPX6 locus variant was associated with lower risk of disorders related to iron metabolism and was also linked with total protein levels in women.
title: Phenome-wide association study of ovarian cancer identifies common comorbidities and reveals shared genetics with complex diseases and biomarkers

finding: This variant was identified as a potential causal variant for celiac disease, suggesting its involvement in metabolic conditions.
title: Phenome-wide association study of ovarian cancer identifies common comorbidities and reveals shared genetics with complex diseases and biomarkers

finding: The SNP rs5370, located in the EDN1 gene, was found to decrease the risk of preeclampsia. This finding highlighted the significance of paternal polymorphisms in predicting preeclampsia outcomes, emphasizing the role of paternal genetic contributions alongside maternal risk scores in the context of preeclampsia risk assessment.
title: Preeclampsia prediction with maternal and paternal polygenic risk scores: the TMM BirThree Cohort Study

finding: SNV rs41272114 was located on a splice site resulting in null alleles for T alleles, which was associated with extremely low LP(a) concentrations. The study observed that subjects carrying variant alleles had the lowest median LP(a) concentration of 4.8 nmol/L. This confirmed previous findings that null alleles lead to decreased LP(a) concentration.
title: Comprehensive analysis of the genetic variation in the LPA gene from short-read sequencing

finding: SNV rs56393506 was identified as the lead SNV associated with increased LP(a) concentration with a per-allele change in LP(a) concentration of 1.065. This finding was significant and corroborated earlier studies identifying this SNV's association with elevated LP(a) levels.
title: Comprehensive analysis of the genetic variation in the LPA gene from short-read sequencing

finding: The SNP rs2229092 in LTA was associated with DKD (p-value 1.513×10^-5) and replicated for T1D with kidney complications (p-value 0.0044) in the FinnGen data set.
title: Whole-exome and Whole-genome Sequencing of 1097 Individuals with Type 1 Diabetes Reveals Novel Genes for Diabetic Kidney Disease

finding: The SNP rs6927687 was identified as likely the BMI-dynamic regulatory SNP of SLC16A10, a monocarboxylate transporter. This SNP showed context-wide regulatory shifts and had a predicted impact on MZF1 binding, indicating its significant role in regulating gene expression related to BMI.
title: BMI Interacts with the Genome to Regulate Gene Expression Globally, with Emphasis in the Brain and Gut

finding: The SNP rs4945850 also exhibited context-wide regulatory shifts affecting SLC16A10, a monocarboxylate transporter. Both SNPs were involved in the BMI-associated gene expression dynamics, showcasing their regulatory importance in the context of BMI and gene expression.
title: BMI Interacts with the Genome to Regulate Gene Expression Globally, with Emphasis in the Brain and Gut

finding: The missense variant p.R47H in the TREM2 gene locus was previously identified as a risk variant for Alzheimer's disease (AD). It significantly associated with lower cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) sTREM2 levels, with a very strong statistical significance (P=7.16×10^-19). This finding highlighted the role of TREM2 genetic variants in modulating sTREM2 levels and associated risk for AD.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The missense variant p.D87N in TREM2 was identified for the first time as significantly associated with AD risk, showing strong statistical association with lower CSF sTREM2 levels (P=2.71×10^-10). Similar to rs75932628, this variant emphasized the connection between sTREM2 levels and TREM2's influence in AD risk.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Located in the TREM2 gene region, this rare variant (P=2.25×10^-20) was associated with sTREM2 levels and demonstrated a strong linkage to the missense variant p.R47H, reaffirming the TREM2 locus's critical role in CSF sTREM2 levels.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Identified as a suggestive association with AD, this variant (P=6.02x10^-7) has implications on sTREM2 and AD risk, although specific linkage to CSF levels was less clear.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs2025994 was identified as a critical SNP located approximately 40kb upstream of the SNX9 coding region, contributing significantly to the risk associated with severe long COVID.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Severe and Fatigue Dominant Long COVID and Commonalities with ME/CFS Identified by Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The rs1800630 variant in the TNF gene presented the highest frequency among various populations, suggesting an increased severity risk for COVID-19 in the Indian population.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel locus in the study that achieved genome-wide significance for lung cancer susceptibility and was also associated with smoking propensity.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The rs200483 SNP was found to have the highest normalized BRAIN-MAGNET cb score among 7 SNPs in linkage disequilibrium (LD) at a schizophrenia risk locus. It was also previously identified as a daSNV, indicating it had a differentially active effect on NCREs.
title: A novel functional genomics atlas coupled with convolutional neural networks facilitates clinical interpretation of disease relevant variants in non-coding regulatory elements

finding: The SNP rs3130968, located in the HLA region, was also genome-wide significant and had previously been associated with peripheral vascular disease, indicating possible immunological involvement in Raynaud's syndrome.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The hemochromatosis variant rs1800562 in HFE was positively associated with disorders of mineral and iron metabolism and linked to lower blood manganese concentrations in previous studies.
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: SNP rs2388334, like rs12464825, exhibited weak effects across various cerebellar features but robustly emerged from multivariate analyses with replication sample p-values less than 1e-15.
title: The genetic architecture of human cerebellar morphology supports a key role for the cerebellum in recent human evolution and psychopathology

finding: The SNP rs7759971 was found to be significantly associated with pediatric steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome (pSSNS) in a multi-population GWAS meta-analysis. It was part of a novel locus in the Abelson Helper Integration Site 1 (AHI1) gene, with a very low p-value of 4.90 x 10^-12. This SNP overlapped with open chromatin regions of various immune cell types, suggesting its involvement in immune-related mechanisms underlying pSSNS.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: This SNP was identified as significant due to its location upstream of HLA-DQB1, achieving an extraordinary p-value of 6.79 x 10^-52. The strong association highlights its potential role as a genetic risk factor in pSSNS, specifically tied to the HLA Class II immune response.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2256318 was located in an intron of MHC Class I Chain-related Gene A (MICA) and showed significant association with pSSNS (p = 9.70 x 10^-18). This finding suggests a connection to immune mechanisms through the class I MHC pathway.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2281591 corresponded to the ELOVL2 gene and showed protective effects against schizophrenia, consistent with the findings involving other long-chain fatty acids. The MVMR analysis indicated that the protective effect of DHA persisted regardless of other lipid factors.
title: Causal associations between fatty acid measures and schizophrenia – a two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: The study reported that rs206783, identified as the top cis-pQTL of BRD2, was significantly associated with increased risk of rheumatoid arthritis (RA) in the UK Biobank population. Individuals with the AA genotype had a 10% higher risk of developing RA compared to those with the CC genotype, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.10 and a p-value of 0.03. This significant association was further reaffirmed through the FinnGen study using RA GWAS summary statistics.
title: Identifying therapeutic targets for rheumatoid arthritis by genomics-driven integrative approaches

finding: The SNP rs12529728 was included in the seven common SNPs linked to PCOS, supporting its potential role in the genetic architecture underlying the condition, particularly in relation to obesity metrics.
title: Both general- and central- obesity are causally associated with polycystic ovarian syndrome: Findings of a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The lead SNP at the HBS1L-MYB locus, rs61028892, had a positive association with HbF levels, with a beta of 0.73 and a P-value of 1.18 x 10^-9.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: At the HBS1L-MYB locus, the SNP rs66650371 was identified as part of a haplotype linked to HbF enhancement, associated with a deletion affecting transcription factor binding.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: This SNP, located at HBS1L-MYB, served as a marker for haplotypes associated with HbF levels, demonstrating significant effects.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: The SNP rs75932628 was identified as a genome-wide significant missense variant associated with proxy Alzheimer's disease. This variant caused an amino acid substitution from arginine to histidine (p.R239W) in exon 2 of TREM2, and had a CADD score of 26.1. It was noted for its strong association with Alzheimer's disease, being recognized in prior research by Sims et al. (2017).
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs143332484 was also significantly associated with proxy Alzheimer's disease, causing an amino acid substitution from arginine to histidine (p.R47H) in exon 2 of TREM2. Despite having a lower CADD score of 9.7, it was highlighted in Sims et al. (2017) and contributed to reduced microglial cell function related to Alzheimer's pathology.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs3117230 was identified in the HLA-DPB1 gene with a near-genome-wide significant association to tuberculosis susceptibility in an admixed South African cohort. The study reported a p-value of 5.292 x 10^-6 and an odds ratio of 0.437, indicating that this variant was associated with a lower risk of TB, further confirming the role of the HLA-II region in TB susceptibility.
title: Confirmation of HLA-II associations with TB susceptibility in admixed African samples

finding: The SNP rs28383206 was recognized in the HLA-II region and identified as genome-wide significant in the meta-analysis conducted by the International Tuberculosis Host Genetics Consortium (ITHGC), with a p-value of 5.2 x 10^-9 and an odds ratio of 0.89. This variant had previously been associated with TB in non-African populations, suggesting a possible population-specific effect that did not replicate in African ancestry cohorts.
title: Confirmation of HLA-II associations with TB susceptibility in admixed African samples

finding: The SNP rs6927022 was found in locus 6p21.32, within the intron of the gene HLA-DQA1. This locus was linked to multiple risk alleles for inflammatory bowel disease, specifically ulcerative colitis (UC), in European descent cohorts.
title: A powerful replicability analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The variant rs140780894 was identified as an East Asian-specific variant at the MHC locus associated with pulmonary tuberculosis (PTB). It had an Odds Ratio (OR) of 1.2 and a highly significant p-value of 2.9×10^-23, with a minor allele frequency of 0.24 specifically in East Asians. This variant was not present in the European population, underscoring its population-specific significance.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The variant rs2523559 at the MHC locus was found to be associated with 24 traits across various diseases, suggesting it may have a significant role in the genetic architecture of these traits.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The variant rs9265949 at the MHC locus was linked to 46 traits in European populations, emphasizing its significant role in pleiotropy across diseases.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The finding related to rs12189871 indicated a strong association with psoriasis, manifested by an odds ratio (OR) of 3.31 and a highly significant p-value of 1.8×10^-1524 within the MHC region on chromosome 6. This signal reflected multiple independent associations and complex linkage disequilibrium patterns.
title: GWAS meta-analysis of psoriasis identifies new susceptibility alleles impacting disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets

finding: The variant rs33980500 was identified as a well-known missense variant associated with psoriasis, exhibiting a regulatory role in the context of the TRAF3IP2 gene. It indicated significant involvement not only in coding but also in the regulation contributing to psoriasis susceptibility.
title: GWAS meta-analysis of psoriasis identifies new susceptibility alleles impacting disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets

finding: The finding for rs6908585 identified it as a skin-specific regulatory variant with a high regulatory probability of 0.491, indicating its role in influencing gene regulation at the TRAF3IP2 locus, which is implicated in psoriasis susceptibility.
title: GWAS meta-analysis of psoriasis identifies new susceptibility alleles impacting disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs12206258 was found to function as an inductive DRE regulating FOXC1 expression. Editing this SNP led to a significant blunting of dexamethasone-induced transcriptional activity of FOXC1 when comparing homozygously edited (C/C) cells to homozygous wild type (T/T) cells, with a reported p-value of 0.040. This suggests that rs12206258 is crucial in modulating gene expression linked to neuro-behavioral traits and psychiatric disorders.
title: Assessment of glucocorticoid-induced enhancer activity of eSNP regions using STARR-seq reveals novel molecular mechanisms in psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs28383206 was associated with susceptibility to tuberculosis (TB) at genome-wide significance (p < 5.2×10^-9). This variant was located in the HLA-II region, which encodes critical proteins involved in antigen presentation, highlighting its role in immune response to TB.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of host genetic susceptibility to tuberculosis identifies shared genetic architecture

finding: The variant rs41553512 was replicated in the Asian ancestry-specific analysis with a p-value of 3.53E-05, located in the HLA-DRB5 gene which is part of the identified HLA-II region.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of host genetic susceptibility to tuberculosis identifies shared genetic architecture

finding: In African American patients, the synonymous polymorphism (rs1049353) in CNR1 gene was associated with a higher weight gain following treatment with clozapine and olanzapine.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The SNP rs9372120 was identified as having a significant association with allergic disease in the PIAMA dataset. It was located in the gene ATG5 (Autophagy Related 5) and showed a notable mediation effect; specifically, 75.7% of the impact of rs9372120 on allergic disease was mediated by the DNA methylation of the CpG site cg20372759. This suggests that genetic variants at that locus could influence allergic disease presentation through methylation changes.
title: Nasal DNA methylation at three CpG sites predicts childhood allergic disease

finding: The SNP rs7766356 was associated with shape features and implicated in schizophrenia, serving as an eQTL for the gene ZSCAN23.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The SNP rs3135394 was part of a tri-SNP haplotype in intron 1 of the HLA-DRA gene that conferred substantial T1D risk, particularly in individuals homozygous for the high-risk DR3-DQ2 haplotype. The 010/010 genotype produced an odds ratio of 4.65 for increased susceptibility to T1D when compared to the homozygous 101/101 genotype.
title: Polymorphisms in Intron 1 of HLA-DRA Differentially Associate with Type 1 Diabetes and Celiac Disease and Implicate Involvement of Complement System Genes C4A and C4B

finding: The SNP rs9268645, part of the tri-SNP haplotype in intron 1 of the HLA-DRA gene, was associated with T1D susceptibility in individuals carrying the high-risk DR3-DQ2 haplotype. It showed a substantial association with T1D, corroborated by independent studies, evidencing an odds ratio of 1.70 for the AGG/AGG or AGG/x haplotypes compared to non-diabetic controls.
title: Polymorphisms in Intron 1 of HLA-DRA Differentially Associate with Type 1 Diabetes and Celiac Disease and Implicate Involvement of Complement System Genes C4A and C4B

finding: SNP rs3129877 was included in the tri-SNP haplotype that displayed significant association with T1D risk. The findings indicated that individuals homozygous for the 010/010 SNP configuration faced markedly increased odds of developing T1D, reinforcing the genetic risk factors identified within the HLA class II region.
title: Polymorphisms in Intron 1 of HLA-DRA Differentially Associate with Type 1 Diabetes and Celiac Disease and Implicate Involvement of Complement System Genes C4A and C4B

finding: This rare missense variant located in the HMGA1 gene exhibited the strongest height-increasing effect of any SNP analyzed in the dataset, contributing to an increase of 3.5 cm in height. It was noted as being detected in a region previously unreported in exome sequencing analyses and was identified due to the comprehensive genome-wide coverage provided by the GEL-UKB data.
title: A Genomics England haplotype reference panel and the imputation of the UK Biobank

finding: Linked to DEK and RNF144B, this SNP contributed to findings associated with low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: This SNP was associated with RGS17 and identified as contributing to the genetic landscape of low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: Tagging DLL1 and FAM120B, this SNP was noted for its association with low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The missense variant rs10305420 showed a strong causal association with a lower risk of PI when utilized as a genetic proxy for GLP-1RAs, with a reported odds ratio (OR) of 0.066 (95% CI, 0.006-0.774; P=3.05e-02). This suggests that it significantly influenced the robustness of the overall MR analysis linking GLP-1RAs to reduced PI risk.
title: GLP-1 Receptor Agonists and Risk of Paralytic Ileus: A drug-target Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The variant rs72928038 at the 6q15 locus was prioritized based on its association with multiple autoimmune diseases including rheumatoid arthritis (RA), type 1 diabetes (T1D), atopic dermatitis, and hypothyroidism. It was linked to the gene BACH2 due to its presence in a T-cell-specific SCENT enhancer, which showed impactful base-editing effects on BACH2 expression and T cell differentiation.
title: Tissue-specific enhancer-gene maps from multimodal single-cell data identify causal disease alleles

finding: The study found that male p.C282Y homozygotes (HFE rs1800562) had a 32% increased risk of prostate cancer compared to those without the mutation, with a projected excess proportion of 3.8% developing prostate cancer by age 75. This finding was notable as it was the first demonstration of such an increased risk in this population, indicating a need for clinical monitoring for both liver and prostate cancers.
title: Hereditary haemochromatosis beyond liver cancer: increased risk of prostate cancer during an 11-year follow-up

finding: The SNP rs2087182 in the MMS22L gene was discovered as another female-specific neuroticism locus. This SNP achieved genome-wide significance and correlated with increased neuroticism scores in the female cohort.
title: Sex-specific genetic and transcriptomic liability to neuroticism

finding: rs1165183 was associated with disruption of a transcription factor binding site at the H2BC1 locus, indicating its role in gout-related pathways.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: The study found that the A-allele and A-carrier genotypes of VEGF -2578 A-allele (rs699947) had significant protective associations against head and neck cancers (HNCs). Specifically, the odds ratios were reported as 0.651 for A-allele, 0.613 for A-carriers, and 0.393 for AA genotypes, suggesting a strong protective effect.
title: Strong and Significant Associations of Single Nucleotide Variants (SNVs) in the Promoter and 3’-Untranslated Region (3’-UTR) of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF) Gene with Head and Neck Cancers

finding: The analysis revealed that the T-allele, CT and T-carrier genotypes of VEGF +936 C/T (rs3025039) were significantly associated with increased susceptibility to HNCs, with odds ratios of 1.882 for T-allele, 2.060 for CT genotypes, and 2.023 for T-carriers. Additionally, CT and T-carrier genotypes were linked to higher tumour grades.
title: Strong and Significant Associations of Single Nucleotide Variants (SNVs) in the Promoter and 3’-Untranslated Region (3’-UTR) of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF) Gene with Head and Neck Cancers

finding: The rs3130048 SNP demonstrated a beta effect of -0.10 kg/m² per allele with a p-value of 1.10×10^-23, implicating common genetic variants at the LTA locus in their association with BMI.
title: Protein-truncating variants in BSN are associated with severe adult-onset obesity, type 2 diabetes and fatty liver disease

finding: The minor allele of rs2234253, located within the TREM2/TREML2 region, was associated with higher expression of ADCY10P1 (p=0.026) and TREML2 (p=0.044). This finding suggested a potential role in AD risk.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of Alzheimer disease reveals many differentially expressed genes and multiple biological pathways in brain tissue from African American donors

finding: The minor allele of rs73427293, also in the TREM2/TREML2 region, was positively correlated with increased expression of ADCY10P1 (p=0.026) and TREML2 (p=0.044), supporting its relevance in AD.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of Alzheimer disease reveals many differentially expressed genes and multiple biological pathways in brain tissue from African American donors

finding: The minor allele of CD2AP SNP rs7738720 was associated with reduced expression of CD2AP (p=0.026), indicating a potential impact on the gene's function in AD.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of Alzheimer disease reveals many differentially expressed genes and multiple biological pathways in brain tissue from African American donors

finding: The intronic variant rs973205 was part of a significant peak in the Tanner 3 to 4 transition in boys. It functioned as an eQTL involved in the regulation of the RP11-524H19.2 gene, highlighting its relevance in pubertal timing.
title: Joint models reveal genetic architecture of transitions between pubertal stages and their association with BMI in a Latino population

finding: The SNP rs1321311 found at 6p21.2 was associated with a high degree of tumor dedifferentiation (P=0.019, OR=2.18, CI: 1.14-4.17), corroborating its significance based on previous analyses.
title: Colorectal Cancer Risk and Ancestry in Colombian admixed Populations

finding: The lead SNP rs9469907 was strongly associated with the somatoform common factor, particularly influencing physical health aspects. It was identified as functioning as an eQTL for several genes in brain tissues, suggesting its role in regulating epigenetic modifications related to somatoform traits.
title: Multivariate, Multi-omic Analysis in 799,429 Individuals Identifies 134 Loci Associated with Somatoform Traits

finding: Association with the rapid symptom progression subtype (Subtype III) of PD was reported for this SNP.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was identified as significantly associated with the rapid symptom progression subtype (Subtype III) of PD.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: Association with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I) of PD was reported for this SNP.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: Located at locus 6p21.33, the SNP rs143334143 was part of the newly identified locus associated with severe COVID-19, presenting a significant p-value of 1.28×10⁻¹⁰, thereby confirming its relevance in the host genetic response to COVID-19.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: SNP rs6457620 was identified within the MHC region and matched with HLA-DQB1, showing a significant association as confirmed by both Taxonomy3 analysis and conventional GWAS results.
title: New Genetic Insights in Rheumatoid Arthritis using Taxonomy3®, a Novel method for Analysing Human Genetic Data

finding: SNP rs9268557 was mapped to HLA-DRA within the MHC region. This finding was significant and supported by the analysis conducted using the Taxonomy3 approach.
title: New Genetic Insights in Rheumatoid Arthritis using Taxonomy3®, a Novel method for Analysing Human Genetic Data

finding: The genetic variant rs2133037 was described as being close to the HLA-DQB1 gene on chromosome 6, implicated in immunity and neuronal survival. This SNP was identified as relevant in the context of the study's findings on serum IgG and its relation to ALS.
title: Polygenic associations and causal inferences between serum immunoglobulins and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs10499096 was associated with MAN1A1, a gene implicated in glycoprotein biosynthesis. It was found to interact with the MAN1A1 promoter through long-range chromatin interactions in muscle tissue, suggesting its regulatory impact on gene expression.
title: Candidate gene modifiers of dystrophinopathy identified by the uniform application of genome-wide datasets to novel GWAS-identified loci

finding: The rs9271609-C allele at the HLA-DQA1 locus was significantly associated with type 1 diabetes mellitus in PheWAS analyses of African American and European American groups. This association suggested potential implications in COVID-19 severity.
title: A comprehensive knowledgebase of known and predicted human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 susceptibility and severity

finding: The SNP rs41550412 was noted to be a tri-allelic variant in the gene HLA-DRB5, with the family segregating five different non-synonymous variants in this gene. While this SNP itself had not been previously attributed to orofacial clefting or limb malformations, it raised interesting possibilities for the patient's unique phenotype.
title: A Novel de novo TP63 Mutation in Whole Exome Sequencing of a Syrian Family with Oral Cleft and Ectrodactyly

finding: The SNP rs6930598, located in a gene-rich region on chr6, displayed significant associations with ΔNIHSS but showed variability in the direction of effect across different ethnic cohorts, highlighting a complexities in genetic contributions to stroke recovery.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: The variant rs1140343 represented a missense change that resulted in a substitution of histidine for glutamine at residue 253 of the HLA-DQB1 gene. This variant showed a modest posterior inclusion probability of 0.082 and was included in the first credible set which contained variants significantly associated with asthma. The finding highlighted its potential role in asthma pathology in relation to HLA genes.
title: Exome-wide analysis of copy number variation shows association of the human leukocyte antigen region with asthma in UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs9273349 was correlated with the Q253H amino acid change (rs1140343) in the HLA-DQB1 gene and was associated with the first GWAS of asthma. Its correlation (r2 = 0.813) indicated it might contribute to susceptibility to asthma through its linkage disequilibrium with previously reported asthma variants.
title: Exome-wide analysis of copy number variation shows association of the human leukocyte antigen region with asthma in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs6905288, associated with type 2 diabetes and thyroid stimulating hormone, demonstrated a positive causal association with reproductive diseases, supporting its role within the context of obesity-related reproductive outcomes.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: The SNP rs114760566, mapped to HMGA1 and linked with type 2 diabetes and multiple lipomatosis, was shared by endometriosis and uterine fibroids clusters, establishing its relevance in the genetic network influencing these conditions.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: In the study, rs2187668 was found to be associated with the DR15-DQ6 genotype which is linked to protection against Type 1 diabetes (T1D). This SNP was analyzed in the context of donors selected for their contrasting susceptibility to T1D, showing a strong protective genotype favoring regulatory T cells.
title: HLA-DQβ57, anti-insulin T cells and insulin mimicry in autoimmune diabetes

finding: rs660895 was identified in the analysis of T1D susceptibility within the DR3-DQ2/DR4-DQ8 high-risk group. The presence of this SNP indicated an increased risk for developing T1D, supporting its role as a significant genetic marker in the context of T1D susceptibility.
title: HLA-DQβ57, anti-insulin T cells and insulin mimicry in autoimmune diabetes

finding: The SNP rs9271366 was shown to correlate with the HLA class II typing performed in the study. Its presence was linked to the susceptible DR3-DQ2/DR4-DQ8 haplotypes, suggesting a strong association with increased risk for developing T1D.
title: HLA-DQβ57, anti-insulin T cells and insulin mimicry in autoimmune diabetes

finding: Analysis revealed that rs7454108 was part of the genetic testing focusing on the susceptibility to T1D within the DR3-DQ2/DR4-DQ8 group. The findings indicated that this SNP has a meaningful association with T1D risk, reinforcing its relevance in the context of T1D genetic predisposition.
title: HLA-DQβ57, anti-insulin T cells and insulin mimicry in autoimmune diabetes

finding: The T allele of rs2982570 from ESR1 gene correlated with lower risk of osteoporosis and decreased body height, showing higher prevalence in LLIs with an odds ratio of 1.692 for longevity.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: The T allele of rs1339227 showed higher frequency in LLIs, leading to a 1.604 times increased likelihood of reaching the age of 85, associated with reduced risk of schizophrenia.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: The G allele of rs2802292 from FOXO3A gene reached nominal significance (P=0.027) and suggested a protective role in longevity, associated with previous findings in Japanese, Germans, and French centenarians.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: The rs138698596 variant was noted as a new genome-wide significant locus in FTLD-TDP A, indicating it contributes to the risk for this pathological subtype.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The SNP rs1214761 was categorized among high-credibility SNPs that may influence regulatory functions and gene expression.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The SNP rs143334143 was associated with asthma (OR 0.94; p=2.31 x 10^-4), indicating a significant relationship between this variant and respiratory conditions relevant to COVID-19 severity.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs998584 was included among the 46 putative causal variants associated with adiponectin, further confirmed as a lead variant through meta-analysis results.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The SNP rs596359 was identified as part of the putative causal variants for adiponectin levels, categorized as a lead variant in the analyses conducted.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The SNP rs683039 exhibited the lowest RegulomeDB score (1f), indicating strong evidence of being in a regulatory region and its association with adiponectin-related mechanisms.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The SNP rs699947 was identified as being associated with hippocampal volume change following electroconvulsive therapy (ECT). Specifically, it was found that this SNP, located in the promoter region of the VEGF gene, mediated the increases in hippocampal volume that were observed after ECT treatment in patients with treatment-resistant depression. This finding suggested a genetic component influencing the structural brain changes related to ECT treatment outcomes.
title: Multimodal multi-center analysis of electroconvulsive therapy effects: brainwide gray matter increase without functional changes

finding: The SNP rs10455872 was found to be in linkage with a high-risk copy number variant (CNV) of the KIV-2 region of the LPA gene, particularly in the European cohort analyzed. This association with LDL levels and cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk underscores its relevance in understanding the genetic predisposition to CVD.
title: Closing the gap: Solving complex medically relevant genes at scale

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs3798220 was identified as a significant variant linked to a high-risk CNV of KIV-2 in the LPA gene, reflecting its impact on LDL levels and CVD risk in the studied European population. This finding reinforces the importance of both rs10455872 and rs3798220 as proxies for assessing cardiovascular disease risk associated with LPA gene variations.
title: Closing the gap: Solving complex medically relevant genes at scale

finding: The rs3734398 SNP associated with the ELOVL2 gene was predominantly related to higher levels of DHA and lower concentrations of eicosapentaenoic acid. This indicates that genetic variation at this locus significantly influenced fatty acid profiles, though it was not consistently linked to cardiovascular traits in East Asians.
title: The impact of fatty acids biosynthesis on the risk of cardiovascular diseases in Europeans and East Asians: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs9481408 was identified as a significant blood eQTL for HDAC2 inhibition (p = 4.1E-07). This finding supported the analysis of off-target effects of statins, highlighting its potential role in mechanisms related to depressive symptoms.
title: Statins and antidepressants induce similar in vitro gene expression responses

finding: The study identified SNP rs2500086 as being associated with alcohol-induced affective symptoms during alcohol withdrawal in a cohort of European Americans. This SNP was found to be in an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) relationship with the gene RNF182, suggesting a molecular mechanism by which genetic variations could influence the effects of alcohol consumption.
title: Peripheral blood transcriptomic profiling indicates molecular mechanisms commonly regulated by binge-drinking and placebo-effects

finding: The SNP rs11540822 was found to have associations with various medications related to COVID-19 symptoms and was specifically linked to thyroid preparations and metabolic traits, reinforcing its significance in genetic susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: Insight into risk associated phenotypes behind COVID-19 from phenotype genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs143334143 demonstrated significant genetic associations with antithrombotic agents and served as an important marker in several metabolic pathway analyses, indicating its potential role in influencing COVID-19 severity.
title: Insight into risk associated phenotypes behind COVID-19 from phenotype genome-wide association studies

finding: TGFM fine-mapped the non-mediated variant rs56225074 with a posterior probability of inclusion (PIP) of 0.55 within 1 Mb of the transcription start site of OVOL1, which was previously implicated in Eczema, demonstrating a potential role despite not being mediated by gene expression in the existing eQTL data.
title: Fine-mapping causal tissues and genes at disease-associated loci

finding: The study reported a rare synonymous variant in the gene TBC1D7, specifically the variant rs768742269 (c.447C>A; p.(Val149=)), identified in individual 5 and parent 1. This variant was associated with a clinical phenotype involving macrocephaly, autistic traits, and intellectual disability (ID). Through RNA sequencing, it was revealed that this variant led to the downregulation of TBC1D7 exon 5 and caused the skipping of this exon, which was confirmed by a mini-gene exon trapping assay. The variant was predicted to disrupt an exonic splice enhancer (ESE) site. Moreover, decreased abundance of the TBC1D7 protein was observed in fibroblasts derived from individual 5, providing further evidence supporting the pathogenic role of the rs768742269 SNP in the context of NDD.
title: RNA-sequencing improves diagnosis for neurodevelopmental disorders by identifying pathogenic non-coding variants and reinterpretation of coding variants

finding: The SNP rs10455872, located in the LPA gene, was identified as having a significant impact on the association between coronary artery disease (CAD) and prostate cancer (PCa). It was determined that a genetically conferred increased risk of CAD was causally associated with an increased risk of PCa, with a beta coefficient of 0.13 and a p-value of 0.03. In a leave-one-out analysis, it was shown that this variant disproportionately influenced the observed association, indicating that the positive finding reflected independent pleiotropic effects of LPA on both diseases, suggesting a shared genetic risk primarily mediated through germline variation in LPA.
title: Coronary artery disease and prostate cancer share a common genetic risk mediated through Lipoprotein(a)

finding: The variant rs1886814 was implicated primarily in East Asian samples and was found to be associated with critical illness due to COVID-19. It highlighted the importance of diverse population data in genetic research.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: This locus associated with lung adenocarcinoma variants showed a connection to severe COVID-19, linking cancer susceptibility knowledge to viral infection effects.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The rs10455872/PLG variant was identified as associated with heart failure risk, and it corresponded to findings from other studies, reinforcing its validity in heart failure genetics.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The hypothyroidism-associated SNP rs9404989 in the HCG26 long non-coding RNA presented a significantly higher odds ratio in the top quartile of fibrogenic disease topic weight (1.90±0.24) versus the bottom quartile (1.19±0.13), with P=3 × 10^-3 for difference. This finding pointed to a differential genetic risk profile associated with hypothyroidism in relation to fibrogenic disease.
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: The study highlighted the interaction of the FKBP5 variant rs3800373 with the city living environment, which was shown to significantly alter the neural stress response specifically in the anterior cingulate cortex. This finding was relevant to understanding the neurobiological mechanisms underpinning stress responses in urban settings, potentially linking it to mental health outcomes.
title: How does the macroenvironment influence brain and behaviour – a review of current status and future perspectives

finding: The rs241768 SNP was associated with tyrosine and represented an original finding linked to an eQTL for SLC16A10.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: The SNP rs143334143 (CCHCR1 locus) demonstrated significant effect size heterogeneity in a lymphocyte count meta-analysis, suggesting its relevance in COVID-19 severity assessment across different ancestries.
title: Host genetic liability for severe COVID-19 overlaps with alcohol drinking behavior and diabetic outcomes and in over 1 million participants

finding: The HFE c.845G>A (p.Cys282Tyr, rs1800562) variant was the most prevalent pathogenic variant within the dataset, found in 112 out of 2078 individuals (5.39%). Among these, 110 exhibited heterozygosity, while 2 were homozygous. This variant is linked to hereditary hemochromatosis, an autosomal recessive disorder connected to excess iron accumulation.
title: Unveiling the Landscape of Reportable Genetic Secondary Findings in the Spanish Population: A Comprehensive Analysis Using the Collaborative Spanish Variant Server Database

finding: The C allele of rs10485012 was linked with larger annular diameter in systole and displayed an association with decreased risk of coronary atherosclerosis and heart failure.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: The SNP rs7738720 near the CD2AP gene yielded a suggestive p-value of 1.14×10^-9 in the combined MVP and ADGC datasets, marking its relevance to Alzheimer's disease.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: This SNP located near the TREM2 gene showed suggestive association with a p-value of 2.23×10^-7 in the study, highlighting its role in Alzheimer's disease.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: This SNP upstream of TREM2 was significant in the combined analysis with a p-value of 2.95×10^-9, indicating its critical role in Alzheimer's disease.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with AD (p=6.06×10^-6) across the combined datasets, emphasizing its role in pathogenesis.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: Identified with a p-value of 4.64×10^-9 in the study, confirming its association with Alzheimer’s disease and strong linkage with TREM2.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: This SNP had a notable p-value of 5.48×10^-7, indicating its association with Alzheimer’s disease in the cohort.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The exonic variant rs9479297 within the SYNE1 gene was identified as contributing to the occurrence of concurrent hepatocellular and transitional cell carcinoma double primary cancer. This finding implied a potential link between genetic variations at this locus and increased cancer susceptibility, suggesting that genetic screening for rs9479297 might be relevant in clinical settings for assessing risk in affected patients.
title: Multiparametric MRI Along with Machine Learning Informs on Molecular Underpinnings, Prognosis, and Treatment Response in Pediatric Low-Grade Glioma

finding: This SNP associated with lymphocyte count and displayed a negative interaction with rs4713570, affecting lymphocyte proliferation.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: Alongside rs3819720, this SNP demonstrated a significant negative interaction impacting lymphocyte counts and associated with an increased risk of celiac disease.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This SNP had significant enhancing interactions with vQTLs in the HFE gene related to hemoglobin levels. The interactions were notably strong with pathogenic alleles of HFE.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: Identified as a vQTL for hemoglobin levels and showed significant interactions with rs4645, enhancing hemoglobin level effects, particularly in the presence of pathogenic HFE alleles.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: The rs401754 SNP was previously associated with an increased risk for schizophrenia. In the analysis, it was determined to be part of a locus on chromosome 6 where seven SNPs were located, highlighting its relevance in neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: BRAIN-MAGNET: A novel functional genomics atlas coupled with convolutional neural networks facilitates clinical interpretation of disease relevant variants in non-coding regulatory elements

finding: The rs10948901 SNP was associated with chronotype, specifically the tendency to wake up early in the morning, pointing to potential physiological or behavioral implications correlated with HG.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of severe pregnancy nausea and vomiting identifies risk loci associated with appetite, insulin signaling, and brain plasticity

finding: The SNP rs6905617 demonstrated the most significant association with English Lexical Decision (ELD). This SNP is located near the gene MANEA, which has been tentatively associated with general cognitive ability in past GWAS studies.
title: A genome-wide association study of Chinese and English language abilities in Hong Kong Chinese children

finding: The SNP rs4406273 served as a proxy for the HLA-C*06:02 status. In the study population, individuals with psoriasis who were HLA-C*06:02-positive (those carrying one or two copies of the rs4406273-A allele) exhibited specific clinical features. Notably, these individuals had lower levels of hsCRP, which is indicative of systemic inflammation, an increased prevalence of atrial fibrillation, and a decreased prevalence of migraine. This finding highlights the importance of the genetic marker in understanding the clinical characteristics of psoriasis patients.
title: Body Composition, Cardiometabolic Risk Factors and Comorbidities in Psoriasis and the Effect of HLA-C*06:02 Status: The HUNT Study, Norway

finding: The rs2076295-G variant was linked to lower expression of DSP in alveolar cells and was previously uncharacterized in relation to COVID-19, showing a strong colocalization signal with intrinsic pulmonary functions.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: The rs12660421-A allele was associated with increased lung adenocarcinoma risk and had recently been linked to long COVID-19, indicating its relevance in both conditions.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: The rs1800562 SNP in the HFE gene was identified as a causal variant associated with hereditary haemochromatosis, a condition that affects iron metabolism. In the context of iron biomarkers and their relationship to sepsis, the study found that this SNP contributed to the increased odds of sepsis, with an odds ratio (OR) for iron levels of 1.21 (95% CI = 1.13–1.29, p = 3.16 x 10^-4). The findings suggested that individuals with iron deficiency and/or anaemia might be at a greater risk, which underscores the complexity of iron homeostasis in the setting of severe infections.
title: Causal associations between iron status and sepsis: a Mendelian randomisation analysis

finding: Located in the exon of TRIM10 and mapped to HLA-A, this SNP was identified for the first time in connection to basal ganglia volumes, with both genes being important for immune functioning in the brain.
title: Unveiling the Genetic Landscape of Basal Ganglia: Implications for Common Brain Disorders

finding: The SNP rs140068132 was identified as a protective variant associated with lower breast cancer risk among Latina women in the US. This variant, located on chromosome 6q25, was found almost exclusively in individuals of Indigenous American ancestry. It correlated with significant clinical features, including lower mammographic density and reduced prevalence of ER-negative cancer, contributing to a 16% reduction in overall breast cancer risk.
title: Germline Mutations Associated with Triple Negative Breast Cancer in US Hispanic and Guatemalan Women using Hospital and Community-Based Recruitment Strategies

finding: The SNP rs71557378 was identified within the major histocompatibility complex (MHC) and showed an odds ratio of 1.10 (P=1.97×10^-8) for its association with SA. However, its significance did not persist when conditioned on MDD, indicating a potential pleiotropic effect or association with psychiatric disorders.
title: Dissecting the shared genetic architecture of suicide attempt, psychiatric disorders and known risk factors

finding: rs9274669 was identified in this study as a sentinel SNP with a significant association to PTB (P = 1.92×10^-17) primarily driven by data from Japan. It demonstrated a consistent direction of association across datasets, affirming its role in PTB susceptibility.
title: Common variants at 22q12.2 are associated with susceptibility to Tuberculosis

finding: The novel lead SNP rs1062034 was associated with the A2 dimension of ASD, recognized for its schizophrenia-like traits. This dimension involved enlarged subcortical volume, cognitive performance issues, and overlaps with schizophrenia genetic underpinning.
title: Three Imaging Endophenotypes Characterize Neuroanatomical Heterogeneity of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs150971595 near GABBR1 was associated with FVC at P=1.49x10^-8 and beta of -0.0307. Previous associations discussed this locus in the context of lipid traits like total cholesterol and triglyceride levels.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: The rs1200427 SNP at the RUNX2 locus on chr.6p21.1 was associated with a small positive effect (Beta=0.06, P=6.85×10^-14) on IgA levels. The IgA-decreasing allele correlated with increased RUNX2 mRNA expression.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: rs335407 was noted as an intergenic variant between TFB1M and NOX3 associated with incident CVD among individuals with T2D, showing a hazard ratio of 1.25, 95% CI 1.16 – 1.35, and a p-value of 1.5×10^-8, achieving genome-wide significance.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: This variant was one of the five significant CAD variants found to be associated with CVD risk in T2D post-Bonferroni correction, marking it as a relevant genetic marker for cardiovascular risk.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: The lead variant rs56393506, located in the LPA gene, was associated with increased odds for an atherosclerotic plaque (OR for T allele: 1.12, 95% CI: 1.07–1.16). This variant was found to be intronic and had a strong association with higher levels of lipoprotein(a), a known risk factor for atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease.
title: Deep Learning-Based Detection of Carotid Plaques Informs Cardiovascular Risk Prediction and Reveals Genetic Drivers of Atherosclerosis

finding: SNP rs78714474 was noted for its significant role in valvular heart disease (VHD) in the hot spring subgroup, indicating a relevant gene-environment interaction.
title: Hot Spring Residency and Disease Association: a Crossover Gene-Environment Interaction (GxE) Study in Taiwan

finding: The SNP rs3813498 was highlighted as significant for VHD, pointing to its involvement in genetic predisposition in individuals residing in hot spring regions.
title: Hot Spring Residency and Disease Association: a Crossover Gene-Environment Interaction (GxE) Study in Taiwan

finding: The lead SNP rs2268657 at the GLP1R locus showed peak associations at three months, illustrating its role in early childhood BMI development.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: Another variant at the GLP1R locus, rs2268647, peaked at one year, indicating different but significant early associations with childhood BMI.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: The variant rs1820721 located downstream of GLP1R, demonstrated strong associations with childhood obesity metrics at six months.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: The SNP rs80215559, located at 6p22.3, was associated with the immune BAG. It was part of a genomic locus that displayed causal relationships with both hepatic and musculoskeletal BAGs, indicated by a posterior possibility of distinct and shared causal variants.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Biological Age in Nine Human Organ Systems

finding: The SNP rs79220007, positioned at 6p22.2, was associated with the metabolic BAG. It was found within a genomic region closely linked to multiple organ BAGs, contributing to the understanding of inter-organ genetic crosstalk.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Biological Age in Nine Human Organ Systems

finding: The SNP rs2744575 is located at 6p22.3 and was associated with the musculoskeletal BAG. Its inclusion in the locus suggests a role in the genetic architecture affecting the musculoskeletal system along with other organ systems.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Biological Age in Nine Human Organ Systems

finding: The SNP rs411535, located at 6p22.3, was associated with the pulmonary BAG. Its position within the genomic locus supported findings of shared genetic influences across different organ systems.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Biological Age in Nine Human Organ Systems

finding: The SNP rs55925606, which is at 6p22.2, was associated with the renal BAG. This SNP is part of the broader genetic landscape influencing multiple organ BAGs.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Biological Age in Nine Human Organ Systems

finding: The finding related to rs10755709 indicated its association with genes involved in viral infection regulation, specifically linked to the transcription factor HIVEP1, playing a significant role in host immune response pathways.
title: Development and validation of a clinical and genetic model for predicting risk of severe COVID-19

finding: Located on chromosome 6, this SNP was linked to both ASD and ADHD, where the A allele conferred increased risk for ASD and cognitive performance, whereas the C allele was associated with ADHD and decreased brain volume in the left globus pallidus.
title: Identification of shared and differentiating genetic risk for autism spectrum disorder, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and case subgroups

finding: This SNP was linked to decreased depressive symptoms and showed a protective effect for pain. However, fine-mapping was challenged due to extended linkage disequilibrium in the MHC region.
title: GWAS meta-analysis reveals dual neuronal and immunological etiology for pain susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs1013698558 located at 6p12 showed moderate association with HGSOC and was positioned near the GCLC gene, which has been implicated in cancer mechanisms involving ARID1A.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The rs1794269 variant, which was closest to the HLA-DQB1 gene, showed significant association with dermatophytosis (p = 1.42×10−36, beta = 0.046), emphasizing the role of HLA region in immune response to fungal infections.
title: The genetic basis of dermatophytosis skin infection susceptibility

finding: A shared causal variant rs2790099 at the locus 6p21.1 between autism spectrum disorder (ASD2) and schizophrenia (SCZ2) was found, with a PP.H4.ABF of 0.92. This finding indicated that both traits shared a causal SNP and has implications in understanding the genetic basis of both conditions, with the causal SNP mapped to the RUNX2 gene.
title: Nine Neuroimaging-AI Endophenotypes Unravel Disease Heterogeneity and Partial Overlap across Four Brain Disorders: A Dimensional Neuroanatomical Representation

finding: The SNP rs9257566 at 6p22.1 was showcased as a shared causal variant between ASD3 and SCZ, with a PP.H4.ABF of 0.82. This locus involved several olfactory receptor genes and has been associated with dysfunction in the olfactory system in the context of both disorders.
title: Nine Neuroimaging-AI Endophenotypes Unravel Disease Heterogeneity and Partial Overlap across Four Brain Disorders: A Dimensional Neuroanatomical Representation

finding: The SNP rs1265079 was identified at the CCHCR1/POU5F1 locus as contributing to PPP susceptibility. Although it is unlikely to directly influence gene expression, it may be in LD with a variant regulating CCHCR1 levels (pSMR=4.4x10^-6), highlighting its importance in the context of PPP.
title: A genome-wide meta-analysis of palmoplantar pustulosis implicates Th2 responses and cigarette smoking in disease pathogenesis

finding: The SNP rs7739897, located in the UNC93A gene, was identified as part of a novel combination with two other variants in a Peruvian family with a strong clinical history of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias (ADRD). This variant was present in affected individuals across two generations, but absent in healthy family members, suggesting a significant role in familial ADRD.
title: Co-occurring Pathogenic Variants in 6q27 Associated with Dementia Spectrum Disorders in a Peruvian Family

finding: The SNP rs61740334, a variant of the WDR27 gene, is one of the three pathogenic variants found in a Peruvian family with a strong history of ADRD. Like rs7739897, this SNP segregated within affected individuals, but was not present in those without the disorder, indicating its potential contribution to familial ADRD.
title: Co-occurring Pathogenic Variants in 6q27 Associated with Dementia Spectrum Disorders in a Peruvian Family

finding: The SNP rs3800544, also a WDR27 variant, was discovered as part of the combination of three pathogenic variants associated with ADRD in a Peruvian family. It followed the same inheritance pattern as the other two variants, being present in affected individuals and absent in healthy members.
title: Co-occurring Pathogenic Variants in 6q27 Associated with Dementia Spectrum Disorders in a Peruvian Family

finding: The G-allele of the TNF rs3093662 A>G polymorphism in donor kidneys was associated with a higher risk of primary non-function (PNF) and significantly worse death-censored kidney graft survival over 5, 10, and 15 years. The G-allele doubled the risk of immediate graft loss and correlated with a 58% increased risk for late graft loss, demonstrating its significant negative impact on graft outcomes.
title: Tumor necrosis factor-α gene polymorphism is associated with short- and long-term kidney allograft outcomes

finding: The SNP rs10305420 was suggested to be associated with a lesser response in Chinese patients regarding glycaemic outcomes. This finding was supported by two small studies evaluating pharmacogenetics, indicating the relevance of this genetic variant in therapeutic response.
title: Precision medicine in type 2 diabetes: A systematic review of treatment effect heterogeneity for GLP1-receptor agonists and SGLT2-inhibitors

finding: The SNP rs601945 was associated with reduced levels of Tau in cerebrospinal fluid and postmortem brain tissues, indicating a protective effect against neurodegenerative pathologies. Specifically, it showed a strong association with decreased neurofibrillary tangles but weak association with neuritic plaque density. Furthermore, it was linked to a slightly older age of onset in Alzheimer's disease, suggesting a complex role in neurodegeneration.
title: Protective association of HLA-DRB1*04 subtypes in neurodegenerative diseases implicates acetylated Tau PHF6 sequences

finding: At locus rs504594, a significant protective effect was identified in Parkinson's disease with an odds ratio of 0.84.
