This finding suggested that it could be the primary driver of the HLA signal across various ancestry groups, establishing a connection with <HLA-DRB1> amino acids associated with protection against the disease.
title: Protective association of HLA-DRB1*04 subtypes in neurodegenerative diseases implicates acetylated Tau PHF6 sequences

finding: The SNP rs35472547 was found to peak in association with Alzheimer's disease, with an odds ratio of 0.91. It indicated a protective association similar to that observed at rs601945, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors associated with neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Protective association of HLA-DRB1*04 subtypes in neurodegenerative diseases implicates acetylated Tau PHF6 sequences

finding: At the CCDC170 locus, this SNP showed a correlation with copper levels, highlighting its role in mineral metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The variant rs1016378028 showed a 1.77-fold increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes with a minor allele frequency of 1.3% in the Latino population. It was considered a Latino private variant and was associated with increased levels of ketone bodies, indicating potential mechanisms linking it to diabetes risk.
title: The power of TOPMed imputation for the discovery of Latino enriched rare variants associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs2376620, located within an intron of the gene CDKN1A, was significantly associated with the cross-sectional area of the interventricular septum (IVS.csad). The finding indicated an increase in IVS.csad by an average of 8.4 mm2, supported by a high level of statistical significance (p=2.0e-10). This locus was specifically recognized for its role in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM), suggesting a connection between genetic variation at this position and cardiovascular risk.
title: Genetic determinants of interventricular septal anatomy and the risk of ventricular septal defects and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy

finding: The locus indexed by rs9369062 showed associations with sleep proxy phenotypes similar to rs1144566, indicating a shared genetic influence on timing of physical activity in sleep contexts.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: This SNP was associated with type 1 diabetes (T1D) in non-DR3/DR4 cases, contributing to the genetic risk differentiation based on HLA background.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: This SNP showed positive association with T1D risk in individuals lacking DR3/DR4 haplotypes and played a role in the genetic stratification of T1D.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: An association was found between rs1611547 and T1D in non-DR3/DR4 individuals, highlighting its relevance in the polygenic risk for diabetes.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: The SNP rs114170382 demonstrated a significant relationship with T1D risk, particularly in the absence of the high-risk DR3/DR4 haplotypes.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: Association with T1D was confirmed for rs17843689, underscoring its importance in the susceptibility profile for those without DR3/DR4.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: This SNP's association with T1D further elucidated the diverse genetic landscape contributing to the disease in non-DR3/DR4 cases.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: This SNP was positively associated with T1D, illustrating its relevance in non-DR3/DR4 genetic risk assessments.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: The association between rs149663102 and T1D was characterized as a substantial contributor to the genetics of diabetes in non-DR3/DR4 individuals.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: A study conducted by Gassó et al. (2017) found that the SNP rs9361235 was significantly associated with positive treatment outcomes after fluoxetine treatment in a group of adolescents diagnosed with major depressive disorder (MDD). This analysis highlighted the relevance of SNPs in transcription factor binding sites for the regulation of the HTR1B gene, which suggested a direct relationship between these genetic variants and antidepressant efficacy.
title: Leveraging DNA Methylation to Predict Treatment Response in Major Depressive Disorder: A Critical Review

finding: Xu et al. (2022) demonstrated that individuals with the SNP rs6298 who also exhibited high methylation levels at the HTR1B CpG3-61 region experienced significantly better outcomes from SSRI treatment. This finding indicated that the interaction between genetic variants and DNA methylation patterns may influence antidepressant treatment response in MDD patients.
title: Leveraging DNA Methylation to Predict Treatment Response in Major Depressive Disorder: A Critical Review

finding: The rs1800562 variant, which corresponds to the p.C282Y mutation in the HFE gene, was associated with a significantly increased incidence of musculoskeletal conditions in male homozygotes. Specifically, they showed a higher risk of developing osteoarthritis (HR: 2.12) and required hip replacements (HR: 1.84) compared to males without HFE mutations. Additionally, this variant was linked to other conditions such as knee replacements, femoral fractures, and osteoporosis, particularly in those with liver fibrosis/cirrhosis diagnoses.
title: Musculoskeletal outcomes with Hereditary Haemochromatosis genetic variants: 11.5 year follow-up in a community cohort

finding: The SNP rs4620159 was an intronic variant located on chromosome 6 with a lead SNP p value of 1.8e-28. It was previously associated with smoking (Smk) and cannabis use disorder (CanUD) and implicated in metabolic traits, being within the gene REV3L.
title: Cross-ancestry genetic investigation of schizophrenia, cannabis use disorder, and tobacco smoking

finding: This SNP in ESR1 reached genome-wide significance specifically in females, highlighting its potential sex-specific role.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The SNP rs9348441 was found to be significantly associated with GDM with a genome-wide significant p-value of 1.6×10^-14. It has also been previously reported for T2D susceptibility, underscoring its relevance in blood glucose regulation within the context of both conditions.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of gestational diabetes mellitus highlights genetic links with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs41272112 on 6q26 was shown to significantly impact longevity (β = -0.21, P = 4.2E-08) through its association with Lp(a) levels, suggesting a cardiovascular mechanism affecting lifespan.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The coding variant rs3798220, in complete LD with the prioritized SNP on 6q26, was linked to significant effects on lifespan, particularly in relation to lost healthy life years across study participants.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs140365013, associated with the HLA region, was reported to be connected to type 1 diabetes and systemic lupus erythematosus. This finding suggested its role as a key driver of comorbidities observed between SCZ and autoimmune diseases.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study in isolated human immune cells highlights interferon regulatory transcription factor 3 as a schizophrenia hub gene

finding: The SNP rs17587226, overlapping with the TRIM38 promoter, was highlighted as linked to schizophrenia risk. It was involved in mediating the expression of proteins that have been implicated in the immune response, suggesting a pathway through which IRF3 may affect SCZ.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study in isolated human immune cells highlights interferon regulatory transcription factor 3 as a schizophrenia hub gene

finding: At 6q16.3, rs117473527 was associated with congenital anomalies of the kidneys and urinary tract (CAKUT). It reached genome-wide significance with a p-value of 3.93×10⁻⁸ and an odds ratio of 3.17. This intergenic variant was noted to be downstream of GRIK2, which has previous associations with neurodevelopmental disorders and urinary tract cancers.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals contribution of rare and common variation to structural kidney and urinary tract malformations

finding: The SNP rs144171242 in PTK7 at 6p21.1 was significantly associated with posterior urethral valves (PUV), presenting a p-value of 2.02×10⁻⁸ and an odds ratio of 7.20.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals contribution of rare and common variation to structural kidney and urinary tract malformations

finding: The missense mutation rs3131639/A was associated with lower MICB expression and increased susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection. This variant was linked to decreased innate immune defense against the virus.
title: “Immunogenetics of resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection in discordant couples”

finding: The missense mutation rs2071554/T was correlated with the HLA-DOB gene and was connected to susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection, indicating its role in antigen presentation.
title: “Immunogenetics of resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection in discordant couples”

finding: The missense mutation rs9269942/T, common in infected individuals, was associated with lower HLA-DRB1 expression and increased susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: “Immunogenetics of resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection in discordant couples”

finding: The study found that homozygosity for the p.C282Y mutation at rs1800562 was significantly associated with decreased T2 signal intensity in motor circuits of the brain, indicating substantial iron deposition. Additionally, the research established that this homozygosity was linked to a greater risk of movement abnormalities in males, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.82, demonstrating a significant increase in risk compared to controls. Among the homozygous males identified, only a subset had a clinical diagnosis of hereditary hemochromatosis (HH), highlighting a potential risk for movement disorders due to iron overload in subcortical structures.
title: Genetic Risk for Hemochromatosis is Associated with Movement Disorders

finding: The SNP rs34645063, located on chr6q16.1, exhibited a strong association with delay discounting (DD) (P = 3.20×10^-13). This SNP was previously implicated in a variety of behaviors including risk-taking, substance use (e.g., alcohol consumption, smoking initiation, coffee intake), psychiatric disorders (including bipolar disorder), and various psychosocial factors such as educational attainment and BMI.
title: Genome-wide association study of delay discounting in 134,935 individuals identifies novel loci and transdiagnostic associations across mental and physical health

finding: The SNP rs2070600, which is associated with the functional RAGE polymorphism Gly82Ser, modulated increased sRAGE plasma levels. This polymorphism was notably linked to psychoticism and schizophrenia, indicating its relevance in conditions characterized by altered oxidative stress responses and psychotic symptoms.
title: Increased AGE-RAGE axis stress in methamphetamine (MA) abuse and MA-induced psychosis: associations with oxidative stress and increased atherogenicity

finding: This SNP was associated with lipoprotein A (LpA) with a p-value of 1.97E-14. It confirmed earlier associations identified in European populations, highlighting its importance in lipid metabolism.
title: A Chinese host genetic study discovered type I interferons and causality of cholesterol levels and WBC counts on COVID-19 severity

finding: This SNP, linked to white blood cell counts (WBC), had a reported p-value of 4.05E-08. It was noted as a novel association based on the context of immune surveillance.
title: A Chinese host genetic study discovered type I interferons and causality of cholesterol levels and WBC counts on COVID-19 severity

finding: The SNP rs7758630 was associated with major depressive disorder (MDD) and predicted to have GRIK2 as its causal gene. GRIK2, which encodes a subunit of the kainate glutamate receptor, showed upregulation in somatostatin (SST) cells across SCZ (logFC = 0.61), BD (logFC = 0.61), and MDD (logFC = 0.32). This finding pointed to the crucial role of GRIK2 in the neural circuit dysfunction connected to MDD.
title: Transcriptomic pathology of neocortical microcircuit cell types across psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs138141444, located at 6q24.1 in the ECT2L gene, was identified as a novel locus significantly associated with breast parenchymal texture variation (V). It had a P value of 1.24 × 10−8 for V75H and has not been previously linked to mammographic density (MD) phenotypes or breast cancer risk.
title: A genome-wide association study of mammographic texture variation

finding: The SNP rs3135338, which acted as a cis-meQTL for cg00124375 annotated to HLA-DRA, was significantly associated with various autoimmune disorders. Specifically, it showed a strong association with type 1 diabetes (P = 1e-300), multiple sclerosis (P = 3.7e-294), and rheumatoid arthritis (P = 1e-200) as reported in large genome-wide association studies (GWAS). These findings highlighted the SNP's relevance in the context of inflammatory and autoimmune phenotypes.
title: DNA Methylation Signatures of Cardiovascular Health Provide Insights into Diseases

finding: The SNP rs80036911, located on the MECOM gene, was significantly associated with aortic root diameter. It was noted in the context of a genetic signature associated with variations in left ventricular trabeculation.
title: Using Machine Learning to Elucidate the Spatial and Genetic Complexity of the Ascending Aorta

finding: The SNP rs35452836, found at 6q21-CD164, was linked to clonal hematopoiesis and represents a new significant locus in the context of recessive genetic factors influencing CH.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: This SNP, related to SUPT3H, presented an association with otosclerosis and specified the odds ratio as 1.25.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: This lead variant near IP6K3 was strongly associated with otosclerosis, showing a significant odds ratio and implications in gene expression.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: The SNP rs3798220 was found to be associated with plasma Lp(a) levels and cardiovascular risk in Caribbean Hispanic individuals (CF=0.12). In the WHICAP cohort, it also showed significant ties to baseline insulin c-Peptide levels, indicating that variant carriers had higher c-peptide levels (beta=3.4, p=0.007). This relationship supported observations of hepatic insulin resistance linked to Lp(a), marking it as a novel finding with important implications.
title: Ancestry specific distribution of LPA Kringle IV-Type-2 genetic variants highlight associations to apo(a) copy number, glucose, and hypertension

finding: The variant rs58023137 was associated with higher expression levels of the THBS2 gene in one individual with AAA. This alignment with previous GWAS findings suggested that this variant contributes to AAA development by affecting gene expression.
title: Differential expression analyses on aortic tissue reveal novel genes and pathways associated with abdominal aortic aneurysm onset and progression

finding: Similar to rs58023137, the variant rs9505895 was linked to increased THBS2 gene expression in an individual with AAA, reinforcing the connection between this allele and AAA risk as established in earlier GWAS studies.
title: Differential expression analyses on aortic tissue reveal novel genes and pathways associated with abdominal aortic aneurysm onset and progression

finding: The intronic variant rs12203592 in the IRF4 gene revealed significant associations with lung cancer risk and allergic diseases, particularly showing strong gene expression regulatory effects in lung tissue from European descent.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The novel association of variant rs17534632 in the PPIL6 gene was linked to lung cancer susceptibility, also correlating with eosinophil count in European populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The variant rs191133092 near the HLA complex group 15 (HCG15) was identified with significant associations in lung cancer, particularly among those with a background of depression.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: SNP rs11757382 was found near HLA-DRB1 and HLA-DQA1 linked with lung cancer risk.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This variant was associated with adenocarcinoma near HLA-DRA and LOC101929163, expanding the significance within the HLA region.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs9267123 near HCP5 showed associations with squamous cell carcinoma, demonstrating effects across diverse populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: An intergenic variant rs9374662 associated with lung cancer, revealing connections with multiple risk factors.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The variant rs2316515 in IRF4 was associated with allergic disease and lung cancer risk, underlining genetic regulation observed through quantitative expression analysis.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The variant rs3104394 in the MTCO3P1 gene reached significance in association with alopecia areata only in Admixed American populations. This finding suggests potential genetic contributions to alopecia, particularly in the Hispanic/Latinx community.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs3135388 was significantly associated with cluster 2 and cluster 4 when compared to controls, with unadjusted p-values of 3.6 × 10^-8 for cluster 2 and 6.1 × 10^-9 for cluster 4. This SNP is highly correlated with the HLA-DRB1*1501 allele, which is recognized as the strongest genetic risk factor for multiple sclerosis (MS). The findings indicated that the clustering analysis may have identified neuropathological subgroups that reflect significant genetic underpinnings related to MS susceptibility.
title: Identification of neuropathology-based subgroups in multiple sclerosis using a data-driven approach

finding: The <italic>CFB<sub>R32Q</sub></italic> variant was found to significantly associate with better graft survival when present in the donor (P=0.027) and showed combined presence in donor-recipient pairs was also associated with improved outcomes (P=0.045). This variant indicated that lower complement activity corresponds with better long-term survival outcomes.
title: Synergistic impact of three complement polymorphisms in the donor, not the recipient, on long-term kidney allograft survival

finding: The lead causal variant rs72951506 was located in the intron of the NUS1 gene. It reached nominal significance for schizophrenia with a p-value of 2.3 × 10^-8 and genome-wide significance for type 2 diabetes with a p-value of 9.93 × 10^-11. This variant had opposing risk-increasing alleles for type 2 diabetes and schizophrenia and was part of a genomic locus that colocalized between the two conditions.
title: Genomic insights into the comorbidity between type 2 diabetes and schizophrenia

finding: The intronic human variant rs3130660 in the FLOT1 gene was significantly associated with the g2g-L2 subclade of Mycobacterium tuberculosis, indicating that individuals with the A allele were approximately 40% more likely to be infected with strains carrying the interacting Mtb variant marker. The association was very strong with an odds ratio of 1.39 and a p-value of 9.24 × 10^-15.
title: A FLOT1 host regulatory allele is associated with a recently expanded Mtb clade in patients with tuberculosis

finding: The SNP rs3132610, which was found to be in tight linkage with rs3130660 (r² = 0.90), was identified as the most strongly associated variant with FLOT1 expression in the GTEx database. This variant's association with FLOT1 expression in the lung had an effect size of 0.28 and a p-value of 2.22 × 10^-16.
title: A FLOT1 host regulatory allele is associated with a recently expanded Mtb clade in patients with tuberculosis

finding: The SNP rs9461629 also showed involvement in FLOT1 expression modulation, which, along with rs3132610, contributed to strong evidence of colocalization with the host SNP associated with the g2g-L2 strain in multiple tissues and cell types.
title: A FLOT1 host regulatory allele is associated with a recently expanded Mtb clade in patients with tuberculosis

finding: The missense variant rs75932628 in the TREM2 locus was identified as a functional variant for AD with a suggestive association p-value of 3 x 10^-3, specifically driven by the European ancestry population.
title: Key variants via Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project whole genome sequence data

finding: The SNP rs201956837, although an intronic variant in HLA-B, was significantly associated with IOP (P = 8.65 × 10^-9, beta = 4.37) in pan-ancestry analysis. Moreover, the HLA-B gene was linked to a strong association with glaucoma in the FinnGen cohort (P = 1.10 × 10^-9), underlining its significance.
title: Whole-exome sequencing study identifies novel rare variants and genes associated with intraocular pressure and glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs9295988 (Chr6:31373718C>G within the MICA gene) was associated with increased risk of colorectal cancer (CRC). In a study involving 40,125 cases and controls, the G allele was linked to a higher risk for CRC with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.09 (95% CI 1.04 - 1.15, p = 0.0009). This association was found to be stronger in early-onset colorectal cancer (EOCRC), with an OR of 1.26 (95% CI 1.08 - 1.44, p = 0.0023). A follow-up validation in an independent set of 76,983 participants confirmed the association with a per-allele OR of 1.15 (95% CI 1.03 - 1.34, p = 0.0150). Additionally, MICA RNA expression analysis showed that expression decreased linearly with each additional G allele, suggesting a functional impact of this genetic variant on immune cell dynamics in colorectal tumors.
title: Genetic Variation and Regulation of MICA Alters Natural Killer Cell-Mediated Immunosurveillance in Early-Onset Colorectal Cancer

finding: For SNP rs660895, the PheWAS analysis using the Gold-standard logistic regression model identified significant associations with multiple disease codes, including Type I diabetes and Rheumatoid arthritis. Both the bias-corrected Poisson model and the bias-uncorrected Poisson model with robust standard errors also captured significant results consistent with those found in the Gold-standard model.
title: Overcome the Limitation of Phenome-Wide Association Studies (PheWAS): Extension of PheWAS to Efficient and Robust Large-Scale ICD Codes Analysis

finding: The variant rs7773324-A, associated with DUSP22 and IRF4, was found to increase the risk of non-melanoma skin cancer (NMSC) by 14%. It showed consistent replication across cohorts with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.14 and a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 1.09 to 1.19.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: The variant rs1847472-C located in BACH2 was associated with increased risk of NMSC, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.05 and 95% CI (1.01, 1.09). This variant indicated a 5-9% increase in risk.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: Rare intergenic variant rs11962863 in the MHC region showed a significant association with pneumonia, with a notable odds ratio indicating increased risk, albeit displaying heterogeneity across cohorts, particularly in Finnish populations.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of pneumonia suggests a role for mucin biology and provides novel drug repurposing opportunities

finding: This SNP at the HLA-DQB1 locus was previously reported to be associated with asthma, lung function, and COPD. For ACO, it had an odds ratio of 1.20 and was significant with a p-value of 9.19×10^-28, suggesting strong genetic influence.
title: Genetic associations and architecture of asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap

finding: The rs9271378 variant was located in the HLA class II region, between HLA-DRB1 and HLA-DQA1, and demonstrated a genome-wide significant association with severe PUUV infection (p = 2.30×10^(-34)). This discovery highlighted the role of HLA class II molecules in modulating immune responses to PUUV.
title: Genetic analysis implicates ERAP1 and HLA as risk factors for severe Puumala virus infection

finding: The rs2844614 variant was closest to the HLA-C gene in the HLA class I region and showed an independent significant association with severe PUUV infection (p = 1.0×10^(-13)). This finding emphasized the importance of HLA class I pathways in the immune response to PUUV.
title: Genetic analysis implicates ERAP1 and HLA as risk factors for severe Puumala virus infection

finding: The rs3130304 variant was located near the NOTCH4 gene, approximately 200 kilobases from the HLA class II region. It was associated with non-severe PUUV infection and exhibited a genome-wide significant p-value of 5.34×10^(-12). This result suggested that genetic variability near NOTCH4 may influence the severity of PUUV infections, although it specifically related to non-severe cases.
title: Genetic analysis implicates ERAP1 and HLA as risk factors for severe Puumala virus infection

finding: The SNP rs3135388, which is linked to the HLA-DRB1â 15:01 allele, was found to significantly contribute to the heritable risk of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), as documented in the FutureMS study. This SNP marked the primary genetic influence on disease risk among individuals diagnosed with relapsing remitting MS, reflecting its dominant association with the disease. Additionally, the cohort exhibited a significant over-representation of the HLA DRB1â 15:01 risk allele, confirming its critical role in the genetic landscape of MS.
title: FutureMS Cohort Profile: A Scottish Multi-Centre Inception Cohort Study of Relapsing-Remitting Multiple Sclerosis

finding: The rs9367106 SNP at the FOXP4 locus was associated with an increased risk of Long COVID, with an odds ratio of 1.63 (95% CI: 1.40-1.89). This association was supported by a genome-wide significant p-value of P = 1.8x10^-10.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Long COVID

finding: The rs12660421 variant, a proxy for the Long COVID risk allele rs9367106, was found to increase FOXP4 expression in the lung (P = 5.3x10^-9, NES = 0.56), supporting its role in the expression of a gene related to Long COVID.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Long COVID

finding: The rs9271608 variant was mapped to the HLA-DRB1 gene and was identified as a likely causal variant linking Alzheimer's disease (AD) with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). This variant exhibited potential as a target for immunosuppressive drugs, suggesting a capacity to influence AD and T2DM manifestations.
title: Local patterns of genetic sharing challenge the boundaries between neuropsychiatric and insulin resistance-related conditions

finding: The rs9275599 variant was also connected to the AD-T2DM relationship, being situated within the MTCO3P1 gene. It shared likely causal involvement in the pathophysiological mechanisms underlying the correlation between these two conditions.
title: Local patterns of genetic sharing challenge the boundaries between neuropsychiatric and insulin resistance-related conditions

finding: At locus 16 (signal 18), rs7776158 displayed significant regulation effects on SOX4 as demonstrated in CRISPRi assays, asserting its role in transcriptional regulation linked to melanoma.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: Also significant at locus 16 (signal 18), rs2125570 was associated with reduced expression of SOX4 upon gRNA targeting in the experimental setup, reinforcing its involvement in melanoma-associated gene regulation.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: At locus 16 (signal 18), rs6935117 was validated as a candidate variant influencing SOX4 expression, reflecting eQTL characteristics and regulatory significance.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: Like rs6935117, this SNP at locus 16 (signal 18) showed influence on SOX4's expression through targeted gRNA effects validated by experimentation.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: At locus 17 (signal 19), rs72834823 was successfully targeted in CRISPRi studies, leading to a significant decrease in SOX4 expression, supporting its regulatory candidate status.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: Also in locus 17 (signal 19), this variant demonstrated regulatory interactions with SOX4 upon testing, consistent with its proposed role in transcriptional modulation.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: In locus 17 (signal 19), rs6456503 influenced SOX4 expression significantly when targeted, establishing it as a notable regulatory element.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs34481484 was found to be significantly associated with MG through HLA fine-mapping, revealing its association with the HLA-DQA1 gene, with a p-value of 3.72×10^-9 and an OR of 2.11, indicating its importance in MG pathogenesis.
title: A Myasthenia Gravis genomewide association study of three cohorts identifies Agrin as a novel risk locus

finding: SNP rs113720465 was associated with an increase of 0.76 standard deviation units of C4 protein concentration, which highlights its significant effect on C4 levels.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: SNP rs3117579 had the smallest P-value indicating a significant association with C4 protein concentration, emphasizing its relevance in this context.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: SNP rs114492815 was identified within the MHC region and showed an association with C3 protein concentration, although its associations with C4 haplotypes were minimal.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: This RNA pseudogene variant was significantly associated across multiple populations (EUR, AFR) with p-values of 2.15×10−18 (EUR) and 1.84×10−8 (AFR), indicating shared genetic risk factors for ERM.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: The SNP rs9268905 was found to have a strong association with temporal artery biopsy (TAB)-positive giant cell arteritis (GCA), reflecting a significant genetic variant within the Human Leucocyte Antigen (HLA) region, with a p-value of 1.9×10^-54 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.79.
title: Estimating overdiagnosis in giant cell arteritis diagnostic pathways using genetic data: genetic association study

finding: The SNP rs477515 showed a robust association with TAB-positive GCA, located in an intergenic region of the HLA, with a p-value of 4.0×10^-40 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.73.
title: Estimating overdiagnosis in giant cell arteritis diagnostic pathways using genetic data: genetic association study

finding: For SNP rs9275184, an association with TAB-confirmed GCA was noted, but in TAB-negative cases, it was the only SNP among several that retained statistical significance with a p-value less than 0.05.
title: Estimating overdiagnosis in giant cell arteritis diagnostic pathways using genetic data: genetic association study

finding: The intergenic variant rs9274619:A was found to significantly associate with decreased triglyceride (TG) levels among individuals with type 2 diabetes (T2D), showcasing significant heterogeneity in effect estimates when compared to those without T2D. Specifically, for individuals with T2D, the variant correlated with a TG reduction (beta=-0.066, p-value=3.9×10^-15), while showing no significant difference in the non-T2D group (beta=0.002, p-value=0.21). This association was replicated in an independent cohort, further validating the original finding.
title: Genome-wide Discovery for Diabetes-Dependent Triglycerides-Associated Loci

finding: SNP rs117928001 was a contributing SNP in all four verifications of the super-variant chr6_148. This super-variant is associated with thrombosis due to interactions involving gene STXBP5, which plays a role in platelet activation, potentially linking it to increased risk of death from COVID-19.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: The high-risk variant rs1165183 was found to regulate the expression of SLC17A4, leading to changes in urate transport in kidney cells, showing a strong association with urate levels.
title: Locus-specific stratification and prioritization unveil high risk genes underlying hyperuricemia

finding: The SNP rs9271609 was confirmed to be associated with WBC traits in prior research. The attenuation of the WBC association signal for the 2q31.2 duplication was due to inter-chromosomal LD between this duplication and rs9271609, located in the HLA region. This indicated a potential complex interaction between the two variants affecting WBC counts.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies common and rare structural variants contributing to hematologic traits in the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The SNP rs3132388 was associated with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD). It was identified as the only conditionally independent genome-wide significant (GWS) SNP within its locus, with a significance level of p=2.86 × 10^-9. This SNP was located in the MHC region, which is known for its complex linkage disequilibrium (LD) structure.
title: Discovery of 95 PTSD loci provides insight into genetic architecture and neurobiology of trauma and stress-related disorders

finding: The novel SNP rs693906 was identified as significantly linked to schizophrenia with a p-value of 2.13E-13. It was located on chromosome 6 within the intron of the SLC44A4 gene, which had been previously associated with schizophrenia in a Japanese sample. This SNP was part of the 17 novel SNP associations identified, suggesting a potential pathway for further research into the genetic underpinnings specific to schizophrenia.
title: Isolating transdiagnostic effects reveals specific genetic profiles in psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs9389268 was significantly associated with mitochondrial genome copy number (MT-CN) variation in blood, with strong associations noted in multiple analyses (P = 3.24×10^-8 in WGS data and P = 1.26×10^-10 in imputed array data). It was located in an intergenic region between the MYB and HBS1L genes, which are known hematopoietic regulators, and was shown to influence hematological parameters. The association with MT-CN was suggested to reflect blood cell composition due to its known links with various blood cell counts.
title: Mitochondrial genome copy number measured by DNA sequencing in human blood is strongly associated with metabolic traits via cell-type composition differences

finding: The SNP rs3130618-A, located near MSH5, correlated with increased survival among TMZ-treated IDH-mutant and 1p/19q non-codeleted gliomas. The hazard ratio was 0.58, demonstrating a median improvement of 79.6 months over the CC genotype (p=0.016).
title: Functional germline variants in DNA damage repair pathways are associated with altered survival in adults with glioma treated with temozolomide

finding: This SNP showed colocalization with myocardial-wall thickness at end-diastole (WT global) and atrial fibrillation, suggesting genetic overlaps between cardiac structure and arrhythmia.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The index SNP rs2232423 at the 6p22.2 locus was identified as a major exonic variant regulating the expression of ZSCAN12, a gene associated with depression and schizophrenia, thereby establishing a link with MDD.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: SNP rs1799971 in the gene encoding opioid receptor mu 1 (OPRM1) was well understood and demonstrated significant implications for perioperative management. Its A>G substitution resulted in an amino acid change (p.Asn40Asp), which was associated with increased opioid resistance, necessitating higher therapeutic doses in patients with AG and GG genotypes. The G allele frequency varied across populations, with Japanese samples showing a range of 42% to 44.7%, and it was detected in two of the five participants in this study.
title: Rapid detection of single nucleotide polymorphisms using the MinION nanopore sequencer: a feasibility study for perioperative precision medicine

finding: The SNP rs9266082 was associated with higher fever (temperature of 37.5 °C or higher and 38 °C or higher) in the context of adverse events following COVID-19 mRNA vaccination.
title: Identification of susceptibility loci for adverse events following COVID-19 vaccination in the Japanese population: A web-based genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs551634406 was part of the loci that were associated with higher fever (37.5 °C or higher) and muscle pain, highlighting its potential role in susceptibility to these adverse events.
title: Identification of susceptibility loci for adverse events following COVID-19 vaccination in the Japanese population: A web-based genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs183300 was included among the loci associated with muscle pain and elevated fever (37.5 °C or higher and 38 °C or higher) following COVID-19 vaccination.
title: Identification of susceptibility loci for adverse events following COVID-19 vaccination in the Japanese population: A web-based genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs3135408 was associated with higher fevers (37.5 °C or higher) and muscle pain in the context of self-reported adverse events after receiving COVID-19 mRNA vaccines.
title: Identification of susceptibility loci for adverse events following COVID-19 vaccination in the Japanese population: A web-based genome-wide association study

finding: Variant rs117114042 located near HLA region showed association with IBD with suggestive significance P-value of 4.27×10−5 and was corroborated by general IBD findings.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The intronic SNP rs6927022 in HLA-DQA1 demonstrated genome-wide significance with a P-value of 2.20×10−14, indicating a strong association with UC risk.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The multi-allelic variant rs2308891 located on chromosome 6 showed significant associations, with glutamic acid being notably associated with protective alleles in UC.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The variant rs9269955 influenced amino acid position and showed strong association with a P-value of 5.08×10−12, indicating relevance in peptide binding with implications for UC.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs17878703 was associated with peptide interactions in the binding pocket, showcasing a P-value of 1.99×10−10 and an OR indicating its role in HLA-related UC associations.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs318450 was noted for its association with increased cardiovascular disease risk, impacting autoimmune disease prevalence while demonstrating an inverse relationship with endometrial cancer risk.
title: Mapping inherited genetic variation with opposite effects on autoimmune disease and cancer identifies candidate drug targets associated with the anti-tumor immune response

finding: It was found to have a high posterior probability of causality for height, though previously implicated in type 2 diabetes.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Identified as a putative causal variant for coronary artery disease, also regulating <italic>EDN1</italic> expression.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This variant was significantly associated with RPE+BM thinning, adding to the evidence of AMD risk variants impacting retinal layer thickness.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: Variant rs60707664 on chromosome 6 was significantly associated with dementia progression in PD, indicating an HR of 2.31 and a p-value of 2.44 x 10^-08, hinting at a potential role of the SSR1 gene in the disease's pathology.
title: Association between the LRP1B and APOE loci and the development of Parkinson’s disease dementia

finding: The SNP rs9986596 in the ZKSCAN4 gene was strongly linked to FEV1 percent predicted, FVC, and PEFR (all p value <0.5×10−8) as well as an association with asthma diagnosis.
title: Epidemiology and Genetics of Preserved Ratio Impaired SpiroMetry (PRISm): An Analysis of UK Biobank

finding: This variant in PRDM1 was associated with decreased expression and shorter transcript length, which was linked to higher predicted TNFα levels according to the ML model, suggesting it may reduce the efficacy of BIRB796.
title: Combining explainable machine learning, demographic and multi-omic data to identify precision medicine strategies for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The variant rs9273363 in the HLA-DQB1 region was associated with Type 1 diabetes, showing an OR of 2.1 (p-value <10^-5). It had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.39 in diabetic gastroparesis cases, contrasting with MAFs of 0.22 in idiopathic controls and 0.27 in matched ancestry controls.
title: The role of M1 to M2 macrophage polarization in the etiology of idiopathic gastroparesis: GWAS perspective

finding: The variant rs9275638 was reported as one of the top variants in the diabetic gastroparesis GWAS, indicating its association with the condition.
title: The role of M1 to M2 macrophage polarization in the etiology of idiopathic gastroparesis: GWAS perspective

finding: The SNP rs7773105 was evaluated within the context of HHV7 U14 antibody levels, showing a significant association with multiple sclerosis (MS) risk, with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.562 and P value of 2.175e-05, confirming a reliable causal relationship.
title: Causal Effects of Herpesvirus-Associated Antibodies on Autoimmune neuroinflammatory diseases: Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs805282 displayed a strong association with HHV7 U14 antibody levels and was found to significantly increase MS risk, showcased by an odds ratio (OR) of 4.277 and a P value of 3.911e-12, supporting its role as a reliable finding.
title: Causal Effects of Herpesvirus-Associated Antibodies on Autoimmune neuroinflammatory diseases: Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: In the MVP cohort, SNP rs191786 was associated with a significantly elevated risk of MACE, particularly for homozygous carriers of the C allele, which exhibited an odds ratio of 1.77 with a p-value of 0.049.
title: Investigation of genomic and transcriptomic risk factors in clopidogrel response in African Americans

finding: The variant rs2749010, located on chromosome 6 at position 52761774, was identified as the lead variant associated with GSTA1 in the multi-ancestry meta-analysis. It was marked significantly in association with the protein levels and type 2 diabetes (T2D), with genome-wide significance reported.
title: Circulating proteomic profiles are associated with the onset of type 2 diabetes in a multi-ethnic Asian population – a longitudinal study

finding: This SNP was identified as a strong predictor for FGID status, with each risk allele being associated with a 2.93 times greater likelihood of suffering from FGIDs.
title: Digital Therapeutics Care Utilizing Genetic and Gut Microbiome Signals for the Management of Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders: Results from a Preliminary Retrospective Study

finding: This SNP was also linked to a reduced likelihood of FGID, with an odds ratio of 0.56 for being an IBD sufferer.
title: Digital Therapeutics Care Utilizing Genetic and Gut Microbiome Signals for the Management of Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders: Results from a Preliminary Retrospective Study

finding: In a linear model of reduction in summative FGID symptom severity, each additional risk allele for this SNP was associated with an increase in self-reported symptom severity.
title: Digital Therapeutics Care Utilizing Genetic and Gut Microbiome Signals for the Management of Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders: Results from a Preliminary Retrospective Study

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with an increase in summative and IBS symptom severity but was also indicated in the reduction of constipation symptom severity in certain models.
title: Digital Therapeutics Care Utilizing Genetic and Gut Microbiome Signals for the Management of Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders: Results from a Preliminary Retrospective Study

finding: The lead variant rs2325259 within the BACH2 gene was identified as a novel regulator of hemoglobin switching. It interacted with transcriptional regulation mechanisms associated with NFE2 and NRF2, thereby contributing to fetal hemoglobin (HbF) gene expression.
title: Genetic regulation of fetal hemoglobin across global populations

finding: The SNP rs1010473 was identified in high linkage disequilibrium with rs2325259, positioned within a peak of accessible chromatin in hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells (HSPCs). Its functional impact was demonstrated when deleting the regulatory element led to reduced BACH2 expression, suggesting its role in regulating HbF levels.
title: Genetic regulation of fetal hemoglobin across global populations

finding: Similar to rs1010473, rs1010474 exhibited high linkage disequilibrium with the lead variant rs2325259. It also mapped to a region of accessible chromatin in HSPCs, reinforcing its association with the regulation of BACH2 and HbF levels through genetic perturbations.
title: Genetic regulation of fetal hemoglobin across global populations

finding: The SNP rs67240003, mapping to the gene ZNF184, was associated with both bipolar type I (BDI) and bipolar type II (BDII) disorders. It was identified through a pleioFDR analysis, which indicated significant genetic overlap between the two subtypes of bipolar disorder.
title: Patterns of convergence and divergence between bipolar disorder type I and type II: evidence from integrative genomic analyses

finding: The rs9349379 SNP, located near the PHACTR1 gene, was associated with dicrotic notch physiology, specifically showing that the G allele conferred a higher risk of coronary artery disease but a lower risk of hypertension. In the study, the G allele correlated with lower values of notch smoothness, indicating that hypertension, rather than atherosclerosis, primarily influenced notch smoothness. Additionally, this variant impacted vascular disease risk through the expression of EDN1, which encodes ET-1, a strong vasoconstrictor.
title: Machine Learning to Understand Genetic and Clinical Factors Associated with the Pulse Waveform Dicrotic Notch

finding: This coding SNP in TREM2 was enriched in centenarians and linked to enhanced neuroinflammatory responses, suggesting a protective effect against AD.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: This SNP was identified as the index SNP for severe COVID-19, with a strong association around the HLA-DRB1 gene, indicating a significant genetic link between severe COVID-19 and rheumatoid arthritis (RA). The meta-analysis reported a P-value of 2.43×10^-345.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was found to be the index SNP for COVID-19 hospitalization and was closely linked to the HLA-DRB1 gene, revealing a notable association with RA. The reported P-value was 5.44×10^-567.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP served as the index SNP for SARS-CoV-2 infection, positioning it within a significant genetic region associated with RA, specifically near the HLA-DRB1 gene, with a P-value of 1.49×10^-294.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: For systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), this SNP was associated with severe COVID-19 and was located in the TNXB gene, with a strong P-value of 1.73×10^-69.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was associated with RA and COVID-19 hospitalization, located in the COL11A2 gene, indicating an important genetic connection.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was associated with RA and COVID-19 hospitalization, found in the PSORS1C1 gene, emphasizing its role in the genetic relationship.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was linked to RA and COVID-19 hospitalization within the PSORS1C1 gene, further elucidating the shared genetic basis.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The TREM2 missense single nucleotide variant (SNV) rs75932628 was found to be exome-wide significant in all three models used in the study, indicating a strong association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk.
title: A novel age-informed approach for genetic association analysis in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs11759553 was significantly associated with increased production of HbF and was confirmed to affect HbF levels, accounting for 7% of the variation. It also provided protection from clinical malaria while increasing gametocyte prevalence.
title: Fetal hemoglobin enables malaria parasite growth in sickle cells but augments production of transmission stage parasites

finding: The SNP rs212388 was connected to the gene TAGAP, which has a protective single coding variant against Crohn's Disease (CD), establishing its relevance in the molecular genetics of IBD.
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: The locus chr6:rs1819333 demonstrated a distinction in DAP for CD and UC, having implications for the RNASET2 and CCR6 genes, thus supporting their differential expression roles in various immune populations.
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: The SNP rs62423175 in MTRNR2L9 was associated with various sleep behaviors such as chronotype, duration, daytime napping, daytime sleepiness, snoring, and insomnia. This finding suggested a relationship between genetic predisposition related to sleep disturbances and the risk of esophageal cancer (EAC), providing a rationale to further explore these associations in the context of EAC.
title: Association of Sleep Behaviors with Risk of Esophageal Cancer

finding: The SNP rs12190287 was associated with TCF21, a known regulator of smooth muscle cell (SMC) phenotype transition to fibromyocytes in plaque. It exhibited a strong eQTL effect in coronary arteries, corroborated by evidence from STARNET aorta and GTEx coronary artery samples, linking the mechanistic role of this locus to CAD and blood pressure.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs1535616 was identified as a lead eQTL for the lncRNA TARID. It showed a significant association in GTEx coronary artery samples, highlighting its potential role in gene regulation associated with coronary artery disease and blood pressure traits.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The variant rs75757892 in RREB1 exhibited a notable differential effect on the thickness of the ONL across retinal fields (effect sizes: foveal -1.12, intermediate -0.55, peripheral -0.20) and has associations with various ocular phenotypes.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs375435 in PRPH2 exhibited interaction effects with the VSX2 locus, demonstrating its role in modulating ONL thickness and contributing to retinal degeneration.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs35049516 located in the SUPT3H gene was significantly associated with Hip Shape Mode 4 (HSM4), showing a P value of 4.3×10^-10. This finding was replicated and indicated a narrower femoral neck and larger femoral head. It was also identified as protective against both OA and hip osteoarthritis (HOA), establishing its role in hip morphology.
title: Genome-wide association study of DXA-derived hip morphology identifies associations with 4 loci in Chinese populations

finding: The SNP rs7761119 located near UST was associated with Hip Shape Mode 8 (HSM8) with a P value of 1.7×10^-8. This association was novel and highlighted its role in hip morphology for the first time, suggesting it functions as an eQTL for UST and TAB2.
title: Genome-wide association study of DXA-derived hip morphology identifies associations with 4 loci in Chinese populations

finding: rs13195402 was a substantial finding as the most significant SNP in the extended MHC region, associated with BD with a P-value of 5.8×10^-15. This missense variant was linked to a single association signal across the extended MHC and influenced the understanding of genetic architecture in BD.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: The SNP rs1541269 emerged as the most significant variant in the classical MHC region, associated with BD at a P-value of 6.71×10^-12. Its association was influenced by linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs13195402, resulting in implications for identifying causal variants within the MHC for bipolar disorder.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: The SNP rs557011 reached genome-wide significance (p=3.1E-05) in association with tuberculosis, replicating findings from previous studies that identified this variant as a risk factor.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The SNP rs9271378 was found to be genome-wide significant (p=8.5E-06) in the context of tuberculosis, corroborating earlier research linking it with the disease.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The SNP rs9272785 also reached genome-wide significance (p<5E-08) in this study, affirming previous associations of this variant with tuberculosis risk.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: In a GWAS involving self-reported positive TB test results, rs2894257 was found to be genome-wide significant (p=2.6E-02), consistent with earlier findings linking it to tuberculosis.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The SNP rs9391858 was identified as a lead variant closest to the gene C6orf10 in the HLA locus with significant association with tuberculosis (p<5E-08), marking it as a key genetic risk factor.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The SNP rs33915496 was found in the HLA locus and was genome-wide significant (p<5E-08) in the context of tuberculosis, highlighting its contribution to an individual's risk for the disease.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: For respiratory TB, rs2395516 was found to be genome-wide significant (p=4.5E-09) within the HLA locus, indicating its role as a genetic risk factor specific to this type of TB.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The study validated previous associations for the SNP rs17425622 within the HLA locus in relation to PD. The details of the association's strength and significance were consistent with prior findings, although precise statistical values for this SNP were not explicitly stated in the provided text.
title: Fine mapping of the HLA locus in Parkinson’s disease in Europeans

finding: Similar to rs17425622, the SNP rs2395163 was also validated for its association with PD, aligning with previous studies. Specific statistical parameters were not provided in the text for this SNP.
title: Fine mapping of the HLA locus in Parkinson’s disease in Europeans

finding: The non-coding SNP rs3129882 was implicated in previous studies as affecting expression in HLA-DRA and was mentioned in the current study for its association with PD. The variant is noted to drive the association, although further analysis is needed to clarify its precise role, as the main findings focus on amino acid changes within other HLA genes.
title: Fine mapping of the HLA locus in Parkinson’s disease in Europeans

finding: The SNP rs9275326 was validated in association with PD during the analysis, consistent with earlier studies. However, no detailed statistical metrics were provided for this specific SNP.
title: Fine mapping of the HLA locus in Parkinson’s disease in Europeans

finding: The SNP rs9470000 was identified in African Americans as a novel association and was part of this significant analysis of pain intensity.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: In 6q14.2, rs2207944 showed associations with snoring and eye retinal metrics, illustrating genetic influences on sleep traits.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: The variant rs7752421 in 6q14.2 linked innately with cognitive abilities and sleep traits, revealing its significance in genetic evaluations.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: The SNP rs9321878 was found to be located within an intron of the gene HIVEP2 at locus 6q24.2. It was identified as a regulatory SNP associated with the expression of differentially expressed EV transcripts in the context of obesity and type 2 diabetes (T2D). Hi-C contact analyses indicated that rs9321878 is part of a regulatory element interacting with the neighboring gene PEX3. Furthermore, knockout experiments of PEX3 in a murine model produced a classic metabolic phenotype, indicating a functional relevance of this SNP to metabolic regulation.
title: The extracellular vesicle transcriptome provides tissue-specific functional genomic annotation relevant to disease susceptibility in obesity

finding: The SNP rs28895246 in the HLA region was strongly correlated with mumps-specific IFNγ secretion (p-value=8.97E-14), indicating its significant influence on cytokine responses after vaccination.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: The SNP rs9268839 was associated with IL-2 secretion (p-value=1.11E-16) in the HLA region, demonstrating its importance in regulating immune responses to mumps.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: The rs11152952 variant, part of the colocalization with migraine in the 6q16.1 region, was associated with functional connectivity characteristics within the default mode network during resting fMRI.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The SNP rs7773324 was identified as the top lead SNP for the gene IRF4, showing significant associations with OCC as well as high CADD and regulomeDB scores, indicating its important regulatory role.
title: Integrated multi-omics data analysis identifies a novel genetics-risk gene of IRF4 associated with prognosis of oral cavity cancer

finding: The SNP rs130067, associated with CCHCR1, showed significant interaction with CMB 216 in contributing to NADT response. Its impact was confirmed in the analysis of patient data.
title: AI-Powered cellular morphometric biomarkers discovered in needle biopsy of prostatic cancer predict neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy response and prognosis: an international multicenter retrospective study

finding: The SNP rs217291 was associated with schizophrenia (SCZ) through developmental expression of the isoform ENST00000519133, which is an isoform of SNAP91. This association was statistically significant with an adjusted P-value of 6.06 x 10^-7. The SNP is located within the gene body and may affect processes such as clathrin and phosphatidylinositol binding, impacting synaptic development.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: The SNP rs10455872 found in the SLC22A3/LPA locus was determined to significantly affect relative (logarithmic) biomarker change in LDL-C response to statins, demonstrating a beta of -0.148 (p-value = 5.07e-16). This represented a novel association identified in lipid response to statins.
title: Leveraging large-scale biobank EHRs to enhance pharmacogenetics of cardiometabolic disease medications

finding: The SNP rs9274477 was associated with the meQTL for HLA-DQB1, appearing in both neutrophils and naive CD4+ T cells from lupus patients, signifying a shared genetic influence on epigenetic changes within the disease context.
title: Hypomethylation of miR-17-92 cluster in lupus T cells and no significant role for genetic factors in the lupus-associated DNA methylation signature

finding: The rs12203592 variant in the IRF4 gene was associated with an increased effect size for SCC risk in SOTRs compared to the non-transplant population. While no specific fold increase was noted in the results, it contributed to the overall increased risk for SCC in SOTRs and was included in the re-weighted PRS for risk stratification.
title: Re-weighting MC1R, ASIP and IRF4 risk variants optimises polygenic risk scores for keratinocyte cancer stratification in solid organ transplant recipients

finding: The variant rs143334143:A in the MHC region was linked with COVID-19 severity, demonstrating a MAF of 7%, with an OR of 1.32, and a significant p-value of 3×10^-4 for comparisons between COVID-19 severe cases and negative or unknown controls.
title: Common genetic variants identify targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: The SNP rs1063478 in the HLA-DMA gene was linked with better treatment outcomes in chronic hepatitis C virus infection and was associated with various cancers, underscoring its relevance in cancer prognosis and susceptibility.
title: Gene-based Hardy–Weinberg equilibrium test using genotype count data identifies novel cancer-related genes

finding: rs12206298 was found to be intronic to ANKS1A on chromosome 6, and it had a suggestive association in celiac disease with a p-value of 4.1 × 10-7. After conditional association, it passed the genome-wide significance threshold with a p-value of 4.9 × 10-8.
title: Joint analysis reveals shared autoimmune disease associations and identifies common mechanisms

finding: rs4713844 was identified as a second independent effect in the locus related to celiac disease. It showed a strong p-value of 9.9 × 10-8, indicating significant relevance to disease susceptibility.
title: Joint analysis reveals shared autoimmune disease associations and identifies common mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs13191376 in the RUNX2 gene showed a significantly pleiotropic association with CCT in European ancestry participants using CAGE eQTL data. Additionally, this SNP was associated with CCT in a cross-ancestry GWAS, indicating its potential importance in influencing CCT.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis identified genes pleiotropically associated with central corneal thickness

finding: The SNP rs3765467 showed a statistically significant interaction with baseline weight among GLP1-RA users, leading to an average weight change of 0.09 kg from baseline, with a significance level of P = 2.7 × 10^-4.
title: Association between plausible genetic factors and weight loss from GLP1-RA and bariatric surgery: a multi-ancestry study in 10 960 individuals from 9 biobanks

finding: The SNP rs6923761 presented a nominally significant interaction with baseline weight in the context of GLP1-RA treatment, resulting in a weight change of 0.02 kg, with P = 0.01.
title: Association between plausible genetic factors and weight loss from GLP1-RA and bariatric surgery: a multi-ancestry study in 10 960 individuals from 9 biobanks

finding: The variant rs9388010, which was an intergenic variant within the GJA1 gene, was discovered to be associated with pulse rate in Africans. This gene has been linked to various cardiomyopathies. The frequency of rs9388010 was significantly higher in Africans (0.54) compared to Europeans (0.1), indicating trans-ancestral variations in cardiovascular traits.
title: Distinct Genetic Loci and Variations in Blood Pressure and Pulse Rate in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank

finding: The rs7750412 variant, located in an intergenic region within the ZBTB9 gene, was found to have a significantly higher frequency in Europeans (0.80) compared to Africans (0.25). This variant was associated with pulse rate in Europeans, showcasing the presence of differing genetic factors influencing cardiovascular traits in each ancestry group.
title: Distinct Genetic Loci and Variations in Blood Pressure and Pulse Rate in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank

finding: The rs196023 variant, an intron and non-coding variant located in the CASC15 gene at the 6p22.3 locus, was identified as the most likely causal variant for diastolic blood pressure in Europeans. It had not previously been linked to this trait but was associated with various cardiovascular traits including systolic blood pressure.
title: Distinct Genetic Loci and Variations in Blood Pressure and Pulse Rate in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank

finding: rs762216297 was associated with colorectal cancer (CRC) risk, identified as one of the strongest SNPs in the DEPTH analysis within the HLA locus at 6p21, consistently significant across both CCFR and GECCO datasets.
title: Using DEPendency of association on the number of Top Hits (DEPTH) as a complementary tool to identify novel risk loci in colorectal cancer

finding: Similar to rs762216297, rs149490268 was found to be significantly associated with CRC risk in the HLA region at 6p21, showing consistent significance in both CCFR and GECCO studies.
title: Using DEPendency of association on the number of Top Hits (DEPTH) as a complementary tool to identify novel risk loci in colorectal cancer

finding: This SNP was also among the strongly associated SNPs identified in the DEPTH analysis for CRC at the HLA locus, showing consistent significance across both data sets.
title: Using DEPendency of association on the number of Top Hits (DEPTH) as a complementary tool to identify novel risk loci in colorectal cancer

finding: rs199707618 was identified as a significant risk SNP for CRC in the DEPTH analysis, contributing to the risk in the same HLA region as previously discussed, with consistent significance in the analyzed datasets.
title: Using DEPendency of association on the number of Top Hits (DEPTH) as a complementary tool to identify novel risk loci in colorectal cancer

finding: This SNP was identified as the main associated SNP for CRC risk in the GECCO data set, and it was consistently significant within the categorized HLA risk region.
title: Using DEPendency of association on the number of Top Hits (DEPTH) as a complementary tool to identify novel risk loci in colorectal cancer

finding: The top eQTL interaction for a gene in dendritic cells was identified with rs199659767, where the minor allele C was associated with significant changes in the expression of Zinc Finger Protein 57 (ZPF57).
title: History of tuberculosis disease is associated with genetic regulatory variation in Peruvians

finding: The lead variant rs202030113 was associated with atrial fibrillation, located in the intronic region of SYNE1, and predicted to cause a splice donor loss. It was linked to defects in nuclear morphology, myoblast differentiation, myogenic progenitor cell fate, and heart development, affecting the nuclear envelope protein complex contributing to atrial arrhythmogenesis.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: Variant rs1759628 showed a positive association with increased height and was linked to the HMGA1 gene, which is related to metabolic syndrome and could implicate metabolic pathways in atrial fibrillation.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: The variant rs6913361 was associated with body mass index (BMI), influencing the metabolic syndrome pathway linked to atrial fibrillation, given its proximity to the HMGA1 gene.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: This intronic variant in MLN was identified as novel and associated with AUD. The gene has been previously associated with smoking and depression, connecting its functional implications to alcohol use.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: This variant near CDC5L demonstrated a significant association with AUD, underlining the genetic complexity of alcohol use disorder.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: The SNP rs13197633 was identified as associated with anti-VZV IgG level in both the current study and a previous genome-wide association study (GWAS). It was noted that this SNP contributed to the variation in humoral immune response to VZV, which relates to the immune response to infections.
title: Exploring the possible causal role of the immune response to varicella-zoster virus on multiple traits: a phenome-wide Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs56401801 was associated with anti-VZV IgG level in both this study and earlier research. This finding indicated its relevance in modulating the immune response against VZV.
title: Exploring the possible causal role of the immune response to varicella-zoster virus on multiple traits: a phenome-wide Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs13204572 showed consistent association with anti-VZV IgG levels across the previous GWAS and this study, signifying its role in influencing immune responses to VZV.
title: Exploring the possible causal role of the immune response to varicella-zoster virus on multiple traits: a phenome-wide Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1048381 was identified in both the current study and a previous GWAS as influencing anti-VZV IgG levels, providing evidence for its role in the humoral immune response against this virus.
title: Exploring the possible causal role of the immune response to varicella-zoster virus on multiple traits: a phenome-wide Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs9380142 was identified as positively associated with severe COVID-19 with an OR of 1.09 in this analysis, which was less than the OR of 1.3 reported by Pairo-Castineira et al. This SNP is associated with the 3p21.31 locus.
title: Genetic associations with severe COVID-19

finding: SNP rs9375066 was also identified in the AFR population with a significant association to Pulse Rate (p=1.4 x 10^-10), establishing it as both a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: SNP rs143362094 was replicated in the AFR population from the EUR cohort, showing a strong association for cardiovascular traits (AFR MTAG p=2.8 x 10^-10). This established it as a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: SNP rs57182997 demonstrated a significant association with cardiovascular traits in both EUR and AFR populations, marking it as a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: SNP rs9482195 was shown to be significantly associated with cardiovascular traits across populations (AFR p=7.1 x 10^-09), confirming its status as both a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: SNP rs9388008, linked with various cardiovascular traits including heart rate, was confirmed as a significant finding in both cohorts, thereby considered a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: SNP rs2267666 exhibited significant frequency differences in the EUR population, recognized as a positive and original finding within cardiovascular trait associations.
