title: Prelude to Malignancy: A Gene Expression Signature in Normal Mammary Gland from Breast Cancer Patients Suggests Pre-tumorous Alterations and Is Associated with Adverse Outcomes

finding: For rs1050379, the research identified that a significant number of white/European individuals were heterozygous for this variant. The frequency of heterozygous individuals was examined concerning the exome target capture kit used, showing a significant association with cancer subtype, thus indicating its relevance in the context of cancer susceptibility.
title: Detecting oncogenic selection through biased allele retention in The Cancer Genome Atlas

finding: The SNP rs9273363 showed association with type 1 diabetes (T1D) in both imputed datasets, confirming its role as a significant locus for this disease as previously reported.
title: Advantages of genotype imputation with ethnically matched reference panel for rare variant association analyses

finding: The A allele at the intronic variant rs72928038 was found to increase the risk for multiple sclerosis (MS) and Type 1 diabetes (T1D). This allele was confidently colocalised with regulatory quantitative trait loci (QTLs), including an expression QTL (eQTL) that decreases gene expression, splicing QTL (psiQTL), and histone modification QTLs. The locus showed significant chromatin interaction with the promoter of the BACH2 gene, indicating its regulatory potential.
title: Genetic associations at regulatory phenotypes improve fine-mapping of causal variants for twelve immune-mediated diseases

finding: The rs2842980 variant created a canonical AUUAAA PAS site, leading to an increased length of the 3' UTR of the SOD2 gene. This variant was found in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs2842992, which had been associated with a higher risk of atrophic macular degeneration.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs2153960, located in an intron of the FOXO3 gene, was associated with logBMI through significant GxE interactions, evidenced by a p-value of 6.5 × 10⁻⁹. This finding was particularly relevant as FOXO3 has been linked to insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF-I) concentrations, a key mediator of metabolic effects.
title: Gene-environment interactions using a Bayesian whole genome regression model

finding: The SNP rs1800562, also known as Cys282Tyr, was associated with reduced putamen volume and altered T2star signal in the striatum. It was implicated in iron regulation and transport, contributing to hemochromatosis, a condition accounting for approximately 85% of cases.
title: Identifying genetic variants associated with cerebellar volume in 33,265 individuals from the UK-Biobank

finding: This novel variant in LPA showed significant association with LDL-C levels in the discovery phase (p = 6.55×10−29) and replicated with a p-value of 1.83×10−03. The study suggested that alcohol consumption may modify the LDL-C levels related to this variant.
title: Role of Rare and Low Frequency Variants in Gene-Alcohol Interactions on Plasma Lipid Levels

finding: This variant, which is a repeat mention of rs1210693, was also linked to heart rate (P = 1.6 x 10^-9) and formed a loop to the promoter region of GJA1.
title: Detailed Regulatory Interaction Map of the Human Heart Facilitates Gene Discovery for Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The novel SNP HFE E168Q (rs146519482) was identified as associated with hereditary hemochromatosis. It was determined to result in loss of HFE function by disrupting the interaction with TfR1, leading to its reclassification as a pathogenic variant according to ACMG guidelines. This SNP also contributed to the understanding of disease manifestations related to H63D.
title: A rare variant on a common risk haplotype of HFE causes increased risk of hereditary hemochromatosis

finding: This SNP was uniquely associated with the joint analyses of MS-UC and was reported to overlap with MS-CD in different effect directions.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: This SNP overlapped between the analyses of MS-UC and MS-CD, although it exhibited different effect directions, indicating contrasting genetic pathways.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: The SNP rs3135388, located in the HLA locus, showed significant allele frequency differences primarily driven by the Italy_IA_Romans, who had the lowest frequency of the effective alleles among all 1st millennium BCE groups. This finding suggested a decrease in allele frequencies throughout Roman domination in the Italian peninsula, indicating a homogenizing effect.
title: The Genomic portrait of the Picene culture: new insights into the Italic Iron Age and the legacy of the Roman expansion in Central Italy

finding: The SNP rs2395182, found on HLA-DRA, also exhibited significant allele frequency differences. Similar to rs3135388, it reflected a trend of decreased effective allele frequencies in Italian populations during Roman rule, suggesting a genetic impact of Romanization across the Italian peninsula.
title: The Genomic portrait of the Picene culture: new insights into the Italic Iron Age and the legacy of the Roman expansion in Central Italy

finding: The SNP rs3757247 was associated with type 1 diabetes and its long-term complications, suggesting a potential link to autoimmune processes that could intersect with conditions like Crohn's Disease.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SOD2 rs4880 polymorphism did not confer risk for COVID-19 but affected inflammation or coagulation parameters, hinting at its role in inflammatory responses which may be relevant in Crohn's disease pathology.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs912056, located on human chromosome 6, was linked to fat distribution traits through GWAS studies implicating the gene LY86 as causative. A cluster 5 DInt was observed between the homologous mouse region and the promoter of Rreb1, which showed significant up-regulation during adipocyte differentiation. Therefore, RREB1 was suggested as a better candidate for the association with fat distribution traits.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: The SNP rs730775 was associated with a regulatory network linking to NFKBIE and NFKB1, pathways previously reported in a two-step approach by Hawe et al. The study derived novel insights by enhancing previously identified connections and introducing new CpG-related gene patterns.
title: Network reconstruction for trans acting genetic loci using multi-omics data and prior information

finding: The SNP rs9274623 was confirmed as a cis-eQTL for genes connected in the context of schizophrenia, showing associations with RNF5 and PBX2, revealing novel interactions with transcription factors implicated in neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Network reconstruction for trans acting genetic loci using multi-omics data and prior information

finding: The SNP rs3132947 was noted for its linkage with RNF5 expression, reinforcing its role in schizophrenia susceptibility through its interaction with other genetic loci within the HLA region.
title: Network reconstruction for trans acting genetic loci using multi-omics data and prior information

finding: The rs400063 variant showed effects on both mean and variability of the RNASET2 gene in T cells treated with PHA plus dexamethasone, illustrating contrasting directions of influence.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The variant rs116611418 exhibited significant genetic effects on the expression of the HLA-DRB5 gene across three pseudotime tertiles, demonstrating a distinct expression pattern associated with asthma.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The NOTCH4/rs367398 variant was significantly associated with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) with a p-value of 0.00576 and an Odds Ratio (OR) of 5.1. It was the only variant in the study that passed multiple test corrections with a Bonferroni p-value of 0.02305. This finding is consistent with previous studies reporting significant associations of this variant with the AD phenotype.
title: Targeted Sequencing of Alzheimer’s Disease Genes in Gujarat Cohort

finding: The variant rs72928038 was identified as a significant causal variant affecting BACH2 expression in T cells. It was associated with multiple autoimmune diseases, including type 1 diabetes (T1D), rheumatoid arthritis (RA), and multiple sclerosis (MS). Base editing of this variant in a human T cell line led to reduced BACH2 expression. Additionally, deletion of the corresponding genomic region in mice (Bach2<sup>18del</sup>) resulted in reduced BACH2 expression and decreased transcriptional features associated with T cell stemness.
title: Prioritization of autoimmune disease-associated genetic variants that perturb regulatory element activity in T cells

finding: The rs6917676 T2D risk allele (T) was linked to increased accessibility of an ER stress-responsive cis-regulatory element (CRE) in islets, leading to enhanced expression of the gene MAP3K5. This gene promoted beta cell apoptosis in response to ER stress, suggesting the T allele contributes to T2D risk by increasing islet dysfunction.
title: Comparative Multi-omic Mapping of Human Pancreatic Islet Endoplasmic Reticulum and Cytokine Stress Responses Provides Insights into Type 2 Diabetes Genetics

finding: The SNP rs1334706 was identified as being associated with schizophrenia (SZ) as it was linked to a risk allele that contributed to a diagnosis of SZ. The study also indicated that individuals with this allele showed hyperactivity in the superior temporal sulcus (STS) during emotionally neutral face perception, which may relate to the social cognitive impairments observed in SZ.
title: Oxytocin and vasopressin 1a receptor alterations in the superior temporal sulcus and hypothalamus in schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs1800562 showed a highly significant association with liver iron levels, correlating strongly with known traits.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs1799945 indicated a robust association with liver iron traits, confirming its relevance in related metabolic processes.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The GGE test detected rs4947296 on chromosome 6, which is mapped to RNU6-1133P and C6orf15 genes. These genes are associated with LDL, triglyceride, and total cholesterol levels, although the SNP itself was not directly associated with lipid phenotypes.
title: A multivariate approach to joint testing of main genetic and gene-environment interaction effects

finding: The SNP rs9469982 was identified as a genetic variant that controlled the expression level of the gene DEF6, associated with asthma risk. This variant fell within a chromatin accessibility peak bound by the response transcription factor SOX8, which demonstrated significantly increased binding affinity for the alternative allele compared to the reference allele. Additionally, chromatin accessibility in T cells increased in response to LPS+DEX treatment, supporting the link between this SNP and asthma pathology.
title: Functional characterization of eQTLs and asthma risk loci with scATAC-seq across immune cell types and contexts

finding: The DAV rs9368977, located in the SCZ-associated locus 6p21.2, was found to increase MPRA activity and disrupt the binding motifs for SP3 and KLF4; it is linked to chromosome 6 open reading frame 89 (C6orf89) and displays eQTL behavior.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: The variant rs6912602 was marked as one of the most differentially active SNPs leading to a significant decrease in expression of peptidylprolyl isomerase like 1 (PPIL1), which has implications in neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: The alternative allele of rs1343025 was associated with increased expression of vascular endothelial growth factor A (VEGFA), a gene controversially linked to SCZ.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: The G177D variant in TBXT was strongly associated with the predisposition to chordoma, a rare spinal cancer. Although its mechanism of action in disease pathogenesis remained unknown, its association emphasized the relevance of TBXT mutations in cancer predisposition.
title: An efficient and adaptable workflow for editing disease-relevant single nucleotide variants using CRISPR/Cas9

finding: The SNP rs2076295 was identified as a functional variant that regulated desmoplakin (DSP) expression in airway epithelial cells. This finding indicates a potential role of DSP as a key player in fibroplasia and fibrotic diseases, possibly contributing to the exaggerated fibrogenesis observed in conditions associated with DSP mutations.
title: Desmoplakin mutations in cardiac fibroblasts cause TGFβ1-mediated pathological fibrogenesis in desmoplakin cardiomyopathy via beclin-1 regulation

finding: The SNP rs2275913, associated with IL-17A polymorphism, was found to be linked to the pathogenesis of preeclampsia (PE) in Chinese patients. This finding indicated that variations in the IL-17A gene could alter the immune response, potentially contributing to the development of PE, which is characterized by an inflammatory profile and immune dysregulation in the placenta.
title: Unveiling the Crucial Role of Pro-inflammatory Macrophages in the Immune Network Imbalance of the maternal-fetal interface with Preeclampsia

finding: SNP rs174399 was identified as the top eQTL for the HERV LTR25_6q21. It was linked to a risk variant at this locus, rs11153302. This SNP was noted for its differential expression, where the risk (G-) allele was associated with a reduced expression of LTR25_6q21 in patients, despite the HERV being upregulated in schizophrenia cases.
title: Schizophrenia risk from locus-specific human endogenous retroviruses

finding: The rs339331 SNP at the RFX6/6q22 locus was identified as robustly associated with an increased risk of prostate cancer (PCa) across multiple diverse populations in a phenome-wide analysis using data from the FinnGen cohort. The T risk allele of rs339331 was found to enhance androgen receptor (AR) chromatin occupancy in PCa tumors, leading to increased expression of the RFX6 gene. Furthermore, high levels of RFX6 expression correlated with adverse clinical outcomes such as PCa recurrence and metastasis, underscoring its importance as a potential biomarker for PCa severity and treatment response.
title: RFX6 at locus 6q22 confers metastasis and drug resistance in prostate cancer

finding: Associated with both SLE and rheumatoid arthritis, rs3101018 demonstrated 1.7-fold stronger enhancer activity for the reference 'C' allele compared to the risk 'T' allele, correlating with higher C4A expression.
title: Genome-wide discovery of SLE genetic risk variant allelic enhancer activity

finding: The study associated the SNP rs13205171 with variations in patient response to CAR T-cell therapy when combined with dexamethasone. It was determined that this SNP influenced the critical threshold of tolerable dexamethasone concentration, affecting CAR T-cell efficacy in glioblastoma treatment.
title: Dose-dependent thresholds of dexamethasone destabilize CAR T-cell treatment efficacy

finding: The SNP rs3088442 was associated with susceptibility to Type 2 Diabetes within the context of polymorphic variants in the OCT3 gene, indicating a potential role of this genetic variant in the disease's pathophysiology.
title: Structural basis of organic cation transporter-3 inhibition

finding: Similar to rs3088442, the SNP rs2292334 was linked to increased susceptibility against Type 2 Diabetes, emphasizing interactions between these polymorphic variants in the OCT3 gene and their impact on the condition.
title: Structural basis of organic cation transporter-3 inhibition

finding: The SNP rs2859338, found in the 3' regulatory region of the EDN1 gene, demonstrated different luciferase activities based on genotype. Particularly, the homozygous G/G genotype exhibited an increase in expression compared to the A/A genotype. Although VDR was hypothesized to bind to this region, the analysis showed it does not bind at rs2859338.
title: Common variation in EDN1 regulatory regions highlights the role of PPARγ as a key regulator of Endothelin in vitro

finding: The SNP rs10080242 was implicated in the tumor microenvironment characteristics of epithelial ovarian cancer in relation to immunotherapy responses. It was shown to affect the behavior and dynamics of tumor-associated macrophages, indicating a link with therapeutic targeting approaches in ovarian cancer treatment.
title: Targeting LxCxE cleft pocket of retinoblastoma protein in M2 macrophages inhibits ovarian cancer progression

finding: The A allele of rs3891176 showed a strong positive selection, with a selection coefficient of s=4.5%. Its frequency increased from approximately 0% to about 20% over the last 4000 years, significantly correlating with increased susceptibility to celiac disease or gluten sensitivity.
title: Pervasive findings of directional selection realize the promise of ancient DNA to elucidate human adaptation

finding: Positive selection was confirmed at rs3135388, with the A allele rising from approximately 0% to 18% between 6000 and 2000 years ago (s=4.0%). This allele is linked to the risk factor for multiple sclerosis, and the study indicated stronger selection in north Europe compared to southwest Europe.
title: Pervasive findings of directional selection realize the promise of ancient DNA to elucidate human adaptation

finding: Positive selection was observed at rs1800562 from approximately 5000 to 2000 years ago, with frequency rising from about 1% to 5% (s=2.9%). The allele was associated with pathogenic iron buildup in cells; however, the frequency declined to about 3% subsequently.
title: Pervasive findings of directional selection realize the promise of ancient DNA to elucidate human adaptation

finding: The SNP rs824382 completed the association profile contributing to modifications on motor onset in Huntington's disease.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: SNP rs12203592, linked to IRF4, was noted for regulating Th cell responses and mucosal cytokines, indicating its potential in immune regulation in acute GVHD.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The HLA-DQB1 rs41552812 variant was found to be present in a notable portion of the Serbian population, impacting the pathogenesis and severity of pulmonary sarcoidosis, which significantly affects the lungs and other organs. Its association with neuro-ophthalmologic lesions in Serbian patients may reflect specific genetic contrasts with other European populations, highlighting its importance in the unique genomic landscape of Serbia.
title: The first insight into the genetic structure of the population of modern Serbia

finding: This intergenic variant between HLA-A and HLA-W showed a rapid decrease in frequency starting around 8,000 years ago, indicating strong selection against certain immune responses.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: Found within the HLA region, this SNP associated with psoriasis risk demonstrated a gradual increase in frequency beginning around 4,000 years ago, highlighting its relevance in autoimmune conditions.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: This intronic SNP within CDKAL1 was associated with 11 intronic fragments that interacted with the CDKAL1 promoter, while also having long-range interactions with SOX4, involved in IL17A production and skin inflammation.
title: Chromatin-based techniques map DNA interaction landscapes in psoriasis susceptibility loci and highlight KLF4 as a target gene in 9q31

finding: The IL-17 gene variant rs763780 was investigated and identified as relevant to behavioral responses seen in drug disorders, adding additional evidence connecting inflammatory pathways to behavioral temperament in both the rat models and human patients.
title: Bioenergetic-Related Gene Expression in the Hippocampus Predicts Internalizing vs. Externalizing Behavior in a F2 Cross of Selectively-Bred Rats

finding: The SNP rs2854277 was indicated to have attenuated associations between self-reported physical activity and overall lung cancer, adenocarcinoma, and lung cancer in never smokers when removed in leave-one-out analyses, suggesting potential pleiotropy.
title: Physical activity and risk of lung cancer: a two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs2763979 was associated with GWAS results indicating links to cancer and systemic lupus erythematosus, marking it as a significant genetic variant.
title: Profiling genetically driven alternative splicing across the Indonesian Archipelago

finding: The fine-mapped variant rs9294987 was associated with systolic blood pressure in the UK Biobank, showing a PIP of 0.48. Its activating allele alone produced a minimal increase in transcription (delta log2 activity of 0.09), but when paired with another variant, it contributed to a substantial transcriptional boost.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: Similar to rs9294987, the rs9294988 variant was linked to systolic blood pressure and had a PIP of 0.39. Its individual effect on transcription was also minimal (delta log2 activity of 0.20), but it interacted with rs9294987 to significantly enhance transcription.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: The SNP rs79220007 in HFE demonstrated a significant association with PV, with a p-value of 1.42E-14. It was highlighted that this SNP is in very high linkage disequilibrium with rs1800562, which is associated with the C282Y mutation causing hemochromatosis, directly linking iron metabolism to the pathogenesis of PV.
title: Iron homeostasis governs erythroid phenotype in Polycythemia Vera

finding: The SNP rs1800562, known for causing the C282Y mutation linked to Type I Hemochromatosis, was found to have an increased association with PV under a recessive model (p-value 2.63E-26). The association indicated that homozygous AA genotype individuals had 12.58 times higher odds of developing PV compared to other genotypes, emphasizing the role of iron regulation in PV.
title: Iron homeostasis governs erythroid phenotype in Polycythemia Vera

finding: The SNP rs13198474 at 6p22.2 was linked to multiple non-FA measures in white matter microstructure, showcasing its broad effects.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The SNP rs141826798, which is a stop-gained variant in the gene EGFL8, was reported to co-segregate in a family with cholesteatoma. This gene is previously linked to psoriasis, an inflammatory skin disorder, which shares the characteristic of abnormal epithelial growth with cholesteatoma.
title: Whole exome sequencing study identifies candidate loss of function variants and locus heterogeneity in familial cholesteatoma

finding: The SNP rs4959783 was identified as an sQTL for the gene PSMG4 and was reported to disrupt binding sites for the RNA-binding protein RBFOX2. This finding highlighted the role of rs4959783 in modulating splicing mechanisms via RBP interactions.
title: Identification and analysis of splicing quantitative trait loci across multiple tissues in the human genome

finding: Lastly, rs9474033 presented associations with various traits, indicating its contribution to metabolic pathways influenced by gut microbiome variations.
title: Large-scale association analyses identify host factors influencing human gut microbiome composition

finding: The SNP rs75932628, encoding TREM2 p.R47H, was observed to have a significant association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) after stringent quality control measures were applied. This variant is well-established in the literature as being linked to AD, which indicates its important role in the disease pathology.
title: Identification of novel Alzheimer’s disease genes co-expressed with TREM2

finding: The SNP rs1247559 was linked to aggressive periodontitis in European ancestry individuals. This association was reported in multiple genome-wide association studies and confirmed in a separate cohort, reinforcing its role as a genetic risk factor for severe forms of periodontal disease.
title: Fibrin is a critical regulator of neutrophil effector function at mucosal barrier sites

finding: The SNP rs2465836 was identified as the lead SNP associated with severe periodontitis with a gene-centric p-value of 4.2×10−4. It was part of a collection of PLG polymorphisms that indicated a strong association with clinical parameters of periodontal disease.
title: Fibrin is a critical regulator of neutrophil effector function at mucosal barrier sites

finding: The SNP rs4252200 served as the lead marker associated with high levels of colonization of the periodontal microbe Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans, which is connected with aggressive periodontitis. A significant gene-centric p-value of 1.3×10−3 was noted, supporting its relevance in periodontal disease.
title: Fibrin is a critical regulator of neutrophil effector function at mucosal barrier sites

finding: The SNP rs13215408 was reported as a significant finding associated with the epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition in colorectal cancer, linking it to increased migration and invasion potential in circulating tumor cell lines. Its role in modulating EpCAM expression provided insights into the molecular mechanisms behind epithelial cancer progression.
title: An EpCAM/Trop2 mechanostat differentially regulates individual and collective migration of human carcinoma cells

finding: The SNP rs11156429 was found to be the most significantly associated variant with male puberty timing (P=3.5×10−52) and was located in or near the gene LIN28B, consistent with findings in both men and women regarding puberty timing.
title: Expanded genomic analyses for male voice-breaking highlights a shared phenotypic and genetic basis between puberty timing and hair colour

finding: This SNP showed significant heterogeneity between sexes, with the allele conferring earlier puberty timing in males while delaying it in females. It was previously reported with a beta of -0.064 years/allele for voice breaking in males and 0.059 years/allele for menarche in females.
title: Expanded genomic analyses for male voice-breaking highlights a shared phenotypic and genetic basis between puberty timing and hair colour

finding: The missense variant rs12210538/M409T within the SLC22A16 gene was associated with variability in the levels of RBC free and acetyl-carnitine, establishing a clear metabolic link to this transporter.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: In research, this SNP was used to predict maize yield at an early developmental stage, utilizing both multispectral images and genotype data to facilitate preliminary hybrid selection.
title: Deep Learning-Based High-Throughput Phenotyping Of Maize (Zea mays L.) Tasseling From Uas Imagery Across Environments

finding: This SNP played a role in corn grain yield prediction and mapping through analysis of multispectral imagery collected via unmanned aerial systems.
title: Deep Learning-Based High-Throughput Phenotyping Of Maize (Zea mays L.) Tasseling From Uas Imagery Across Environments

finding: In the GWAS-MA of ADHD across the lifespan, rs183882582 was identified as the most significantly associated locus on chromosome 6, with an odds ratio of 1.43 and a P-value of 1.57E-08, establishing its significance.
title: Shared genetic background between children and adults with attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder

finding: The variant rs12197454 was part of the credible set for rs183882582 and was associated with the expression of RSPH3, indicating its relevance in the study of ADHD.
title: Shared genetic background between children and adults with attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder

finding: The association between rs2274911 (p.Pro91Ser) in GPRC6A and prostate cancer was confirmed with statistical significance (p=8.2×10⁻⁸, OR=1.12, 95% CI: 1.07-1.17). It was noted to be in linkage disequilibrium with another previously associated variant.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: Located in BACH2, this SNP was suggested to impact expression regulation through interaction with rs56148686, linking it to oxidative stress responses relevant in Alzheimer’s pathology.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: This SNP was suspected to interact with rs9344977 in post-transcriptional regulation, implicating it in the oxidative stress response, potentially affecting AD progression.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs75688122 was associated with cocaine dependence, located within the first intron of the RIMS2 gene. CaptureSeq detected multiple novel splice isoforms of RIMS2, including three highly conserved internal exons that were predicted to collectively add 56 amino acids to the RIMS2 protein, with the first novel internal exon including a start codon.
title: Targeted, High-resolution RNA Sequencing of Non-coding Genomic Regions Associated with Neuropsychiatric Functions

finding: The V288V polymorphism (rs8192620) in the TAAR1 gene was associated with increased TAAR1 protein expression in participants with active methamphetamine dependence. Specifically, it was noted that those with at least one copy of the V288V variant exhibited a greater craving response for methamphetamine, with estimated cravings 1.55 times higher for the MA-ACT group and 1.77 times higher for the MA-REM group compared to individuals without the SNP.
title: Trace amine-associated receptor gene polymorphism increases drug craving

finding: The SNP rs13194864 was associated with variations in the AXL receptor, which was found to play a crucial role in cancer metastasis and drug resistance in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). The findings suggested that AXL amplification could lead to enhanced EMT in PDAC under hypoxic conditions.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals microenvironment context-specific routes for epithelial-mesenchymal transition in pancreas cancer cells

finding: The analysis of SNP rs13215532 pointed to its involvement in the epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) as a key regulator in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma progression and chemoresistance, indicating its potential as a target for novel drug therapies.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals microenvironment context-specific routes for epithelial-mesenchymal transition in pancreas cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs13213604 showed significant differences in allele binding through experimental validation, supporting its classification as a high-probability functional variant related to the risk of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
title: High-throughput identification of functional regulatory SNPs in systemic lupus erythematosus

finding: The analysis found that SNP rs6917603 was associated with HDL levels, despite being missed by NFBC's earlier analysis. This SNP exhibited high pairwise correlations with other SNPs, indicating its relevance in the context of complex trait genetics.
title: Multivariate GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The SNP rs11154336 exhibited allele-specific enhancer activity in luciferase assays, demonstrating a 236% increase in reporter activity associated with NCOA7, consistent with eQTL findings.
title: Mapping genomic regulation of kidney disease and traits through high-resolution and interpretable eQTLs

finding: The variant rs9479402, associated with the gene VIP, had a p-value of 1.812 x 10^-17 and a locus RCP of 0.30. This SNP was discussed in a GWAS of 89,283 individuals from the 23andMe cohort self-reporting as 'a morning person' where it exhibited a significant association with a p-value of 3.9 x 10^-11. The gene VIP is involved in the production of vasoactive intestinal peptide, a neurotransmitter related to the synchronization of circadian rhythms to light cycles.
title: PhenomeXcan: Mapping the genome to the phenome through the transcriptome

finding: The rs1360780 SNP in the FKBP5 gene was associated with significant variations in stress response to early life adversity (ELA). Specifically, carriers of the AT allele exhibited increased expression of FKBP5 upon glucocorticoid stimulation, leading to a greater predisposition for psychiatric symptoms later in life compared to CG allele carriers. Additionally, in female mice, exposure to ELA and possession of the AT allele resulted in altered HPA-axis functioning and behavioral changes, including less activity and diminished responsiveness to novel environments, highlighting the SNP's critical role in sex-specific interactions with ELA.
title: Impact of Fkbp5 × Early Life Adversity × Sex in Humanized Mice on Multidimensional Stress Responses and Circadian Rhythmicity

finding: The SNP rs7775698 was linked to an enhancer with dysregulated activity in Ts21 HSCs, as indicated by the findings on TSPAN32. The analysis suggested that while the dysregulation of any individual gene would have minor effects on HSC differentiation, the comprehensive reshaping of enhancer-gene maps in Ts21 was likely to significantly affect haematopoiesis, highlighting the broader implications of the dysregulation in the context of Down's Syndrome.
title: Single-cell multi-omics map of human foetal blood in Down’s Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs9368197, located in an intron of the gene CDKAL1, was associated with breast cancer risk. This finding was highlighted within the context of breast cancer research, indicating that the SNP plays a role in the genetic risk factors linked to this disease.
title: Finding associations in a heterogeneous setting: Statistical test for aberration enrichment

finding: The genomic locus containing gallocin A in Streptococcus gallolyticus subsp. gallolyticus (SGG) UCN34 included the conserved co-regulated gene gallo_rs10370, which encoded a putative 'bacteriocin biosynthesis protein' containing a thioredoxin domain. This gene was hypothesized to assist in disulfide bond formation in gallocin A peptides, thus playing a crucial role in their antimicrobial activity.
title: Gallocin A, an atypical two-peptide bacteriocin with intramolecular disulfide bonds required for activity

finding: SNP rs4613794 was associated with reduced SA of the superior parietal cortex in anxiety, highlighting its impact.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs9375138 was linked to decreased SA in the inferior parietal cortex in PTSD, emphasizing its relevance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs9401593 showed positive correlation with greater CT and SA in superior temporal cortices across both ASD and BD, emphasizing its dual relevance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs1906252 was identified as having joint effects on increased CT and SA in brain regions relevant to both BD and ASD, underlining its genetic significance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs9375188 exhibited associations with enhanced CT and SA in shared brain regions, impacting both ASD and BD, demonstrating its shared relevance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs17814604 showed joint associations with greater CT and SA in brain regions linked to both ASD and BD, illustrating its genetic importance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs1487441 exhibited joint associations influencing CT and SA in superior temporal and anterior cingulate regions for both ASD and BD.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs1487445 was associated with increased CT and SA in motor cortex regions shared between ASD and BD, underlining its genetic role.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs6917902 was identified as an exonic variant jointly associated with schizophrenia (SCZ) and cortical thickness (CT), highlighting its role in structural brain variations.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs2273709 was implicated in shared associations with SCZ and CT, emphasizing the implications for cortical architecture across disorders.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs9472022 was identified as an exonic variant associated with SCZ and CT, underscoring its influence on brain structural differences.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs66650371 was identified as reducing LDB1 binding to the -84 kb enhancer of the Myb gene, which is homologous to the murine -81 kb enhancer. This reduction in LDB1 binding subsequently decreased the interaction frequency between the MYB promoter and its enhancer, suggesting a negative impact on Myb gene expression and a potential regulatory role in fetal hemoglobin production.
title: An enhancer RNA recruits MLL1 to regulate transcription of Myb

finding: The SNP rs13214467 was tied to the findings of Song and Wang (2021), who noted that incorporating leaf traits improves deep learning models for predicting photosynthetic capacity from reflectance data. This finding suggested that genetic traits could influence leaf reflectance metrics and their application in remote sensing.
title: Hyperspectral imaging for chloroplast movement detection

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with multiple phenotypes, including blood urea nitrogen (BUN), calcium, glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase (GOT), mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH), and others. Its connections to various metabolic traits were established, and it is reported to have a possible association with CD109 Molecule in relation to malignancies.
title: Phenome-wide association study of a comprehensive health check-up database in a Korea population: Clinical application & trans-ethnic comparison

finding: The SNP rs9271520 displayed co-eQTL effects across various immune cell types, including CD4+ T cells and monocytes. The associated co-eGenes were enriched for traits related to several immune diseases, such as rheumatoid arthritis and multiple sclerosis, indicating a potential regulatory role in these conditions despite the confounding effects of linkage disequilibrium with nearby SNPs.
title: Identification of genetic variants that impact gene co-expression relationships using large-scale single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs393727 was associated with multiple co-eGenes, including RNASET2 and others related to Crohn's disease and inflammatory bowel disease. Despite a limited number of co-eGenes, the association with immune-related diseases suggested that rs393727 may play a significant role in immune function and disease susceptibility.
title: Identification of genetic variants that impact gene co-expression relationships using large-scale single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs13194985 was associated with vimentin expression levels in the context of epithelial mesenchymal transition (EMT), which was highlighted in research that posited vimentin's role in metastasis for colorectal cancer (CRC). The study provided evidence indicating that alterations in vimentin expression, mediated by this SNP, could contribute to cancer cell behavior and patient outcomes.
title: Multifunctional molecular hybrid for targeted colorectal cancer cells: Integrating doxorubicin, AS1411 aptamer, and T9/U4 ASO

finding: The SNP rs9271894, associated with the HLA gene region, resulted in significant upregulation of L1 transposon expression. Changes in this genotype were linked to increased expression of multiple TE family gene sets as identified through differential expression analysis.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate Regulators of LINE-1 RNA Levels in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: The SNP rs9271379 was identified to influence expression linked to HLA-DRB6 and showed associations with the regulation of L1 transposon family expression patterns, asserting its role as a candidate regulator.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate Regulators of LINE-1 RNA Levels in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: The A118G (rs1799971) SNP in the mu opioid receptor gene was associated with moderately significant effects on MOR mRNA expression, showing higher expression in carriers of the minor G allele. This was determined from pooled results across multiple brain regions, indicating a brain region-specific impact as previous studies had reported no correlation in other brain areas.
title: Increased functional coupling of the mu opioid receptor in the anterior insula of depressed individuals

finding: The SNP rs2760157 located within KIAA0319 showed significant association with RAN-color in the replication analysis of this study, with p=6.97×10−5, supporting previous findings that highlighted its role in dyslexia-related cognitive traits.
title: A genome wide association study identifies a new variant associated with word reading fluency in Chinese children

finding: The SNP rs16889506, another variant in KIAA0319, showed association with RAN-color (p=3.17×10−4) in the replication analysis, aligning with previous reports of its involvement in dyslexia.
title: A genome wide association study identifies a new variant associated with word reading fluency in Chinese children

finding: The SNP rs3756821, identified in previous studies, was validated in the context of the Chinese population with significant associations noted during the analyses.
title: A genome wide association study identifies a new variant associated with word reading fluency in Chinese children

finding: The SNP rs13205235 was highlighted in Proshkina et al. (2021) regarding its association with the selective suppression of HER2-positive tumor growth using DARPin_9-29-targeted gold nanorods. This finding demonstrated the potential of this SNP to influence treatment outcomes in models of HER2-positive breast cancer.
title: Internalization-Responsive Nano-PLGA For Image-Guided Photodynamic Therapy Against HER2-Positive Breast Cancer

finding: This SNP was identified as a chromatin accessibility QTL (caQTL) in naive CD4+ T cells linked to the gene BACH2, corroborating previous research and indicating its role in type 1 diabetes (T1D) susceptibility.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: This SNP was determined to function as a caQTL for a CD4+ T cell-specific site, showing significant allelic influence (π=0.81, q-value=6.3×10^-4) and highlighting its role in CD4+ T cell biology.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: It was a caQTL for a distal site and the DSP promoter in B cells, indicating its role in gene regulation with significant association (π=0.65, q-value=0.0066).
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: The SNP rs2884013 was identified as an mQTL for cg18181703 and used as an instrumental variable to estimate the height association. It served as a proxy for rs4383852, enabling further analysis of the relationship between methylation and height.
title: DNA methylation at the suppressor of cytokine signaling 3 (SOCS3) gene influences height in childhood

finding: The genetic variant <OCT2> c.596C>T (p.Thr199Ile, rs201919874) was associated with decreased transporter function resulting in significantly higher plasma exposure and reduced renal clearance of metformin compared to those with the reference genotype.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: The variant <OCT2> c.602C>T (p.Thr201Met, rs145450955) resulted in decreased transporter function and was shown to increase plasma exposure and reduce metformin renal clearance when compared to individuals with the reference genotype.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: For the <OCT2> c.808G>T (p.Ser270Ala, rs316019) variant, individuals demonstrated a significant increase in metformin AUC(0-24 h) by 27% with cimetidine treatment, correlating with reduced renal clearance of metformin in comparison to heterozygous carriers.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: The <OCT1> intronic variant c.1386-2964C>A (rs622342) was associated with impaired glucose-lowering effect, indicating a functional impact on OCT1.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: Homozygous individuals for the <OCT1> c.480G>C (p.Leu160Phe, rs683369) variant showed a significant increase in metformin AUC(0-24 h) by 33% and Cmax by 48% with cimetidine treatment.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: The <OCT2> c.518+32G>C (rs2774230) variant resulted in an increase in AUC(0-24 h) by 35% and decreased metformin renal clearance when co-administered with cimetidine.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: The <OCT2> c.1506C>T (p.Val502=, rs316003) variant demonstrated a statistically significant increase in AUC(0-24 h) by 27% and reduction in renal clearance of metformin in the context of cimetidine co-administration.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: This SNP, found in the E2F3 gene, exhibited strong associations with total cholesterol and HDL levels, linking lipid phenotypes to its effects.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The common variant rs9349379 in the PHACTR1 gene was significantly associated with prevalent coronary heart disease (CHD), confirming its role in heart disease risk.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs3131638 was associated with the SKIV2L locus, which was found to produce insomnia-like behaviors when mutated in zebrafish. The mutation significantly reduced sleep duration and increased sleep latency, along with daytime hyperactivity, suggesting a state of hyperarousal.
title: Zebrafish screen of high-confidence effector genes at insomnia GWAS loci implicates conserved regulators of sleep-wake behaviors

finding: The SNP rs610913, a G>T polymorphism resulting in a P261H amino acid exchange in the cGAS protein, was found to nominally associate with HIV-1 acquisition in a study involving 6,334 infected cases and 7,247 controls. Data suggested that individuals homozygous for rs610913 showed a slight reduction in type I IFN response upon DNA challenge compared to those homozygous for the wild-type allele. Although the steady-state activity of cGAS(P261H) was comparable to wild-type in terms of interferon-stimulated genes (ISG) expression, the expression of cGAS(P261H) resulted in a potentially altered susceptibility to viral infections. This implicates rs610913 in the regulation of antiviral responses and a possible role in facilitating HIV-1 acquisition in vivo.
title: A base-line cellular antiviral state is maintained by cGAS and its most frequent naturally occurring variant rs610913

finding: SNP rs13215533 was found in research that explored the roles of galectins in glioma progression. The study indicated that this SNP was linked to changes in macrophage behavior within the GBM microenvironment, illustrating its potential impact on cancer treatment pathways.
title: Single-cell analysis reveals diversity of tumor-associated macrophages and their interactions with T lymphocytes in glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs7767396 showed a significant association with Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor-A (VEGF-A) and was identified as having the most substantial effect on protein expression in the context of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). The effect size was measured at beta -0.42, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.46 and a p-value of 8.7×10^-18, indicating strong evidence of its role as a cis-expression quantitative trait locus (cis pQTL) affecting protein expression related to IBD.
title: Serum proteomic profiling at diagnosis predicts clinical course, and need for intensification of treatment in inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The variant rs6913677 in the BAI3 gene exhibited a significant association with body mass index (BMI) at a P-value of 1.08 × 10−8, representing a novel GWAS signal in the studied Indian cohort.
title: Multifaceted genome-wide study identifies novel regulatory loci for body mass index in Indians

finding: The SNP rs13215284 was related to intrinsic interferon signaling in glioblastoma stem cells, which influenced cell death and the mesenchymal phenotype of these cells. This finding established a link between the genetic variant and the regulation of critical pathways in glioblastoma pathology.
title: Single CAR-Dual target: Intracranial Delivery of Anti-PD-L1 CAR T Cells Effectively Eradicates Glioma and Immunosuppressive Cells in the Tumor Microenvironment

finding: The variant rs11154537 (A/G) demonstrated a strong association with the promoter activity of TMEM200A, especially for prmtr.94867 (p = 1.96 x 10^-54, beta = -0.99) and prmtr.94870 (p = 8.88 x 10^-8, beta = -0.38). It was also mapped as an eQTL related to the total expression level of TMEM200A (p = 1.93 x 10^-53, beta = -0.99), indicating its pivotal role in regulating both promoter activity and overall gene expression.
title: Mapping of promoter usage QTL using RNA-seq data reveals their contributions to complex traits

finding: SNP rs6940658 revealed a novel association with the ceramide species CER[N(26)S(19)], yielding a P-value of 2.07x10^-8, situated upstream of the CD83 gene, contributing to our understanding of ceramide metabolism in relation to inflammatory responses.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide lipidome reveal genetic influence over circulating lipids

finding: This SNP, located at the HLA-DRB1 locus, exhibited chromatin accessibility specifically in EAE-OLG but not in MiGl. This finding indicates a potential involvement in immune functionality alterations in oligodendrocytes in MS, as it was also linked to chromatin accessibility data derived from healthy individuals.
title: A primed immune transcriptional program is activated in oligodendroglia in multiple sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs17493811 showed chromatin accessibility predominantly in control-OPCs and EAE-OPCs, suggesting that it might modulate regulatory regions affecting transcriptional output and oligodendrocyte function during MS. Its findings indicate a relationship with chromatin accessibility alterations related to MS susceptibility.
title: A primed immune transcriptional program is activated in oligodendroglia in multiple sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs62389423 located at the IRF4 locus was recognized as a genome-wide significant signal of selection, resulting in a p-value of 8.80 × 10-42, contributing to the reported signals of selection.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The SNP rs9267817 at the HLA locus presented a significant association with a p-value of 6.17 × 10-9, being included as a prior signal of selection.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The SNP rs2395029 was historically associated with HIV susceptibility, as evidenced by findings from Limou and Zagury (2013) and Fellay et al. (2007). This association contributed to the understanding of host genetics impacting disease susceptibility.
title: Optimal HLA imputation of admixed population with dimension reduction

finding: A missense mutation within the SAPCD1 gene, this SNP was associated with macular degeneration, suggesting its role in an important eye disorder.
title: Vision-related convergent gene losses reveal SERPINE3’s unknown role in the eye

finding: The SNP rs17215231 was identified in the CIMBA/BCAC-TN meta-analysis as exclusively associated with triple-negative disease, demonstrating a significant association with an odds ratio of 0.85 (95% CI=0.81-0.89) and a high statistical significance (P=8.6×10^-13). This finding contributed to insights regarding genetic susceptibility to specific breast cancer subtypes.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 32 novel breast cancer susceptibility loci from overall and subtype-specific analyses

finding: The SNP rs13215493 was identified in the context of tumors exhibiting phenocopy of TP53 loss. It had been associated with alterations in PPM1D, which is implicated in tumorigenesis similarly to TP53 loss-of-function mutations. The study highlighted that high expression of PPM1D could induce tumors that are phenotypically indistinguishable from those bearing TP53 mutations, indicating a significant role in cancer development.
title: Prevalence, causes and impact of TP53-loss phenocopying events in human tumors

finding: SNP rs9469860 on chromosome 6 exceeded the genome-wide significance threshold, despite adjustments for dominance effects, marking its relevance in obesity genetics.
title: Identifying latent genetic interactions in genome-wide association studies using multiple traits

finding: In the study, a rare coding mutation in SIRT5, identified as rs201979175 (c.C303G:p.F101L), was found to segregate dominantly with finger interphalangeal joint osteoarthritis (OA) in a family examined within the Utah Population Database (UPDB). The mutation leads to a substitution of a conserved phenylalanine (F) with leucine (L) at position 101 in the protein's catalytic domain. This mutation was associated with early-onset or severe manifestations of OA, affecting multiple joints, including the hands and shoulders. Furthermore, in silico analyses, such as SIFT and MutationTaster, predicted that this mutation is harmful or disease-causing.
title: Sirt5 regulates chondrocyte metabolism and osteoarthritis development through protein lysine malonylation

finding: Located at the RREB1 locus, this primary signal showed islet TOA of 0.31 and adipose TOA of 0.27, demonstrating shared tissue involvement.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs6908626, with a fine-mapped PIP of 0.99 for 'All Auto Immune Traits', was associated with the gene BACH2 via the Roadmap S2G strategy. BACH2, classified as a master-regulator transcription factor, has been implicated in immune responses and various autoimmune diseases, highlighting its critical regulatory function in the immune system.
title: SNP-to-gene linking strategies reveal contributions of enhancer-related and candidate master-regulator genes to autoimmune disease

finding: The variant rs9478812 was associated with blood pressure regulation in independent GWAS. It was linked to an increased risk of preeclampsia in the maternal GWAS performed on the same cohort. The presence of this SNP indicated an increased susceptibility to developing PE, thus suggesting that individuals with this variant had a heightened genetic predisposition related to hypertension, which aligns with the underlying mechanisms of PE development.
title: Risk of preeclampsia in patients with genetic predisposition to common medical conditions: a case-control study

finding: The SNP rs13215345 was linked to the mechanism whereby nicotine activates PD-L1 expression in HNSCC cells following exposure to cigarette smoke. This interaction was shown to alter the tumor immune microenvironment, suggesting a direct connection between genetic variants like rs13215345 and the immune response suppression observed in smokers with head and neck cancer.
title: Tobacco smoke exposure is a driver of altered oxidative stress response and immunity in head and neck cancer

finding: The SNP rs9274741 was significantly associated with leprosy in the Jatt/Choudhry subgroup, showing a p-value of 4×10^-10. This finding indicated a potential link between this variant and resistance to the disease.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: The SNP rs9275596 demonstrated a significant association with IgA nephropathy, with a p-value of 3×10^-31 in the analysis focusing on the Jatt/Choudhry subgroup, suggesting its relevance in the predisposition to this nephrological condition.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: The variant rs3115663 was part of a group of SNPs significantly linked to idiopathic membranous nephropathy, with multiple SNPs in this context showing a combined p-value less than 2×10^-40, underscoring its importance in this specific disease.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: Similarly, rs3130618 was associated with idiopathic membranous nephropathy, contributing to the notable significance revealed in the analysis, with the previous p-value context supporting a highly impactful finding.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: Identified alongside others, rs3134945 was significantly linked to idiopathic membranous nephropathy and thus added weight to the understanding of genetic predisposition to this disease in the specific population sample.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: The SNP rs11229 was included in the suite of variants associated with idiopathic membranous nephropathy, contributing to the strong collective significance observed for this condition.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: For rs2071278, it was noted to have a highly significant association with complement C4 levels, attaining a p-value of 4×10^-72, indicating its possible role in immune response regulation.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: Lastly, rs10885 was significantly associated with haemoglobin levels, with a remarkable p-value of 2×10^-36, suggesting its potential significance in affecting erythropoiesis.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: The SNP rs1800562, linked to the HFE gene, showed significant colocalization with traits affecting total cholesterol, low density lipoprotein, and various red blood cell traits, suggesting its involvement in hereditary hemochromatosis and related metabolic processes.
title: Genetic colocalization atlas points to common regulatory sites and genes for hematopoietic traits and hematopoietic contributions to disease phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs117780815, located in the NKAIN2 gene, showed genome-wide significant SNP-by-sex interaction (p=3.2×10−8), with effects differing between bipolar disorder (BIP) and schizophrenia (SCZ). The minor allele was associated with increased risk in females with BIP while decreasing risk in males, and vice versa in SCZ.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: SNP rs1737071, also located on Chromosome 18, was linked to stomatal density (DS) and explained 36% of the phenotypic variance at Duclos. Heterozygote accessions (GA) exhibited significantly higher DS compared to homozygous accessions (GG), suggesting a better capacity for water loss control and CO2 uptake.
title: Identification and analysis of genomic regions influencing leaf morpho-physiological traits related to stress responses in Dioscorea alata

finding: Linked to pancreatic volume (p=8e-13, beta=0.07), this SNP has been associated with diabetes-related traits.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs2005 was linked to the study of network phases in block copolymer melts as described by Bates in 2005. This finding contributed to a deeper understanding of structural behaviors within bicontinuous membranes and their importance in the functionality of nanostructures, particularly in the context of plant cell organelles and the identification of the bicontinuous diamond surface in chloroplast precursors.
title: SPIRE, Surface Projection Image Recognition Environment for bicontinuous phases: application for plastid cubic membranes

finding: The rs2327429 SNP mapped upstream of TCF21, with a relation to CAD in overlapping cell types.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The rs9349379 SNP disrupts a MEF2 binding site and was found within a significant smooth muscle and macrophage peak, establishing its link to CAD.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The SNP rs13214343 was also found to have significant relevance as an original finding related to coral habitat estimation, as discussed in the study by Roelfsema et al. in 2021. This research emphasized the need for accurate assessments of shallow coral habitats on the Great Barrier Reef, further supporting the utility of citizen science and AI in contemporary coral reef monitoring.
title: Broadscale reconnaissance of coral reefs from citizen science and deep learning

finding: The SNP rs914338 showed associations with Alistipes shahii specifically in male cohorts, confirming its relevance in understanding gender-specific gut microbiota dynamics.
title: M-GWAS for the gut microbiome in Chinese adults illuminates on complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs4947296 was found to be associated with Meniere's disease, a disorder affecting the stria vascularis (SV) that results in symptoms like vertigo, tinnitus, and hearing loss. The study indicated that a majority of patients with bilateral Meniere's disease carried this variant. This SNP plays a role in regulating the TWEAK/Fn14 signaling pathway, leading to activation of Nf-kappa B pathways with inflammatory consequences. Thus, TWEAK signaling was identified as a potential therapeutic target for patients who carry the rs4947296 variant, demonstrating its relevance in investigating the etiology of Meniere's disease.
title: Molecular differences between neonatal and adult stria vascularis from organotypic explants and transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs9481842 was identified as a strong trans eQTL linked to the NKX2-5 transcript, influencing both mRNA and protein levels. This association highlighted the role of NKX2-5 as a transcription factor affected by AF GWAS variant, contributing to atrial fibrillation by regulating target gene expression.
title: Tissue-specific multiOMICs analysis of atrial fibrillation

finding: The variant rs1460351219, encoding the p.Arg581His in MCM9, was observed in a male infertility patient and was shown to cause infertility in mouse models. Homozygous mice exhibited reduced sperm counts and a histological examination revealed variable spermatogenesis, indicating meiotic arrest.
title: In vivo versus in silico assessment of potentially pathogenic missense variants in human reproductive genes

finding: The SNP rs783153 was identified as having a significant correlation with LPA expression in human kidney tubules. The effect was particularly strong in individuals with G/G genotype, where LPA expression increased with PT cell fractions, indicating a cell-type specific eQTL interaction.
title: Mapping the genetic architecture of human traits to cell types in the kidney identifies mechanisms of disease and potential treatments

finding: The SNP rs61202914 was identified as an eQTL for the expression of a FYN isoform. It resided in the transcription factor binding site (TFBS) of multiple transcription factors within the promoter region of FYN, suggesting that it likely affected the binding affinity of these transcription factors and thus the expression level of FYN. This evidence indicated that rs61202914 may causally affect the expression of FYN and is therefore associated with Alzheimer’s disease (AD) traits.
title: Genome-wide prediction and integrative functional characterization of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genes

finding: The SNP rs6912511 was identified as a significant disruptor of the RUNX3 motif. This was demonstrated through analyses that showed its marked influence on MEF2A DNA binding in human lymphoblastoid cell lines. Additionally, a binomial test exhibited a p-value of 6.35E-3, indicating that rs6912511 serves as an allelic specificity binding site (ASB). This finding revealed how rs6912511 contributed to allelic imbalance and underscored the importance of genetic variation in modulating transcription factor activity, particularly relating to B-cell-specific gene regulation.
title: A highly parallel, automated platform enabling individual or sequential ChIP of histone marks and transcription factors

finding: This SNP in HLA-DRA was identified as a high priority SNP for nervous system diseases, particularly linked with pesticide-induced effects.
title: Genetic variability in pathways associates with pesticide-induced nervous system disease in the United States

finding: The SNP rs13215353 was associated with somatic hypomethylation of pericentromeric SST1 repeats in human colorectal cancer cells. The context of this finding relates to its implications in cancer biology, particularly focusing on how alterations in methylation patterns may influence tumorigenesis.
title: Recombination between heterologous human acrocentric chromosomes

finding: The SNP rs2269424 (G/A) was identified as a Time Informative Marker (TIM) adjacent to the PPT2 and EGFL8 genes associated with immunity. Strong evidence of selection was found at this marker, indicating its relevance to immunity traits.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: The SNP rs1800562 (G/A) in the HFE gene was recognized as a TIM associated with hemochromatosis. Temporal variation trends showed an increase in the frequency of this risk allele, suggesting an association with changes in lifestyle and diet.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: The SNP rs6907487 on chromosome 6 was associated with coronary artery disease and had been validated in independent studies, confirming its significance in cardiovascular genetics.
title: DeepCOMBI: Explainable artificial intelligence for the analysis and discovery in genome-wide association studies

finding: SNP rs1800460, associated with Horvath-based epigenetic age acceleration (Horvath-EAA), displayed a CADD score of 28.40, indicating a potentially deleterious effect on protein function, and is linked to thiopurine methyltransferase (TPMT), which is involved in drug metabolism.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of epigenetic age acceleration

finding: The SNP rs1142345 is associated with Horvath-EAA and shows a high CADD score of 28.30, suggesting it may have harmful protein effects. This SNP is also relevant to methylation processes.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of epigenetic age acceleration

finding: SNP rs10949483 was associated with Horvath-EAA and had a CADD score of 18.92, indicating potential deleterious effects. It is linked to the NHLRC1 gene, which is involved in glycogen metabolism.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of epigenetic age acceleration

finding: SNP rs76244256 was the variant most strongly associated with Horvath-EAA, with eQTL evidence for NHLRC1 expression, which is linked to glycogen metabolism, across multiple tissues.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of epigenetic age acceleration

finding: The variant rs75932628, encoding the p.R47H mutation in TREM2, was identified as a strong risk factor for developing late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD). This variant was shown to reduce TREM2 function, thereby contributing to the pathology associated with the disease. It was reported through genome-wide association studies (GWAS) and had one of the highest odds ratios for LOAD after APOE4.
title: A novel TREM2 splice isoform lacking the ligand binding is expressed in brain and shares localization

finding: The SNP rs143332484, encoding the p.R62H mutation in TREM2, was also recognized as a significant risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD). Similar to rs75932628, it was found to compromise TREM2 function. This variant was validated through multiple GWAS, underscoring its role in AD risk alongside other established genetic factors.
title: A novel TREM2 splice isoform lacking the ligand binding is expressed in brain and shares localization

finding: The variant rs75932628-T in exon 2 of the TREM2 gene was found to cause an arginine-to-histidine substitution at amino acid position 47 (R47H), which was highly significantly associated with increased risk of developing Alzheimer's disease (AD). This SNP's risk effect was comparable to that of the APOEε4 allele, approximately three times increased AD risk. Additionally, the R47H variant was implicated in other neurodegenerative diseases, including frontotemporal dementia, Parkinson's disease, and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, indicating the broader influence of TREM2 in microglial function and survival across the brain.
title: Trem2 promotes anti-inflammatory responses in microglia and is suppressed under pro-inflammatory conditions

finding: The mutation rs10457592 was linked to the target gene POU3F2, with a corresponding TransEPI score of 0.9400. This finding was also validated using Hi-C, indicating that it is pertinent to the study of neural disorders and enhances the understanding of non-coding mutations in this context.
title: Capturing large genomic contexts for accurately predicting enhancer-promoter interactions

finding: The SNP rs3129882 in the HLA-DRA gene was associated with a 1.7-fold increased risk for idiopathic late-onset Parkinson's disease (PD). The high-risk GG genotype was over-represented in individuals with PD compared to a healthy control group.
title: MHCII deletion in mouse myeloid cells alters T-cell subset frequencies and inflammatory responses to alpha-synuclein pathology and epigenetic analysis of human monocytes reveals genotype-as well as disease-dependent differentially accessible chromatin regions in the HLA locus

finding: The ESR1 rs2234693 polymorphism was studied in conjunction with other SNPs and was linked to coronary artery disease (CAD). This finding suggested that variations in the ESR1 gene may contribute to cardiovascular health.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The ESR1 rs9340799 SNP was associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) in a study that examined multiple genetic variants, indicating its relevance in cardiovascular risk profiles.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The rs11755527 STAT4 gene variant was studied for its association with type 1 diabetes mellitus, showing the genetic underpinnings of autoimmune diseases.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The study reported a strong association of the nonsynonymous change in the VARS2 locus (rs4678) with rheumatoid arthritis (RA). This finding indicated that this SNP potentially played a significant role in the susceptibility to RA.
title: kTWAS: integrating kernel-machine with transcriptome-wide association studies improves statistical power and reveals novel genes

finding: The research identified a mutation in HLA-DQA2 (rs9275595) that could contribute to the pathogenesis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), suggesting a genetic link between this SNP and RA.
title: kTWAS: integrating kernel-machine with transcriptome-wide association studies improves statistical power and reveals novel genes

finding: The SNP rs56705452 was found to be a sex-biased eQTL for the gene MICA in muscle tissue. This gene's variations are linked to several autoimmune conditions, including psoriasis and ankylosing spondylitis. The SNP demonstrated a sexually dimorphic influence on the presentation of ankylosing spondylitis, suggesting a regulatory role in MICA expression influenced by sex, particularly through interactions with the FOXA1 protein.
title: Sexual differences in genetic architecture in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs9349050 was identified as the most significant cis pQTL associated with MDGA1 levels, explaining 54.6% of the phenotypic variance in plasma protein levels. This marked it as a notable original finding in relation to neurological proteins.
title: Genetic and epigenetic architectures of neurological protein biomarkers in the Lothian Birth Cohort 1936

finding: The SNP rs9394903 was linked to the gene PRPH2 specifically in RPE2, providing evidence of its involvement in geographic atrophy mechanisms.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: A significant association was found for the lead SNP rs114892859 with penicillin allergy, indicated by a P-value of 4.59×10^-29 and an odds ratio of 1.59. It was identified as part of the major histocompatibility complex (MHC) region on chromosome 6 and showed strong links to the HLA-B*55:01 allele. Additionally, it was shown to have regulatory functions and was associated with lower expression of HLA genes, which may contribute to hypersensitivity reactions.
title: Genome-wide study identifies association between HLA-B*55:01 and penicillin allergy

finding: This SNP was associated with CL as indicated by a P-imputed_1000G of 6.06×10^-6 and was expressed more in CL biopsies compared to normal skin.
title: A genome-wide association study highlights a regulatory role for IFNG-AS1 contributing to cutaneous leishmaniasis in Brazil

finding: The SNP rs6923384 was linked to the superior longitudinal fasciculus in a 100kb window on chromosome 6, intersecting with genes DLL1, FAM120B, MIR4644, and LINC01624.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: The rs1043618 SNP was associated with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) in response to environmental stressors. It was located in the HSPA1A gene, which codes for a vital GR co-chaperone. This polymorphism was found to have different frequencies in the Japanese (0.1599) and Korean populations (0.2801), indicating a potential role in stress-related pathologies and possibly influencing Hsp70 protein levels through translation efficiency or post-transcriptional regulation.
title: A genomic study of the Japanese population focusing on the glucocorticoid receptor interactome highlights distinct genetic characteristics associated with stress response

finding: This SNP was associated with rheumatoid arthritis in East Asians, showing a significant effect size (beta=0.82, p=1.91×10^-105), indicating its role in immunological phenotypes.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with chronic hepatitis B in East Asians, showing a negative effect (beta=-0.618, p=2.87×10^-18), categorizing it under immunological phenotypes.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was linked to Graves’ disease in East Asians, showing a negative effect (beta=-0.477, p=3.90×10^-18), which categorizes it under endocrine phenotypes.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with mean corpuscular hemoglobin in European populations, indicating its relevance to hematological phenotypes (beta=0.158, p=9.97×10^-304).
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was associated with GLP1 receptor levels in connection to type 2 diabetes.
