title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Linked to several phenotypes including body height and smoking behavior, this SNP was indicated as an ASM index SNP with strong connections to regulatory functions in gene expression.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs10455872 was significantly associated with median Lp(a) values in the LipidCardio cohort, showing the strongest evidence of an association with Lp(a) serum levels (β=0.794; p=5.1×10^-52). There was also a reasonable association observed between carrying a minor LPA variant and coronary artery disease (CAD), specifically indicating that in women, the odds ratio for obstructive CAD reached 1.85 (95% CI 1.02-3.35, p=0.04), whereas no such association was established in men.
title: Cohort profile: The LipidCardio Study - Role of Lipoproteins in Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The SNP rs3798220 was found to be significantly associated with Lp(a) levels in the LipidCardio cohort, supporting its previously established relationship with Lp(a) serum concentrations. While the study found an association, it did not report specific odds ratios or statistical significance levels for CAD related to this SNP.
title: Cohort profile: The LipidCardio Study - Role of Lipoproteins in Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The SNP rs186696265 was also significantly associated with Lp(a) levels in the LipidCardio cohort, consistent with earlier reports linking this SNP to Lp(a) concentrations. Like rs3798220, it did not provide detailed odds ratios or significance levels for CAD in this study.
title: Cohort profile: The LipidCardio Study - Role of Lipoproteins in Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The eQTL rs9271209 was found to overlap with ChIP-seq peaks and DNA-binding motifs for transcription factors MEF2B, CUX1, and ATF2. It was established that patients with this eQTL exhibited reduced expression of HLA-DRB1, suggesting that the Alzheimer’s disease-associated effect on gene expression could be mediated through disruption of transcription factor binding.
title: A systems-biology approach connects aging mechanisms with Alzheimer’s disease pathogenesis

finding: This SNP was associated with developing Hashimoto thyroiditis versus Graves' disease and significantly affected the expression of the TDRD6 gene, involved in spermiogenesis and autoimmune polyendocrine syndrome. It was also among the nine variants demonstrating a strong selection.
title: Ancient DNA reveals that few GWAS loci have been strongly selected during recent human history

finding: The SNP rs6570507 was positively associated with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis, as confirmed by a multi-ethnic meta-analysis. This finding indicated that individuals carrying the risk allele of this SNP had a higher predisposition to develop this condition, which is characterized by abnormal curvature of the spine during adolescence.
title: The N terminus of adhesion G protein-coupled receptor GPR126/ADGRG6 as allosteric force integrator

finding: The SNP rs1521 was associated with Graves' disease and was found to alter the expression of the HLA-C gene in thyroid cells. This down-regulation of HLA-C potentially enhances NK cell-mediated cytotoxicity against thyrocytes, contributing to the pathogenesis of autoimmune thyroid diseases (AITD). Furthermore, it was associated with an increase in expression of MIC-B, another ligand for the CD314 immunoreceptor, which could activate NK cells.
title: Multi-omic analyses reveal antibody-dependent natural killer cell-mediated cytotoxicity in autoimmune thyroid diseases

finding: The SNP rs3094228 was associated with TPOAb-positivity and was shown to increase the expression of the MIC-B gene in thyroid cells. This up-regulation may enhance interaction with NK cells via the CD314 receptor, thereby facilitating antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity of thyrocytes in the context of AITD.
title: Multi-omic analyses reveal antibody-dependent natural killer cell-mediated cytotoxicity in autoimmune thyroid diseases

finding: Demonstrated association with TREML3P, which is located in the TREM locus where TREM2 exists, important for Alzheimer's pathology.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs2071543 was associated with IgA glomerulonephritis, also known as Berger Disease. It was reported as genome-wide significant in East Asians (p-value = 2.1 × 10−9) but showed no significance in Europeans (p-value = 0.85). In the sampled Native American populations, the risk allele frequency was 0.76, in contrast to 0.89 in Caribbean Americans and 0.88 in European Americans.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The SNP rs8111 was found to be associated with Blood Protein Levels in European populations, with a PHRED score of 22.2. This SNP is part of a larger number of SNPs associated with similar traits, as reported in the GWAS catalog.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The SNP rs3130618 was associated with MMR vaccination-related febrile seizure and Membranous Glomerulonephritis. This variant carried a PHRED score of 32 and was highlighted for its associations with significant medical traits.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The SNP rs2395617, located in the DEF6 gene, was associated with Apolipoprotein A1 levels in European individuals. It was noted that this SNP appears within a region showing underrepresented American ancestry.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The SNP rs2814982 was reported to be associated with cholesterol levels and LDL levels in multiple studies, contributing to insight into its significance related to metabolic traits in European populations.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The SNP rs2305089 in the T (brachyury) gene was associated with the prognostic significance in spinal column chordoma, where it served as a predictor for local recurrence and overall survival in patients. This finding highlighted its relevance in the clinical behavior of chordoma and suggested its potential as a biomarker for patient management.
title: Selective targeting of TBXT with DARPins identifies regulatory networks and therapeutic vulnerabilities in chordoma

finding: The SNP rs652888 was found to have a novel association with non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) risk. It was linked to autoimmune and infectious diseases, as well as being associated with Epstein-Barr virus infection, a known risk factor for NHL.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs9271378 was strongly associated with NHL risk and is part of the HLA region, which has been previously implicated in cancer risk, suggesting a clear linkage to NHL.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: Similar to rs9271378, the SNP rs3135006 was also found to be strongly associated with NHL risk, further supporting the connection between HLA variants and NHL susceptibility.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The variant rs2070600 was found to have significant interrelations with serum annexin A1 and soluble receptor for advanced glycation end products, indicating its potential as a biomarker for chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The FKBP5 gene polymorphism rs4713916 was associated with psycho-cognitive assessments and quality of life in older adults with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, suggesting its impact on psychological outcomes in COPD patients.
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs60066732 was identified as a significant genetic variant associated with the expression of circBACH2. It showed a negative correlation with both circRNA and its parent gene transcripts, with the effect size and p-value being much more extreme for circBACH2. This finding indicates that circBACH2 may play a crucial role in the risk of Type 1 diabetes (T1D), as circBACH2 was collocated with T1D GWAS loci, achieving a probability of 0.89.
title: An integrative framework for circular RNA quantitative trait locus discovery with application in human T cells

finding: The study established a positive association between the CD2AP rs9349407 polymorphism and Alzheimer's disease (AD) susceptibility. This finding indicated that genetic variations in the CD2AP gene played a significant role in predisposing individuals to AD, linking the downregulation of CD2AP to cognitive decline and related vascular impairments observed in the disease.
title: The Alzheimer risk factor CD2AP causes dysfunction of the brain vascular network

finding: The SNP rs13194850 was associated with significant findings related to the p53-DREAM pathway, which plays a vital role in regulating gene expression linked to hematopoiesis and brain development. This correlation was established through systematic identification of p53-DREAM target gene networks, impacting conditions like dyskeratosis congenita, Fanconi anemia, Diamond-Blackfan anemia, and primary microcephaly.
title: A systematic approach identifies p53-DREAM target genes associated with blood or brain abnormalities

finding: The SNP rs758109813 was associated with a homozygous G deletion mutation in the EYS gene, leading to a frame-shift mutation referred to as EYS2265fs, which causes retinitis pigmentosa. Analysis showed that the editing at this SNP through Cas9 targeted approaches could restore the reading frame in a significant number of edited clones.
title: Reading frame restoration at the EYS locus, and allele-specific chromosome removal after Cas9 cleavage in human embryos

finding: The SNP rs66502009 was used as a flanking marker in the study. 48.6% of sequenced reads post-Cas9 treatment were unmodified reads of the maternal EYSwt allele, while 51.3% were of paternal origin, confirming the specificity of the gRNA towards the paternal allele. Moreover, alterations at this SNP were analyzed as part of the genetic linkage surrounding the EYS mutation.
title: Reading frame restoration at the EYS locus, and allele-specific chromosome removal after Cas9 cleavage in human embryos

finding: As a flanking SNP to the EYS locus, rs12205397 was monitored during the analysis of edited embryos. The study noted it in conjunction with other SNPs to ascertain recombination events and continued characterization of the genetic context surrounding the EYS mutation and its consequences.
title: Reading frame restoration at the EYS locus, and allele-specific chromosome removal after Cas9 cleavage in human embryos

finding: The SNP rs4530841 was another flanking marker assessed in the context of the EYS locus. It contributed to identifying genetic linkages during SNP array analysis and provided insights into the structural changes during the embryonic editing processes.
title: Reading frame restoration at the EYS locus, and allele-specific chromosome removal after Cas9 cleavage in human embryos

finding: The SNP rs1631333 was integral in understanding chromosomal changes post-Cas9 interventions as deletions were often analyzed with respect to this SNP to determine the impact of Cas9 editing on chromosome 6 structure, revealing loss of heterozygosity and prompting further insights into the mechanism of editing effects.
title: Reading frame restoration at the EYS locus, and allele-specific chromosome removal after Cas9 cleavage in human embryos

finding: The variant rs2395178 in the HLA-DRA gene was identified as a CD8+ T-cell-specific meQTL for cg00886432, showing significant association with type I diabetes (T1D) due to its shared methylation effect in individuals with a high abundance of CD8+ T-cells. The colocalization analysis confirmed a strong relationship between this SNP and T1D, given a posterior probability for colocalization (PPFC) of 0.9802.
title: A hierarchical Bayesian interaction model to estimate cell-type-specific methylation quantitative trait loci incorporating priors from cell-sorted bisulfite sequencing data

finding: This SNP on chromosome 6 was newly implicated in the study with strong evidence of association with cerebral malaria. It showed a high Bayes factor (BF_avg) of 4.8 × 10^5, replicating with a P_additive of 0.02 for the risk effect of the derived allele. The SNP was located between the genes MAP3K7 and EPHA7.
title: New insights into malaria susceptibility from the genomes of 17,000 individuals from Africa, Asia, and Oceania

finding: SNP rs3129051 was identified solely by ESNN and located upstream of the HLA-G gene, which is well-established as related to T1D.
title: Uncertainty Quantification in Variable Selection for Genetic Fine-Mapping using Bayesian Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs16894900 was only found by ESNN and situated between the MAS1L and UBD genes, both of which have been related to T1D.
title: Uncertainty Quantification in Variable Selection for Genetic Fine-Mapping using Bayesian Neural Networks

finding: In the context of prostate cancer, the SNP rs13195020 was identified in relation to TBX2's role in driving neuroendocrine differentiation and enzalutamide resistance. It was noted that the expression of TBX2 was linked to this SNP, correlating with the gene's regulation of AR and GR signaling pathways, which are critical in advanced prostate cancer progression.
title: TBX2 driven switch from Androgen Receptor to Glucocorticoid Receptor signaling confers therapeutic resistance in Prostate Cancer

finding: The SNP rs1800629 demonstrated a significant association with EHR-OSA, especially noted in individuals with a BMI less than or equal to 30, β = 0.10 (p = 1.31 x 10^-2).
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs29230 was associated with EHR-OSA across datasets with a meta-analysis β = -0.05 (p = 2.27 x 10^-2), recognizing its potential impact on OSA diagnosis.
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The rs2071464 variant was found to be an eQTL for the PSMB9 gene in B cells stimulated with LPS plus dexamethasone, although it showed no effects on gene expression variability.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The rs1197452483 variant was linked to increased gene expression variability of the RPS18 gene in monocytes treated with PHA plus dexamethasone, without affecting mean gene expression levels.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs75932628, located in the TREM2 gene, was associated with late onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) with an extremely low p-value of 4.8 × 10^-12, indicating strong evidence for its role as a risk factor.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggests involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: The variant rs104894002 in the TREM2 gene was identified as a high-impact variant associated with LOAD, observed in 4 cases and absent in controls.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggests involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: The SNP rs9504361, found intronic to EXOC2, demonstrated cell-type specific H3K27ac occupancy in MyLa cells and long-range interactions with the promoters of IRF4 and DUSP22, linking it to pathways relevant to psoriasis including immune response modulation.
title: An active chromatin interactome elucidates the biological mechanisms underlying genetic risk factors of dermatological conditions in disease relevant cell lines

finding: This SNP was previously characterized as having a high impact, leading to a non-synonymous L9H variant of CFB and was involved in the regulation of co-regulated protease complement factors CFB, CFH, CFI, and APCS.
title: CoffeeProt: An online tool for correlation and functional enrichment of proteome-wide systems genetics

finding: It was also characterized as a high-impact SNP resulting in a non-synonymous R32Q variant of CFB and implicated in the genetic regulation of the abundance of CFB.
title: CoffeeProt: An online tool for correlation and functional enrichment of proteome-wide systems genetics

finding: The SNP rs2517606 was linked to the TRIM26 promoter EPIN and associated with the gene RRM2, with a significant p-value of 2.69e-7 indicating its potential role in prostate cancer.
title: The PENGUIN approach to reconstruct protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions and its application to prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs1321311 was studied in relation to colorectal cancer (CRC) among male carriers of the PMS2 mutation. A total of 191 men from 102 families were analyzed, revealing a statistically significant association between the risk allele of rs1321311 and CRC at the 5% level, using the new generalized weighted cohort method. This finding was consistent across various models, supporting its relevance in CRC risk for PMS2 mutation carriers.
title: A new inverse probability of selection weighted Cox model to deal with outcome-dependent sampling in survival analysis

finding: This C/T missense SNP was strongly associated with psoriasis (p=1.78 x 10^-210) and rheumatoid arthritis (p=5.58 x 10^-8). Analyses indicated that the rs28732176 variant was predicted to reduce FKBPL gene expression in both sun-exposed and non-sun-exposed skin. Furthermore, FKBPL expression was downregulated in psoriatic lesions compared to healthy skin.
title: The immunophilin protein FKBPL and its peptide derivatives are novel regulators of vascular integrity and inflammation via NF-κB signaling

finding: The A/G variant in the 5' untranslated region of FKBPL was significantly associated with rheumatoid arthritis (p=7.84 x 10^-11) as well as with hay fever rhinitis or eczema (p=5.29 x 10^-13). Predicted gene expression changes indicated that this SNP could impact FKBPL gene expression.
title: The immunophilin protein FKBPL and its peptide derivatives are novel regulators of vascular integrity and inflammation via NF-κB signaling

finding: The G/C missense variant SNP was associated with lymphocyte count (p=1.48 x 10^-11). Molecular modeling suggested that this SNP might influence the conformational flexibility of the PPIase domain and affect interactions with cellular binding partners. Predicted expression changes associated with this SNP were analyzed but detailed findings were not provided in the context.
title: The immunophilin protein FKBPL and its peptide derivatives are novel regulators of vascular integrity and inflammation via NF-κB signaling

finding: This SNP served as a missense variant associated with serum urate levels, and MR Corge estimates highlighted its role in elevating the risk of gout.
title: MR Corge: Sensitivity analysis of Mendelian randomization based on the core gene hypothesis for polygenic exposures

finding: SNP rs1050326 was identified as associated with 3'UTR usage in the HLA-C gene, indicating its potential role in regulating immune response.
title: Genetic Basis of Alternative Polyadenylation is an Emerging Molecular Phenotype for Human Traits and Diseases

finding: SNP rs2975052 showed association with 3'UTR usage in the HLA-A gene, suggesting its involvement in immune function modulation.
title: Genetic Basis of Alternative Polyadenylation is an Emerging Molecular Phenotype for Human Traits and Diseases

finding: The SNP rs9366770 was found near the HCG27 gene, with a significant association for right-handed versus non-right-handed people, having a p-value of 2.2E-09. This positioned it within critical genomic regions linked to observed handedness.
title: The molecular genetics of hand preference revisited

finding: This SNP was found within the MHC region and had a significant association (p=2.0E-08) as an eQTL for MICB related to hand preference when combining ambidextrous with left-handed individuals. It indicated complex interactions in the region affecting handedness.
title: The molecular genetics of hand preference revisited

finding: Similarly, rs2854008 showed an association (p=2.4E-08) as an eQTL for C4A. This finding, alongside other significant variants, suggested that complex genes in the MHC region may play a role in hand preference when viewed in broader assortments of handedness.
title: The molecular genetics of hand preference revisited

finding: The SNP rs20455, resulting in a W719R substitution in kinesin family member 6, was linked to altered responses to statin treatment, with higher allele frequencies observed in African (86%) and East Asian (53%) populations. This SNP was indicated as a risk factor for disease based on its associations with drug response.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs2802292 was associated with the activation of stress-dependent expression of the FOXO3 gene by Heat Shock Factor 1 (HSF1). This finding indicated that HSF1 utilized an intronic enhancer to regulate FOXO3 expression under stress conditions, which was significant in the context of cellular stress responses.
title: HSFs drive stress type-specific transcription of genes and enhancers

finding: This intronic variant associated with BACH2 indicated a conflicting regulation role since it increased T cell proliferation, diverging from normal effector responses.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The variant rs4839813, located in the FUT9 gene, was associated with obesity in the PheWAS related to the first GWAS. Raw p-values for this association were 2.3×10^-5, indicating a significant correlation with the phenotype of obesity.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: The SNP rs6597292 showed an association with EC4-specific peaks related to the BMP6 gene in coverage plots. This finding supported the involvement of this SNP in molecular mechanisms underlying the mesenchymal-like endothelial cell phenotype, which is significant in the context of coronary artery disease.
title: Single cell ‘omic profiles of human aortic endothelial cells in vitro and human atherosclerotic lesions ex vivo reveals heterogeneity of endothelial subtype and response to activating perturbations

finding: The OPRM1 variant rs179971 was associated with opioid use disorder (OUD) in human genetic studies, providing context for the relevance of Oprm1 SNPs in both the presented rodent study and human GWAS.
title: Opiate responses are controlled by interactions of Oprm1 and Fgf12 loci in rodents: Correspondence to human GWAS findings

finding: This SNP was highlighted as a missense mutation (N398S) in the transposase-derived domain of the PGBD1 gene. It presented as a significant finding due to its predicted role as a regulatory SNP and reinforcement of the association between PGBD1 and schizophrenia susceptibility. Its correlation was supported by a reduction in PGBD1 levels observed in schizophrenia patients.
title: PiggyBac Transposable Element-derived 1 controls Neuronal Progenitor Identity, Stress Sensing and mammal-specific paraspeckles

finding: SNP rs628031 was identified as exhibiting significant marginal epistasis (ME) for serum lipoprotein A levels (lipoA). This SNP is a non-synonymous polymorphism that alters methionine to valine in the protein product of the OCT1 gene (SLC22A1), which is involved in the uptake and efflux of cationic metabolites in the liver and has been implicated in drug response variation, especially to metformin in the context of type 2 diabetes.
title: A biobank-scale test of marginal epistasis reveals genome-wide signals of polygenic epistasis

finding: The SNP rs9277535 was identified as the most studied variation associated with the hepatitis B virus. It demonstrated a strong link with disease susceptibility across multiple populations, particularly in Asian and Central Asian countries including China, Japan, Turkey, Korea, and Indonesia. This extensive analysis provided insights into its relevance to infectious diseases and emphasized its importance in understanding SNP associations with HLA gene-disease correlations.
title: HLA-SPREAD: A Natural Language Processing based resource for curating HLA association from PubMed abstracts

finding: The study reported that polymorphisms at the locus rs806378 within the Cnr1 gene were associated with changes in cannabinoid receptor 1 (CB1) expression in patients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS). Specifically, the research highlighted increased CB1 mRNA expression in male subjects following non-model stress (NMS), which aligns with previous clinical observations linking this SNP to alterations in CB1 levels. This finding contributes to the understanding of the genetic factors that influence visceral hypersensitivity and gut motility related to DGBI.
title: Early life adversity promotes gastrointestinal dysfunction through a sex-dependent phenotypic switch in enteric glia

finding: The SNP rs12193216 was identified in the context of grapevine physiology characteristics as reported by Maimaitiyiming et al. in 2020. It pertained to the physiological indicators of grapevines which were characterized using high-resolution hyperspectral and thermal imaging, illustrating its relevance in understanding grapevine responses to environmental factors.
title: Genome assembly of the hybrid grapevine Vitis ‘Chambourcin’

finding: This SNP was attributed to the HLA locus, implicating multiple genes in potential telomere length influence.
title: Validation of human telomere length trans-ancestry meta-analysis association signals identifies POP5 and KBTBD6 as novel human telomere length regulation genes

finding: This SNP was linked to BAG6 indicating potential influence within the HLA locus on telomere length.
title: Validation of human telomere length trans-ancestry meta-analysis association signals identifies POP5 and KBTBD6 as novel human telomere length regulation genes

finding: This adjacent signal was attributed to POU5F1 and CCHCR1, suggesting involvement in telomere length regulation.
title: Validation of human telomere length trans-ancestry meta-analysis association signals identifies POP5 and KBTBD6 as novel human telomere length regulation genes

finding: The SNP rs12153855 in the TNXB gene was linked to age-related macular degeneration and atopic dermatitis. The study's findings contributed to understanding genetic predispositions for these conditions in the context of evolutionary pressures.
title: Fast and accurate estimation of selection coefficients and allele histories from ancient and modern DNA

finding: The SNP rs9380238 showed expression differences of HLA-C in CD4+ T cells, with fold changes ranging from 0.73 to 1.25 depending on genotype, linking HLA-C's role in self-antigen recognition to immune activity relevant in NSCLC.
title: Systemic CD8+ T cell effector signature predicts prognosis of lung cancer immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs141826798 located in the EGFL8 gene was identified as a risk variant for psoriasis in a genome-wide association study involving the UK BioBank. The study found that this variant was consistently observed across 7 individuals and 44 different tissues, with 98% of observations showing a proportion of reference reads below 0.65. Additionally, the SNP's position was 3 base pairs from the end of exon 4, and it was not associated with unusual splicing events or located in a long exon.
title: Nonsense-mediated decay is highly stable across individuals and tissues

finding: The rs1360780 SNP located within the FKBP5 gene was shown to influence FKBP5 gene expression (gex) differentially based on glucocorticoid stimulation. Minor allele (T) carriers exhibited the highest levels of FKBP5 gex following this stimulation. Moreover, while there was a significant main effect of case-status on FKBP5 gex across various psychiatric conditions (such as schizophrenia, major depression, and bipolar disorder), the genotype did not demonstrate an additive effect on FKBP5 gex.
title: Associations of psychiatric disease and aging on FKBP5 expression converge on cortical supragranular neurons

finding: The SNP rs17079281 was found to decrease lung cancer risk by creating a YY1-binding site that suppresses the expression of DCBLD1. This finding indicated a potential role of DCBLD1 in cancer progression, linking genetic variations with mechanisms that regulate angiogenesis and tumor biology.
title: DCBLD1 modulates angiogenesis by regulating of the VEGFR-2 endocytosis in endothelial cells

finding: The SNP rs660895 was also found to be significantly associated with GIP1 (P = 2×10−22) and located nearest to the HLA-DRB1/DQA1 loci. Similar to rs429358, it contributed to the association with self-rated health and resilience.
title: Genetically independent phenotype analysis identifies LPA and VCAM1 as drug targets for human ageing

finding: The SNP rs1885125 was found to participate in an epistatic interaction with the IRF1-targeting sgRNA to regulate MCM9 expression. This relationship accounted for 47% of the variability in MCM9 expression. The findings related to IRF1 underline its role in T cell activation and polarization, especially in Th1 responses. Epigenetic analyses suggested significant IRF1 binding at the MCM9 promoter, indicating the importance of this SNP in gene regulatory mechanisms.
title: Mapping gene regulatory networks of primary CD4+ T cells using single-cell genomics and genome engineering

finding: The SNP rs4946371 was linked to IRF1 binding predictions which suggest its involvement in the modulation of MCM9 expression in association with rs1885125. It was found in high linkage disequilibrium with rs1885125 (D' > 0.98) and contributes to the regulatory landscape critical for gene expression variability of MCM9 as influenced by IRF1. This highlights the SNP's relevance in shaping T cell responses.
title: Mapping gene regulatory networks of primary CD4+ T cells using single-cell genomics and genome engineering

finding: The RNA editing QTL (rs1049115) was shown to disrupt LIN28 regulations on splicing and editing events in adjacent genes, particularly affecting NQO2, which has roles in neurodegenerative pathogenesis.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: It was reported that the variant rs9349407 was correlated with increased risk for Alzheimer’s disease (AD) in Chinese populations, as indicated in a GWAS study by Gao et al. in 2022. This finding contributed to the evidence that genetic variations at the CD2AP locus were significant risk factors for AD.
title: CD2AP is Co-Expressed with Tropomyosin-Related Kinase A and Ras-Related Protein Rab-5A in Cholinergic Neurons of the Murine Basal Forebrain

finding: The variant rs7738720 was correlated with increased risk of AD pathophysiology in individuals of African ancestry, as noted in a GWAS study by Sherva et al. in 2023. This association further supported the role of CD2AP gene variants in the development of AD.
title: CD2AP is Co-Expressed with Tropomyosin-Related Kinase A and Ras-Related Protein Rab-5A in Cholinergic Neurons of the Murine Basal Forebrain

finding: SNP rs34247110 was recognized as a Tier 3 ancestry-related heterogeneity eQTL for the gene KCNK17. It exhibited significantly different effect sizes between populations with AFR_high and AFR_low ancestry, corroborated by a Cochran's Q p-value of 1.8×10^-10. Furthermore, this SNP was associated with type 2 diabetes in independent studies across various populations.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: The SNP rs3734618, part of the 95% credible sets for KCNK17, also displayed significant effect size differences between AFR_high and AFR_low populations, affirming its role as a Tier 3 ancestry-related heterogeneity eQTL.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: The SNP rs2180314 corresponded to a common cSNP identified in the GSTA2 gene, resulting in a Ser111 to Thr variant. This variant was associated with proteoform GSTA2, which showed a 14 Da mass shift from the canonical form, indicating that it was a consequence of this specific genetic variant. The SNP was prominent in the context of spatial localization in kidney tissue, specifically in the cortex region, and it was found to represent non-specific biallelic tissue expression. Furthermore, both proteoforms GSTA1 and GSTA2 were detected in similar abundances, highlighting the relevance of this SNP in gene expression studies and its impact on proteoform variability.
title: Direct Imaging and Identification of Proteoforms up to 70 kDa from Human Tissue

finding: Homozygous carriers of the T2D-protective allele at rs112498319 had a significant reduction in subcutaneous adipocyte area across all individuals, with notable reductions observed in both male and female carriers of the protective A allele.
title: Loss of RREB1 reduces adipogenesis and improves insulin sensitivity in mouse and human adipocytes

finding: SNP rs314267, associated with the 'LIN28B' gene, was found to be the most significant eQTL SNP in the region studied. Its MPRA significance indicated several functional SNPs in the locus, and it demonstrated consistent effect directions with brain eQTLs, strongly linking it to MDD and cross-psychiatric disorder risk.
title: Transcriptional-Regulatory Convergence Across Functional MDD Risk Variants Identified by Massively Parallel Reporter Assays

finding: The SNP rs6927172 was recognized as a causal SNP for pan-autoimmune diseases, demonstrating the effectiveness of nucleotide-level models in correctly prioritizing this variant.
title: Cross-species prediction of transcription factor binding by adversarial training of a novel nucleotide-level deep neural network

finding: The non-synonymous gain-of-function SNP rs1535500 (p.TALK-1 A277E) was associated with an increased risk of type-2 diabetes (T2D). Additionally, this SNP caused a significant increase in total cholesterol levels in a Han Chinese population, suggesting its role in metabolic disorders.
title: The MODY-associated TALK-1 L114P mutation causes islet α-cell overactivity and β-cell inactivity resulting in transient neonatal diabetes and glucose dyshomeostasis in adults

finding: The variant rs116772905 in the DDR1 gene showed significant association with microalbuminuria with an odds ratio of 3.78, indicating an important role in renal disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: rs118124843, which is located near the DDR1 gene, achieved genome-wide significance for microalbuminuria, emphasizing its role in collagen-related pathways affecting renal health.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The rs12523822 SNP was replicated and was associated with diabetic kidney disease with a significance of P=6.8x10^-4 in comparison to control.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The analysis identified rs7741021 as one of the shared causal signals between circulating RSPO3 abundance and estimated bone mineral density (eBMD). This finding highlighted the role of rs7741021 in the overlapping genetic signals of both traits.
title: SharePro: an accurate and efficient genetic colocalization method accounting for multiple causal signals

finding: rs9482773 was also found to be a shared causal signal between circulating RSPO3 abundance and eBMD. This indicated that rs9482773 contributed to the colocalization results and suggests its importance in the genetic architecture of these phenotypes.
title: SharePro: an accurate and efficient genetic colocalization method accounting for multiple causal signals

finding: The analysis revealed that rs853974 served as a shared causal signal for both circulating RSPO3 abundance and eBMD, demonstrating its significant involvement in the overlapping genetic influences on these traits.
title: SharePro: an accurate and efficient genetic colocalization method accounting for multiple causal signals

finding: The SNP rs13215577 was associated with variable expression levels of the disialoganglioside GD2, which was notably expressed in a subset of prostate cancer patients, particularly in metastatic tumors. This finding supported the concept that GD2 contributes to tumorigenesis and might play a role in cancer stem cell maintenance in advanced prostate cancer.
title: GD2 and its biosynthetic enzyme GD3 synthase promote tumorigenesis in prostate cancer by regulating cancer stem cell behavior

finding: The study demonstrated that rs6932603, a single-nucleotide polymorphism in the CCDC170 gene's 3' untranslated region, had differential binding by miR-544a, which suppressed the expression of the T allele relative to the C allele. This lower expression of the T allele in 293T and U2OS cells was linked to an increased risk of osteoporosis, indicating the SNP's potential etiological role in the disease.
title: Risk variant in miR-544a binding site in CCDC170 is associated with osteoporosis

finding: In the study of a large cohort of 770 men, SNP rs3777457 was found to be loosely associated with type 2 diabetes within the Japanese population, with a reported significance of p=6 x 10^-7. This association indicated a potential link between genetic variants of ASRA and the regulation of glucose metabolism relevant to type 2 diabetes.
title: A brown fat-enriched adipokine, ASRA, is a leptin receptor antagonist that stimulates appetite

finding: The SNP was noted for its interaction effects within specific immune cell types, especially in the context of gene expression variability concerning HLA-B regions.
title: Genetic variants associated with cell-type-specific intra-individual gene expression variability reveal new mechanisms of genome regulation

finding: The SNP rs2693076 was associated with increased LINC00680 expression and downregulation of immune genes like LAIR1 and PLEK in immune cell types, influencing macrophage regulation.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs4148876 was associated with TAP2 gene expression and has previously been linked to type 2 diabetes risk.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs2621321 was significantly associated with TAP2 expression and implicated in conditions such as strep throat and psoriatic arthritis.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The minor allele of rs1143146 was associated with decreased HLA-A expression and lower infiltration of CD8 and CD4 T cells, correlating with worse overall survival in certain cancers.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The major allele of rs2844806 was linked to decreased HLA-A expression; patients with both HLA-A variants showed poorer survival outcomes in pancreatic and rectal adenocarcinoma.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs7751376 was associated with macrophage infiltration and linked to various malignant neoplasms, suggesting a macrophage-mediated etiology for certain cancers.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs6922269, located in the MTHFD1L gene, was found to be positively associated with cardiovascular mortality in males after acute coronary syndrome. This finding was initially reported by Hubacek et al. in 2015 and further corroborated by Palmer et al. in 2014, indicating a relationship between this genetic polymorphism and survival as well as baseline active vitamin B12 levels in patients following acute coronary syndromes.
title: Aberrant tissue stiffness impairs neural tube development in Mthfd1l mutant mouse embryos

finding: The study reported that the interaction between childhood abuse and the SNP rs1360780 of the FKBP5 gene was associated with alterations in amygdala resting-state functional connectivity in young adults. This finding implied that the genetic predisposition represented by rs1360780 could modulate how childhood abuse affected brain connectivity, which is crucial for understanding its implications on emotional resilience and disorders.
title: Genetic-Dependent Brain Signatures of Resilience: Interactions among Childhood Abuse, Genetic Risks and Brain Function

finding: The variant rs118039278 located in an intron of LPA was identified in CRISPR screens with a significant effect on ICAM1 expression (FDR < 0.001). Although LPA is not expressed in teloHAEC, the CRISPR activation could induce its ectopic expression, which has been linked to endothelial dysfunction.
title: CRISPR perturbations at many coronary artery disease loci impair vascular endothelial cell functions

finding: The association of SNP rs2250287 with TRBV19 was strong, indicated by a beta of 0.760 and a p-value of 7.93 x 10^-13, highlighting its importance in determining TCR repertoire for immune responses.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: The SNP rs62395263 was identified as a top secondary SNP associated with TRBV19, showing a beta of 0.705 and a p-value of 2.96 x 10^-7, further supporting the complexity of SNP interactions influencing TCR usage.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: SNP rs3763288 was significantly associated with the K-mer TSGDYNE in the beta chain, presenting a beta of 1.12 and a p-value of 2.66 x 10^-10, occurring within an intronic region of MICA, related to immune response regulation.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: The rs10305492 variant (Ala316Thr) was identified as a gain-of-function missense SNP associated with lower fasting glucose and reduced risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D) and cardiovascular disease. In a humanized knock-in mouse model, this variant exhibited characteristics suggesting constitutive receptor activation, improved glucose tolerance, and lower fasting blood glucose levels. The results supported earlier genome-wide association studies (GWAS) linking this SNP to better glycaemic traits.
title: In vivo functional profiling and structural characterisation of the human Glp1r A316T variant

finding: The SNP rs7772714 was associated with KCNQ5, a gene that was found to be downregulated in individuals with MDD. Treatment with amitriptyline resulted in upregulation of KCNQ5 expression, indicating its potential role in signaling pathways relevant to AD response. This finding highlighted the significance of this SNP in the context of MDD pathogenesis and treatment outcomes.
title: Multi-omic modeling of antidepressant response implicates dynamic immune and inflammatory changes in individuals who respond to treatment

finding: The R47H mutation in TREM2 showed strong association with Alzheimer's disease, with substantial improvement in significance over previous studies, confirming its impact on disease risk.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs2270450 SNP was associated with SLC25A27 (UCP4), a gene involved in neuronal metabolism and previously linked to schizophrenia and Parkinson's disease.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The rs1800562 variant, associated with the homeostatic iron regulator gene (HFE), exhibited voxel-wise associations in several brain areas including the putamen and cerebellar regions. This gene is linked to iron absorption, and its mutations can lead to hereditary hemochromatosis.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs1799945 C>G in HFE, associated with hemochromatosis type 1, showed lower allele frequencies in Vietnamese and East Asian populations compared to the world population, with values of 5.10%, 3.41%, and 10.82% respectively, indicating marked discrepancies in allele frequency across populations.
title: Genetic profiling of Vietnamese population from large-scale genomic analysis of non-invasive prenatal testing data

finding: The SNP rs1126506 was linked to the gene HLA-DPA1 and was associated with anti-rubella IgG levels in the South Asian population. This strong selection signal suggests that this variant has been under evolutionary pressure related to immune responses.
title: Improved detection of evolutionary selection highlights potential bias from different sequencing strategies in complex genomic-regions

finding: The SNP rs2305089 was strongly associated with the risk of developing chordoma in European populations, with an odds ratio of 6.1. This variant causes a glycine to aspartate substitution in the brachyury DNA binding domain. Despite unclear details regarding the precise role of this substitution in protein function and chordoma pathology, it was suggested by previous in vitro assays to possibly influence DNA binding.
title: Structures of the human transcription factor brachyury offer insights into DNA recognition, and identify small molecule binders for the development of degraders for cancer therapy

finding: The SNP rs13215506 was linked to cyclin-dependent kinase (CDK) activity regulation. This SNP played a role in the inhibition of phosphorylation processes essential for histone production during the cell cycle's G1/S transition, according to findings from a study focusing on therapies targeting CDK.
title: Cyclin E/CDK2 and feedback from soluble histone protein regulate the S phase burst of histone biosynthesis

finding: The rs2781666 SNP in the ARG1 gene was found to confer a significant risk of T2DM, emphasizing the gene's potential contribution to metabolic disturbances.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The rs2781665 SNP in the ARG1 gene was also shown to be significantly associated with T2DM risk, reinforcing the role of arginase in insulin resistance.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The rs2010963 polymorphism in the VEGF gene was linked to T2DM, suggesting its role in angiogenesis and potential implications for diabetic complications.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs117391865, an intronic variant near SYNE1, was associated with androstenone perception and reached genome-wide significance in the discovery cohort (p<1.35×10^-8).
title: From musk to body odor: decoding olfaction through genetic variation

finding: The SNP rs3129158 in OR2J2 was identified with significant associations surrounding the LD band for pleasantness perception of cis-3-hexen-1-ol (p<2.3×10^-4).
title: From musk to body odor: decoding olfaction through genetic variation

finding: The eQTL variant rs113520162 for the gene IER3 had a significant GxC effect reflecting variation across cell differentiation. This effect was explained primarily by the first MOFA component, indicating that the genetic regulation was notably context-specific and associated with cellular differentiation stages.
title: CellRegMap: A statistical framework for mapping context-specific regulatory variants using scRNA-seq

finding: The eQTL variant rs506770 for the gene HSPA1A was associated with GxC effects observed across different MOFA factors. This indicated that higher order cellular contexts, such as cell cycle phases, were relevant in modulating genetic effects on gene expression.
title: CellRegMap: A statistical framework for mapping context-specific regulatory variants using scRNA-seq

finding: For SNP rs9270493, a significant connection to the upregulation of the L1 family gene set was observed through eQTL analysis, reinforcing its role in transposable element regulation.
title: A Computational Approach for the Identification of Novel L1 Transcriptional Regulators

finding: Similar to rs9270493, SNP rs9272222 was found as a significant trans-eQTL for L1MEb expression, further implying its role in transposable element regulation although specific phenotypic impacts were less detailed.
title: A Computational Approach for the Identification of Novel L1 Transcriptional Regulators

finding: This SNP was associated with total tau measures, showing nominal significance, indicating its relevance in AD pathology but did not reach genome-wide significance.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The rs598493 SNP was identified as one of the top candidate SNPs with the highest score and was likely a sweep-driving mutation associated with risk loci for autoimmune disorders.
title: Prioritising Autoimmunity Risk Variants for Functional Analyses by Fine-Mapping Mutations Under Natural Selection

finding: The rs1360780 SNP in FKBP5 was significantly associated with CES-D scores, especially when social stressors were included in the model. Participants with a T allele at rs1360780 and high financial strain exhibited the highest mean CES-D scores, indicating a link between this genetic variant and increased susceptibility to depression in the context of social stress.
title: Financial strain and stressful social environment drive depressive symptoms, while FKBP5 variant intensifies the effect, in African Americans living in Tallahassee

finding: The SNP rs13204048 matched the reference k-mer 'TGACTC', aligning with the motif of transcription factor FOS. Like rs56167332, it was among the top 100 SNPs analyzed, showcasing a relationship between its ΔMOCCS2score implications and FOS binding, further supporting the predictive claims regarding changes in TF binding specificity driven by non-coding GWAS-SNPs.
title: MOCCS profile analysis clarifies the cell type dependency of transcription factor-binding sequences and cis-regulatory SNPs in humans

finding: This SNP was noted for being part of the significant associations for HDL, displaying correlations with rs6917603 and another copy of itself in repeated measures.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The SNP rs2397118 (c.558A>G) was heterozygous in three of five samples and was linked to an Alu insertion in the 3'UTR of GHR (c.*+413_+422insAlu). This Alu mutation led to allele silencing in all carriers, indicating a potential regulatory impact of the insertion on gene expression.
title: A systematic screen of breast cancer patients’ exomes for retrotransposon insertions reveals disease associated genes

finding: The eQTL rs9266234 of gene CCHCR1 had the T allele preferentially binding POUF2F and TBP, which was associated with an increased burst size and decreased burst frequency. This was observed despite a flip genotype in another sample, GM18502, indicating consistent effects.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The SNP rs9271588 was both an eQTL and a GWAS catalog variant for HLA-DQA1. The T allele induced preferential binding of SRF, which was associated with higher burst frequency and larger transcription variance. The T allele was confirmed to have higher TF binding affinity than the C allele.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The eQTL rs72844311 was shown to induce ASB of BHLHE40 at the C allele while being in phase with the T allele of rs9271588. This association contributed to increased burst frequency and decreased burst size consistent with observations in GM18502.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The SNP rs112243036 was also identified with genome-wide significance, showing a nominal p-value of 7.0 × 10^-21 in the FAMHE analysis. It confirmed previous associations reported by the original study and is relevant to HIV-1 disease progression.
title: Truly Privacy-Preserving Federated Analytics for Precision Medicine with Multiparty Homomorphic Encryption

finding: The SNP rs17079281 was found to decrease lung cancer risk by creating a YY1-binding site which suppresses the expression of DCBLD1. This discovery was crucial as it indicated a specific genetic mechanism contributing to the modulation of lung cancer predisposition.
title: Perspectives on Codebook: sequence specificity of uncharacterized human transcription factors

finding: Identified for the first time as being associated with POAG, this SNP is located within the HLA gene region and was linked to several other traits. Its mechanism of action may involve intraocular pressure (IOP), supported by a significant association in IOP GWAS (P=8.8e-06).
title: A large cross-ancestry meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies 69 novel risk loci for primary open-angle glaucoma and includes a genetic link with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This SNP was identified in a GWAS meta-analysis and was in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with SNPs in the SLC35F1 gene, suggesting its relevance to various neurological and psychiatric phenotypes. This association was tied to delay discounting behaviors, which are linked to substance use disorders.
title: Genome-wide association study of delay discounting in Heterogenous Stock rats

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with educational attainment in a GWAS meta-analysis involving three million individuals, highlighting a connection with cognitive traits. The findings related to educational attainment were noted as being inversely associated with delay discounting, meaning individuals with steeper discounting had lower educational achievements.
title: Genome-wide association study of delay discounting in Heterogenous Stock rats

finding: Similar to rs11755280, this SNP showed significant association with educational attainment in the updated GWAS. The implications tied educational outcomes to behavioral traits, such as delay discounting, linking behavioral economics with genetic predispositions.
title: Genome-wide association study of delay discounting in Heterogenous Stock rats

finding: SNP rs3135388 was previously reported to be associated with atrial fibrillation and multiple sclerosis in the context of its relationship with gene HLA-DRB1. This association was confirmed through phenome-wide association study findings.
title: HCLC-FC: a novel statistical method for phenome-wide association studies

finding: SNP rs3129716 was identified in the study as being associated with 28 distinct phenotypic blocks, with 16 of those blocks confirmed in the GWAS catalog as being significantly associated with the SNP. This SNP mapped to genes HLA-DQB1 and MTCO3P1, highlighting its potential relevance in various phenotypes.
title: HCLC-FC: a novel statistical method for phenome-wide association studies

finding: Rs601945 was linked to HLA-DQA2 and demonstrated to influence multiple HLA genes across all twelve tissues. Its association with alterations in the expression of numerous immune-related pathways provided significant insights into the genetic predisposition to type 2 diabetes (T2D).
title: Understanding functional consequences of type 2 diabetes risk loci using the universal data integration and visualization R package CONQUER

finding: The SNP rs1074287 exhibited a nominally significant correlation with MOR coupling efficiency. Carriers of the minor G allele displayed a higher potency of the DAMGO agonist, although the result did not pass multiple testing correction. This SNP was suggested to affect MOR protein abundance without significantly influencing MOR expression. The findings indicated a potential involvement in the modulation of MOR function related to psychopathological circumstances.
title: Increased functional coupling of the mu opioid receptor in the anterior insula of depressed individuals

finding: The SNP rs1933801 also showed a significant gender difference in allele effect sizes, achieving a p value of 4.65×10^-6 for the difference. The respective male and female p values were 2.40×10^-26 and 1.30×10^-6, providing insights into its role in lean mass.
title: Genome-wide association study of appendicular lean mass in UK Biobank cohort

finding: The SNP rs76735376 was identified in an epigenome-wide analysis and found to significantly impact lipoprotein(a) [Lp(a)] concentrations. The minor allele of rs76735376, which had a minor allele frequency of 1.1%, was associated with increased Lp(a) values (p=1.01e-59) and explained 3.5% of the variation in Lp(a). Importantly, this effect was attributed to the base change itself rather than DNA methylation levels. eQTL data from liver tissue confirmed that the minor allele was associated with increased LPA expression. This study highlighted rs76735376 as a novel regulatory SNP in the LPA promoter affecting cardiovascular risk.
title: A genome-wide analysis of DNA methylation identifies a novel association signal for Lp(a) concentrations in the LPA promoter

finding: The SNP rs2076177 was associated with enhanced expression in the DMR of HLA-F in rejectors, indicating its role in modulation of gene expression related to transplant rejection. This finding was contextualized within dynamic methylation changes impacting MHC-dependent rejection pathways.
title: The role of dynamic DNA methylation in liver transplant rejection in children

finding: The SNP rs1736924 was linked to decreased expression and splicing in the DMR of HLA-F among rejectors. This alteration was relevant to understanding how sequence variants may influence transplant-related immune responses and highlight gene regulatory mechanisms involved in acute cellular rejection.
title: The role of dynamic DNA methylation in liver transplant rejection in children

finding: The SNP rs9273375 was identified in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) as being significantly associated with Lyme disease, with a P-value of 6.53×10^(-11). This SNP was located at the 3' end of the HLA-DQB1 gene, a region known for its impact on immune response and predisposition to infectious diseases, indicating the critical role of the HLA region in susceptibility to Lyme disease.
title: Secretoglobin family 1D member 2 (SCGB1D2) protein inhibits growth of Borrelia burgdorferi and affects susceptibility to Lyme disease

finding: The SNP rs13194820 was linked to chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) patients, where higher levels of histone H1 abounded among individuals exhibiting resistance to imatinib, a common treatment for CML. This association underscored the SNP's potential as a predictor of treatment response. Furthermore, it was noted that non-responder patients demonstrated lower proportions of specific H1 subtypes—H1.0, H1.1, and H1X—compared to responders, suggesting that variations at this SNP might contribute to resistance mechanisms.
title: Quantification of histone H1 subtypes using targeted proteomics

finding: The SNP rs141393446 was linked to loss of ZNF292 as a positive finding.
title: Germline determinants of the prostate tumor genome

finding: The SNP rs59084763 lay in an intergenic region downstream of ARHGAP18, showing a strong association with susceptibility to heterotopic ossification (HO). It reported an odds ratio (OR) of 1.87 with a genome-wide significance p-value of 2.48×10^-8, indicating a significant role in the genetic predisposition to HO.
title: Genome-wide association and functional analyses identify CASC20 and KIF26B as target loci in heterotopic ossification

finding: The SNP rs3129791 was found on chromosome 6 and was part of a region associated with general happiness. It was noted that this locus is located in the major histocompatibility complex (MHC), which contains many genes involved in neural development, potentially influencing individuals' happiness levels.
title: A Genome-Wide Association Analysis of Happiness: Consistent Genetic Effects Across the Lifespan and Across Genetic Ancestries in Multiple Cohorts

finding: The variant rs1891308 near ADGRG6 was linked to increased torso length. Conditional knockout mice for ADGRG6 showed abnormalities in spine structure and alignment that correlated with a reduction in torso length, highlighting this SNP's significance in skeletal proportions.
title: The genetic architecture of the human skeletal form

finding: Identified as a progenitor eSNP, rs4897179 was colocalized with GWAS index SNP rs9388490 related to both Global Surface Area (GSA) and Educational Attainment (EA). This SNP affected CENPW gene expression, linking it to brain morphology and cognitive function.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: This SNP served as an index variant for GWAS associated with Global Surface Area (GSA) and Educational Attainment (EA). Its colocalization with progenitor eSNP rs4897179 suggested a mechanistic pathway involving CENPW regulation impacting cognitive functions.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: Variant rs9388486 disrupted transcription factor binding motifs in the promoter of the CENPW gene. Its C allele was linked to decreased chromatin accessibility, resulting in reduced CENPW expression, which was connected to neurogenesis and brain development.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: In the analyzed study, SNP rs10807491 was found to be specifically associated with heel Bone Mineral Density (BMD). This association was highlighted within the context of understanding metabolic mediators' role in chronic inflammation-related bone loss. Elevated GDF15 levels in arthritis patients correlated inversely with bone density, thereby emphasizing the significance of this SNP in relation to bone health.
title: GDF15 mediates inflammation-associated bone loss through a brain-bone axis

finding: The GPLD1 coding variant rs146351134 was identified as associated with ALP and was noted to be particularly rare in European populations, emphasizing the unique genetic landscape of African ancestry individuals.
title: Analyses of Biomarker Traits in Diverse UK Biobank Participants Identify Associations Missed by European-centric Analysis Strategies

finding: In the TNXB gene, variant rs201510617 was one of three variants predicted to be deleterious. It was found to affect conserved domains linked to tissue elasticity and integrity, contributing to the severity of CMS.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: Variant rs144415985 in TNXB gene was predicted to be deleterious. It, along with other variants, contributed to the understanding of how genetic variants could lead to extreme phenotypic expressions within CMS.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: The variant rs367685759 in TNXB was identified as deleterious, affecting critical conserved domains that are essential for muscle and connective tissue function, thus linking it to severe CMS phenotypes.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: The SNP rs10660361 was identified as a significant finding in a GWAS of chronic pain (CP) and was also associated with back pain and multisite chronic pain. It was located in the intronic region of the gene LEMD2 on chromosome 5. Additionally, this SNP was strongly associated with anthropometric traits, including height, BMI, body fat percentage, and platelet count.
title: Genetic, lifestyle and environmental risk factors for chronic pain revealed through GWAS

finding: rs2232429 was located at an intronic region of ZSCAN12 and was found at a genome-wide significant level with a P-value of 2.06 × 10−8. This SNP contributed to a genomic region in chromosome 6, which was implicated in the genetic make-up of a common factor influencing schizophrenia (SCZ), bipolar disorder (BD), and major depressive disorder (MDD). This finding highlighted the relevance of ZSCAN12 in the pathophysiology of these psychiatric disorders.
title: Spatial expression pattern of ZNF391 gene in the brains of patients with schizophrenia, bipolar disorders or major depressive disorder identifies new cross-disorder biotypes: A trans-diagnostic, top-down approach

finding: The rs7746199-ZNF391 pair was prioritized in the study with the highest consensus posterior probability (PP = 0.96), suggesting a strong link between this SNP and the potential causal core gene ZNF391. The fine-mapping analysis revealed that the expression of ZNF391 decreased significantly in relation to mental and behavioral traits, mainly schizophrenia, hinting at its critical role in influencing working memory and associated biotypes.
title: Spatial expression pattern of ZNF391 gene in the brains of patients with schizophrenia, bipolar disorders or major depressive disorder identifies new cross-disorder biotypes: A trans-diagnostic, top-down approach

finding: The SNP rs9349205 was shown to be linked to the regulatory element of CCND3 and was characterized by reduced chromatin accessibility and expression during erythroid differentiation. This demonstrated its specific impact on red blood cell traits.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The analysis of rs1413354854 revealed that this rare high-frequency variant (HSV) significantly alters the motif patterns and drives expression predictions for the gene ZFP57. It was found to be located within a weakly active enhancer, and the alternative allele created a binding site for NFKB2 and/or RELA, enhancing regulatory interactions.
title: Deep-learning prediction of gene expression from personal genomes

finding: For rs3117299, a common high-frequency variant (HSV), the findings indicated that it also drives expression predictions for ZFP57 but falls within a quiescent chromatin region. The alternative allele was shown to create binding sites for several blood transcription factors, reflecting its potential role in gene regulation.
title: Deep-learning prediction of gene expression from personal genomes

finding: The SNP rs9486902 was linked to bone mineral density (BMD) and was located at the promoter region of the human gene FOXO3. Using the AdaLiftOver tool, this SNP was successfully mapped to the mouse orthologue at the promoter region of Foxo3, demonstrating the utility of AdaLiftOver in rescuing SNPs that could not be mapped using the UCSC liftOver. Additionally, it was noted that the human and mouse orthologous regions shared common transcription factor binding sites relevant for BMD regulation.
title: AdaLiftOver: High-resolution identification of orthologous regulatory elements with adaptive liftOver

finding: The SNP rs7757969 was identified as an intronic marker on the FYN gene, significantly associated with schizophrenia. It demonstrated a strong association with a p-value of 4.8*10^{-8}, highlighting its relevance in this psychiatric condition. The gene FYN plays a critical role in neuronal apoptosis, brain development, and synaptic transmission, and its lower expression was notably found in the platelets of schizophrenic patients compared to controls, indicating its potential importance in the pathology of schizophrenia.
title: A General Statistic to Test an Optimally Weighted Combination of Common and/or Rare Variants

finding: The SNP rs9497673 was replicated in the study, showing a significant association with colorectal cancer risk. It was reported to be located within the intronic region of the STXBP5-AS1 gene on chromosome 6. The finding was part of an association analysis, reinforcing the prior identifications of this SNP's relevance to colorectal cancer.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Colorectal Cancer in Multiethnic Indonesians

finding: The SNP rs6936461 was also successfully replicated, reflecting a significant link to colorectal cancer risk. Located in the intronic region of the STXBP5-AS1 gene on chromosome 6, this finding supported previous studies and highlighted the gene's involvement in colorectal cancer pathogenesis.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Colorectal Cancer in Multiethnic Indonesians

finding: The SNP rs7758229 showed a statistically significant association with colorectal cancer (p=0.009, OR of 2.2) in the Indonesian population. Originally identified in a Japanese cohort with an odds ratio of 1.3, this replication demonstrated its importance in different ethnicities concerning colorectal cancer risk.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Colorectal Cancer in Multiethnic Indonesians

finding: The SNP rs185691679 significantly disrupted the target site in the miRNA seed region for hsa-miR-3692-5p, with a conservation score of 6. This mutation may lead to alterations in the expression levels of the CCR5 protein due to its interference with miRNA targeting.
title: In silico analysis of single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) in human C-C chemokine receptor type five (CCR5) gene

finding: The SNP rs13215519 was found to enhance the capture and preservation of CTCs when samples were immediately fixed. The study emphasized its potential role in standardizing microfluidic approaches to CTC analysis, highlighting its significance in improving diagnostic methodologies for pancreatic and head and neck cancers.
title: Biases in the Parsortix® system observed with pancreatic cancer cell lines

finding: The variant rs9468925 was associated with both psoriasis and vitiligo, supporting a shared MHC-I driven etiology which aligns with clinical findings of disease co-occurrence.
title: Autoimmune Alleles at the Major Histocompatibility Locus Modify Melanoma Susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs9394312 was found to have a significant interaction with disease status on the expression of FKBP5. Specifically, the minor allele of this SNP conferred higher FKBP5 expression in control subjects but lower expression in cases of alcohol dependence, indicating its potential role in the modulation of FKBP5 and its involvement in the severity of alcohol withdrawal and problematic drinking patterns.
title: Assessing the role of long-noncoding RNA in nucleus accumbens in subjects with alcohol dependence

finding: The SNP rs10004 was found to be polymorphic in the population, encoding either serine or leucine at the SSR1 site. This polymorphism influenced the recognition of the SSR1-derived antigen by T cells. The study demonstrated that while monocytes from healthy donors carrying the SSR1-S epitope could induce T cell responses, not all healthy cells presented the TAP-independent SSR1 antigen effectively. This indicated the variability in TAP-independent antigen presentation among different healthy cell types, emphasizing the need for extensive testing to identify clinically relevant targets for T cell-based immunotherapy.
title: Healthy cells functionally present TAP-independent SSR1 peptides: implications for selection of clinically relevant antigens

finding: Similar to rs147398495, the rs381218 variant located at the HLA-DOA locus demonstrated significant in silico mutation effects on transcription. It was validated by reporter assays in previous studies, thereby serving as a lead variant and supporting the results from the MENTR predictions regarding its effects on ncRNA transcription.
title: Predicting cell-type-specific non-coding RNA transcription from genome sequence

finding: The analysis indicated that the coding variant rs9379084 (p.Asp1171Asn) was identified as a causal variant with a 92% posterior probability for type 2 diabetes (T2D). This variant encoded a protein likely to have a detrimental effect on RREB1 function, correlating with lower risk of developing T2D and lower fasting glucose levels in carriers of the minor allele.
title: Loss of RREB1 in pancreatic beta cells reduces cellular insulin content and affects endocrine cell gene expression

finding: Carriers of the rs112498319 T2D-risk allele (C) had, on average, lower glucose-stimulated insulin secretion compared to non-carriers. This finding implied that this variant had a significant association with impaired islet function, supporting the hypothesis that RREB1 impacts human pancreatic islet activity.
title: Loss of RREB1 in pancreatic beta cells reduces cellular insulin content and affects endocrine cell gene expression

finding:
The SNP rs76960013 was linked to a low frequency variant with an allele frequency of 0.0414 and was associated with a strong odds ratio of 3.95 (
P = 1.18×10^-13). This variant was in linkage disequilibrium with a non-synonymous variant c.2528G>A (p.G843E), which contributed significantly to the genetic diagnosis of autosomal recessive retinitis pigmentosa (ARRP) in the studied Japanese population.
title: Systematic detection of Mendelian and non-Mendelian variants associated with retinitis pigmentosa by genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs59178556 was associated with a common nonsynonymous variant c.7666A>T (p.S2556C), displaying a higher allele frequency of 0.2161 and a lower odds ratio of 1.83 (P = 3.79×10^-10). This finding was significant in recognizing additional genetic risks linked to ARRP and was characterized as benign/likely benign.
title: Systematic detection of Mendelian and non-Mendelian variants associated with retinitis pigmentosa by genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs79476654 was associated with an extremely low frequency of 0.0005 and displayed a notable odds ratio of 16.46 (P = 2.45×10^-8). This SNP was in linkage disequilibrium with a well-known founder mutation c.4957dupA (p.S1653Kfs), indicating a critical genetic risk factor for ARRP in the Asian cohort.
title: Systematic detection of Mendelian and non-Mendelian variants associated with retinitis pigmentosa by genome-wide association study

finding: Similarly, rs2750415, located in the intron of REPS1, was also associated with cardiometabolic diseases in type 2 diabetes, including coronary artery disease and chronic kidney disease. Additionally, it acted as a splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) for skeletal muscle, indicating its role in muscle-specific gene regulation.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: Associated with lipid traits, rs62441843 was another lead variant located between REPS1 and ABRACL, further underscoring its importance in metabolic profiles among the studied traits.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: This variant was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for muscle tissue, establishing its connection to muscle-specific gene expression, which may influence metabolic health.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: The SNP rs200307517 was associated with leisure screen time, indicating a behavioral link that could relate to sedentary lifestyles and their potential impact on metabolic health.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: The SNP rs3817963 at 6p21.32 was associated with lung adenocarcinoma and had the highest PBS score in the Senegalese branch of the studied populations. Its allele frequencies were significantly different across Africa: 33.9% in Senegal, 12.9% in Ghana, 10.4% in Nigeria, and 8.4% in South Africa, resulting in p-values < 0.0001 for pairwise comparisons with Senegal.
title: A custom genotyping array reveals population-level heterogeneity for the genetic risks of prostate cancer and other cancers in Africa

finding: This SNP had an exceptionally strong association (p = 5.0×10-160) in the overall analysis, classified as a missense variant in the AGER gene. It had prior associations with COPD and lung function, marking it as a significant discovery.
title: Omnibus Inverse Normal Transformation Based Association Test Improves Power in Genome-Wide Association Studies of Quantitative Traits

finding: rs2747652 was particularly associated with HER2-positive subtypes, contributing to the understanding of HER2 heterogeneity.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: rs9397437 showed strong evidence for association with TN disease with an OR of 1.30 and P=8.26×10^-23.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This SNP demonstrated substantial association with TN disease (OR=1.15, P=1.24×10^-19) and was associated with ER and grade.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Documented associations with HR-negative disease across studies.
