title: Genome-wide association studies identify 137 loci for DNA methylation biomarkers of ageing

finding: The T allele at rs13204742 (G>T) was deemed protective for type 1 diabetes with early diagnosis and coeliac disease. However, it was also found to be associated with susceptibility to irritable bowel disease. The findings suggested that increased expression of THEMIS would potentially lead to a higher risk of type 1 diabetes diagnosed before age 7 by affecting T cell development and survival.
title: Specific type 1 diabetes risk genes underpin age-at-diagnosis and indicate joint defects in immunity, beta-cell fragility and responses to viral infections in early-onset disease

finding: SNP rs1800629 was classified as a dNMD-QTL, influencing the decay efficiency of NMD-transcripts from the genes HLA-C and ATP6V1G2-DDX39B. This SNP was mapped to be related to 58 diseases, with a notable focus on 18 diseases associated with neoplastic processes, highlighting its potential significance in cancer biology.
title: Mapping genetic variants for nonsense-mediated mRNA decay regulation across human tissues

finding: The SNP rs2003916 was identified as having differential effects between individuals with interstitial lung disease (ILD) and unaffected donors specifically in four tested epithelial cell types. This SNP was linked to the gene DSP, which had three top interaction eQTL (int-eQTL) showing that despite being widely expressed, its expression levels were significantly affected by the presence of different regulatory loci in the two groups, indicating context-specific regulatory effects in relation to lung disease.
title: Cell type-specific and disease-associated eQTL in the human lung

finding: The A allele at rs3130008 decreased the gene expression variability of the RPS18 gene in T cells treated with PHA+DEX. RPS18 is implicated in multiple autoimmune conditions.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The genetic polymorphism at rs9260584 conferred opposite effects on both mean and variability of the HLA-A gene expression, which is associated with asthma and several autoimmune disorders.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs3135388 was identified as a tag SNP associated with the HLA allele HLA-DRB1*15:01. This allele has a strong association with multiple sclerosis. In the context of a convolutional neural network (CNN) analysis, evidence suggested that the model relied heavily on rs3135388 for accurate imputation of HLA-DRB1*15:01, as demonstrated by a significant drop in probability when K-mers around this tag SNP were masked.
title: HLA Allele Imputation with Multitask Deep Convolutional Neural Network

finding: The SNP rs13215495 was implicated in the context of CD8+ T cell recruitment and activation in the setting of dipeptidyl peptidase inhibition, particularly in relation to the enhancement of inflammasome activity in a murine model. This finding suggested a correlation between this SNP and immune responses relevant to both HIV-infected states and the activation of inflammatory pathways, specifically associated with CD8+ T lymphocytes.
title: NLRP3 and NLRP1/CARD8 pathways differently contribute to pyroptosis of CD8+ T cells of ART-treated HIV patients

finding: The SNP rs13205246 was associated with immune responses against cancer, specifically indicating that variations in this region might influence the functions of Cancer-Associated Fibroblasts (CAFs) as reported in the study by De et al. (2021). This finding illustrated how genetic variations could potentially modulate the effectiveness of CAR-T therapies in stroma-rich tumor environments.
title: Stromal depletion by TALEN-edited universal hypoimmunogenic FAP-CAR T cells enables infiltration and anti-tumor cytotoxicity of tumor antigen-targeted CAR-T immunotherapy

finding: rs6914622 was shown to be constrained in mammals and primates, with phyloP scores of 2.37 and a PIP of 0.76 in the baseline-LF+Zoonomia model, indicating a potential association with hypothyroidism. This was significant as it was actively involved as an enhancer in thyroid cell types, supporting a causal role.
title: Leveraging Base Pair Mammalian Constraint to Understand Genetic Variation and Human Disease

finding: The SNP rs9271602 located in the HLA-DR/DQ region showed a highly significant association with steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome (SSNS), confirmed by the GWAS with a p-value of 1.12×10^{-27} and an odds ratio of 2.75. This finding replicated across multiple studies.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2746432 in the AHI1 gene was identified as a novel risk factor for SSNS with a significant p-value of 2.79×10^{-8} and an odds ratio of 1.37 in trans-ethnic meta-analysis, replicating in a South Asian cohort. AHI1 is associated with immune dysregulation.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs9391784 was identified as a second independent signal associated with SSNS with a p-value of 1.16×10^{-15} in conditional analysis, indicating that it contributes to the disease risk alongside rs9271602.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs17212846 exhibited a third signal of association for SSNS, with a genome-wide significant p-value of 2.57×10^{-13}, further supporting the genetic influence on the disease.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs9260172 showed a fourth independent signal with a p-value of 3.27×10^{-9} in the analysis, contributing to the understanding of the genetic architecture of SSNS.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2858317 was mentioned as being in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs9271602, establishing its relevance in the context of associations with SSNS.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs3828799 was also in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs9271602, associated with the region influencing SSNS risk.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs4642516 was identified as linked to the HLA-DQ/DR region associations, contributing to SSNS risk.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs1129740 was in linkage disequilibrium with lead SNPs in the HLA region and contributed to understanding associations with SSNS.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs1071630 was part of the broader analysis revealing linkage to SSNS through the HLA loci.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs1063348 was noted for its association with the HLA region in the context of SSNS studies.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs28366266 was also linked to findings within the HLA region influencing the susceptibility to SSNS.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2856665 showed strong association with SSNS in the European cohort with a p-value of 2.45×10^{-68} and OR of 4.06 during trans-ethnic meta-analysis.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs4896153 was associated with immune system function and was found to have a susceptibility variant linked to multiple sclerosis that impacts AHI1 expression.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The rs1535500 SNP was identified as a common nonsynonymous polymorphism significantly associated with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) across multiple genome-wide association studies in diverse populations. The protein change introduced by this SNP (p.Ala277Glu) resulted in a modest 1.4-fold increase in TALK-1 channel current due to enhanced open probability and increased surface localization. This association suggested that the risk haplotype was not only linked to T2DM but also influenced by increased expression of the nearby KCNK17 gene encoding TALK-2, thus implicating combined mechanisms via overactive TALK-1 and overexpression of TALK-2 in the pathogenesis of T2DM.
title: A novel mutation in KCNK16 causing a gain-of-function in the TALK-1 potassium channel: a new cause of maturity onset diabetes of the young

finding: The SNP rs4945787 was categorized as novel and was identified as an intronic variant of the gene SCML4. Other intronic variants of SCML4 have been related to coronary artery disease and Alzheimer’s disease, both of which are relevant to lipid levels.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The rs7771980 SNP in the RUNX2 promoter was associated with lower bone mineral density (BMD). Previous studies reported high-frequency alleles of this SNV linked to lower BMD in modern human populations. The study also confirmed that the 3'UTR variant derived from Neanderthal/Denisovan lowered RUNX2 transcriptional activity, which reinforces its impact on BMD.
title: Human-derived alleles in SOST and RUNX2 3′UTRs cause differential regulation in a bone cell-line model

finding: This SNP in HLA-DQA1 displayed classical signatures of balancing selection, showing particularly low MU values which runs contrary to its high global allele frequency.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: The variant rs6908626 (G>T) was identified as an intronic variant associated with T1D risk, with the EUR minor allele significantly influencing disease outcomes.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: The strongest signal for MICA/B was identified at the intronic variant rs3132467, with a associated MAF of 0.30 and a staggering P-value of 3.04 × 10^-68.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: This SNP was associated with lower expression of TCF19 in adipose tissue, contrasting with a type 2 diabetes variant that increased TCF19 gene expression.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: This SNP was associated with increased expression of SLC22A1, which was down-regulated in hepatocellular carcinoma.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: This SNP was associated with higher expression of SLC22A1, mirroring findings related to longevity variants.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: Associated with lower HLA-B expression, which correlated with better survival outcomes in colorectal cancer patients.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: This SNP was associated with the EBV LMP1 signaling landscape, which plays a pivotal role in B-cell transformation and oncometabolism, indicating a significant link between genetic variation at this locus and the regulation of purine nucleotide biosynthesis.
title: Epstein-Barr Virus Latent Membrane Protein 1 Subverts IMPDH pathways to drive B-cell oncometabolism

finding: The SNP rs2770573, associated with LINC00240, was identified as a fine-mapped variant influencing white matter characteristics, linking it to broader genetic effects in brain function.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The rs9393777 variant was associated with genetic fine mapping for white matter microstructural parameters, suggesting its role in the genetic factors affecting related disorders.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The SNP rs12203592 exhibited DNAm associations tied to pigmentation traits, emphasizing its relevance in the study of skin cancer.
title: Investigating DNA methylation as a potential mediator between pigmentation genes, pigmentary traits and skin cancer

finding: The SNP rs12210050 was shown to be associated with DNAm sites that relate to pigmentation and skin cancer, reinforcing its significance in genetic studies.
title: Investigating DNA methylation as a potential mediator between pigmentation genes, pigmentary traits and skin cancer

finding: The SNP rs4526212 located on chromosome 6q23.3 was associated with immune functions relevant to asthma, also showing a highly significant <italic>cis</italic> eQTL (P<1.0×10-300) in blood, indicating that <italic>AHI1</italic> might play a role in asthma pathology through immunological mechanisms.
title: Large-scale Genetic Analysis Identifies 66 Novel Loci for Asthma

finding: The SNP rs9647635, found on chromosome 6q23.3, was in near perfect linkage disequilibrium (r2=0.98) with rs4526212 and was associated with selective IgA deficiency, a condition correlated with asthma, thus reinforcing its potential relevance in asthma susceptibility.
title: Large-scale Genetic Analysis Identifies 66 Novel Loci for Asthma

finding: The rs55982826 SNP was found within open chromatin peaks linked to undifferentiated columnar epithelial cells in Barrett's oesophagus. It was suggested to disrupt the binding of a transcriptional activator, thereby potentially influencing the development and maintenance of the Barrett's phenotype.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: The rs1264706 SNP was noted for its location in an open chromatin region within the developmental epithelial clusters. It was predicted to create a binding site for a repressor, further supporting its role in the regulatory landscape associated with Barrett's oesophagus.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: The SNP rs58453446, related to the BACH2 gene at 6q15, showed a significant association with the FEV1/FVC ratio in never smokers (p=8.9×10^-10). This result pointed to its role in maintaining pulmonary surfactant homeostasis.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs3778609 was included in the 180-SNP PRS used in the analysis. It was identified in fine-mapping studies in Latinas, specifically associated with breast cancer.
title: A polygenic risk score for breast cancer in U.S. Latinas and Latin-American women

finding: The SNP rs851984 was part of the 180-SNP set used for risk prediction, linked to breast cancer through fine-mapping studies in the Latina population.
title: A polygenic risk score for breast cancer in U.S. Latinas and Latin-American women

finding: The SNP rs13194926 was implicated in the molecular mechanisms underlying EGFR-TKI resistance in EGFR-mutated NSCLC. This involvement highlighted the SNP's potential role in biological diagnostics and monitoring for patients undergoing treatment.
title: Mechanisms analysis for Formononetin counteracted-Osimertinib resistance in Non-small-cell lung cancer cells: from the insight into the gene transcriptional level

finding: The variant rs1349979 was noted as a potential pleiotropic variant influencing smoking initiation's effects on WHR and waist circumference (WC). This association underscores its relevance in understanding smoking as a risk factor for abdominal fat.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The finding related to SNP rs12193182 was linked to the study conducted by Sobejano-Paz et al. in 2020, which explored the impact of environmental factors on stomatal conductance, transpiration, and photosynthesis in maize under drought conditions. The original finding indicated that this SNP was associated with thermoregulation mechanisms and may influence maize's adaptive responses to temperature variations, thereby affecting crop yield and efficiency in thermoregulation during extreme temperature events.
title: Heat dissipation from photosynthesis contributes to maize thermoregulation under suboptimal temperature conditions

finding: The SNP rs1800629, which is a polymorphism in the TNF-α gene, was found to impact cognitive impairment among Asian breast cancer patients. This finding established a direct link between this genetic variant and the cognitive effects observed in patients, suggesting that genetic factors may influence the overall patient experience during cancer treatment.
title: An Ensemble Learning Approach for Cancer Drug Prediction

finding: The SNP rs72840075 was the most strongly associated SNP in the replication cohort, located within the MYLK4 gene at the 6p25.2 locus with a borderline significant association at p=5.29×10-8.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: SNP rs142480106 showed a borderline significant association in the meta-analysis for RMM with a p-value of 5.29 × 10-8.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: The allele rs3135388-T, often used as a marker for HLA DRB1*15:01, was absent in all Niedertiefenbach samples, suggesting a lack of predisposition to mycobacterial infections, marking a significant genetic distinction from contemporary Europeans.
title: Neolithic genomes reveal a distinct ancient HLA allele pool and population transformation in Europe

finding: The SNP rs13194985 was positively associated with the process of epithelial mesenchymal transition (EMT), which is relevant to the pathophysiology of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF). This SNP provided insights into dysfunctional epithelial repair, highlighting Vimentin's role in cellular transitions that could contribute to IPF progression, as described in the study by Usman et al., where the importance of these cellular states in the context of cancer and fibrosis was emphasized. Thus, this SNP's findings were significant in understanding the underlying mechanisms of IPF and therapeutic targeting.
title: Hypoxia-inducible factor-2 (HIF2) regulates alveolar regeneration after repetitive injury

finding: Previously associated with schizophrenia, rs1233494 underscored its role in the genetic mechanisms underlying serious mental illnesses.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: This novel variant linked to the HSPA1A locus was associated with type I diabetes related phenotypes, indicating a relation between decreased telomere length and increased risk for these phenotypes.
title: Novel genetic determinants of telomere length from a trans-ethnic analysis of 109,122 whole genome sequences in TOPMed

finding: The rs237025 SNP, which corresponds to the M55V variant of SUMO4, was found to be prevalent and associated with several human pathologies, including diabetes.
title: SUMO monoclonal antibodies vary in sensitivity, specificity, and ability to detect SUMO conjugate types

finding: The SNP rs4895441 showed converging effects with rs1427407 on HBG2, reinforcing the association with hemoglobin levels and suggesting broader implications in brain health.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The variant rs10455872 in lipoprotein(a) gene (LPA) was known to decrease statin efficacy and toxicity, influencing individuals to be more likely on atorvastatin at higher doses. This variant was significantly associated with simvastatin and atorvastatin usage in the UK Biobank study and is linked to reduced LDL-c levels, requiring stronger therapeutic interventions in carriers.
title: LPA and APOE are associated with statin selection in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs74617384 was associated with atorvastatin selection, indicating carriers of this variant were more likely to be prescribed atorvastatin than simvastatin. It was significantly linked to higher intensity doses of atorvastatin, suggesting a role in determining drug choice and dosage among patients.
title: LPA and APOE are associated with statin selection in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs13195019 was linked to the response of ovarian carcinoma to targeted therapies. In the context of the research, the study examined the influence of TSP-1:CD47 antagonism within the tumor microenvironment, noting its role in modulating anti-tumor immunity. This finding highlighted a significant association between rs13195019 and immune responses in both tumor and adjacent normal tissues, particularly in high-grade serous ovarian cancers (HGSCs).
title: Human fallopian tube single-cell analysis reveals monocytic transcriptional and interaction changes in high-grade serous ovarian cancers

finding: The SNP rs7454108 was associated with increased HLA-DR mean fluorescence intensity (MFI) on monocytes. This SNP tagged the high-risk HLA-DR4-DQ8 haplotype and demonstrated a significant association independent of age, T1D status, or autoantibody positivity, suggesting its role as a genetic driver of immune phenotype in T1D.
title: Human immune phenotyping reveals accelerated aging in type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant rs71542466 in the HLA-DQB1 locus was identified as regulating gene expression in a context-specific manner. This variant was targeted using CRISPR-Cas mediated homology-directed repair in cell lines, revealing that it influenced gene expression of HLA-DQB1.
title: Defining the function of disease variants with CRISPR editing and multimodal single cell sequencing

finding: The SNP rs9463650 appeared as a new risk variant near the gene RPS17P5, marking a contribution to the genetic knowledge comprising psychiatric risks.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: Identified near the gene RP1-149C7.1, rs12190758 was recognized as a significant novel discovery in the context of psychiatric disorders.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The rs41272114 SNP, associated with LPA, was linked to plasma plasminogen levels, lipoprotein A levels, and coronary artery disease, marking it as a significant phenotypic trait.
title: Common homozygosity for predicted loss-of-function variants reveals both redundant and advantageous effects of dispensable human genes

finding: The SNP rs6570507 was found to be associated with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis (AIS) in a multi-ethnic meta-analysis. This association suggests that rs6570507 may be a potential genetic risk locus for the development of scoliosis in adolescents, providing insights into the genetic basis of the disorder.
title: Postembryonic screen for mutations affecting spine development in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs2236256 was identified as a susceptibility locus for chronic lymphocytic leukaemia (CLL), having a P of 2×10−10. The related NRS, GNRS_28218, was significantly associated with anemia-related traits such as mean corpuscular hemoglobin, mean corpuscular volume, and red cell volume distribution width-coefficient of variation. This linkage suggests that the gene IPCEF1, where GNRS_28218 is located, may play a role in anemia pathogenesis, hinting at additional pathways influenced by rs2236256.
title: Graph pangenome reveals functional, evolutionary, and phenotypic significance of human nonreference sequences

finding: The SNP rs9366778 was associated with birth weight (BW) showing a putative fetal effect. It was previously reported in genetic association studies and was found to have a P-value of 2.13×10^-7. The effect of HLA alleles on BW was modeled considering this SNP, allowing for assessment independent of the associations from other listed SNPs.
title: Partitioning genetic effects on birth weight at classical human leukocyte antigen loci into indirect maternal and direct fetal components using structural equation modelling

finding: The SNP rs6911024, located in the 5' UTR of the MICA gene, demonstrated a predominantly maternal effect on birth weight (BW) and significant associations were noted. In conditional analyses, it was noted to be in moderate linkage disequilibrium with HLA alleles. Its significance was suggested to be substantial with a P-value indicating it should be accounted for in models estimating genetic contributions to BW.
title: Partitioning genetic effects on birth weight at classical human leukocyte antigen loci into indirect maternal and direct fetal components using structural equation modelling

finding: SNP rs144626001 served as a proxy for rs114892859 and showed a stronger likely deleterious effect based on CADD scores. It was highlighted during the investigation of eQTL associations, showing correlations with lower lymphocyte counts in context of penicillin allergy. The functional data suggested a regulatory role, further supporting its involvement in hypersensitivity mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide study identifies association between HLA-B*55:01 and penicillin allergy

finding: The SNP rs12203592 was identified as a significant <italic>trans</italic>-meQTL for 131 CpG probes. It exhibited a positive effect size where lower expression of <italic>IRF4</italic> was associated with higher methylation levels, indicating a regulatory role in the context of transcription factor-mediated gene expression.
title: Cell-type-specific meQTL extends melanoma GWAS annotation beyond eQTL and informs melanocyte gene regulatory mechanisms

finding: This variant, associated with RNASET2, was shown to be responsive to cellular respiration and tagged a risk variant for basal cell carcinoma. It exhibited significant effects on allele-specific expression influenced by cellular context, highlighting the complex interactions in gene regulation.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing of differentiating iPS cells reveals dynamic genetic effects on gene expression

finding: The BTNL2 rs2076530 polymorphism was indicated to have an association with Graves' disease as noted in the research by Simmonds et al. in 2006.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and enriched pathways in inflammatory bowel disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: A human genome-wide association study identified the SNP rs75205693 in the CNR1 gene, which was associated with DNA methylation. This finding provided insight into the regulatory mechanisms involving the CB1 receptor in human pathophysiology.
title: Loss of myeloid cannabinoid CB1 receptor confers atheroprotection by reducing macrophage proliferation and immunometabolic reprogramming

finding: The SNP rs1535500, resulting in a gain-of-function mutation (A277E) in the TALK1 potassium channel, was associated with an increased risk of type 2 diabetes. This finding was contextualized within the observation that TALK1 plays a regulatory role in glucose-stimulated insulin secretion (GSIS). Additionally, TALK1 knockout mice exhibited increased membrane depolarization and elevated Ca2+ influx, further emphasizing the impact of this mutation on GSIS and its relation to diabetes risk.
title: Heteromerization of alkaline-sensitive two-pore domain potassium channels

finding: rs6456883 was identified as a significant sQTL for the expression of the ZNF311 gene isoforms. The T allele of rs6456883 was associated with increased expression of the protein-coding isoform ZNF311-203, while the C allele was correlated with increased expression of the untranslated isoform ZNF311-204, indicating a role in intron retention. This SNP was in complete linkage disequilibrium with GWAS SNP rs9257408, which was associated with breast cancer risk.
title: Alternative splicing regulation by GWAS risk loci for breast cancer

finding: rs9257408 was associated with breast cancer risk as indicated by the study. It was in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs6456883, the significant sQTL for ZNF311, underscoring its relevance in breast cancer susceptibility.
title: Alternative splicing regulation by GWAS risk loci for breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs1268163, near the FOXO3 gene, showed overlap between the posterior body and isthmus, implicating it in IL-9 signaling and FOXO-mediated transcription.
title: The Genetic Architecture of the Human Corpus Callosum and its Subregions

finding: The SNP rs9295128 was prioritized in the context of coronary artery, showing a significant overlap with an annotated enhancer from the EpiMAP database. The BTS analysis yielded a p-value of 1.7e-3 and prior odds of 2.85, indicating its relevance in coronary-related functional genomic elements.
title: BTS: scalable Bayesian Tissue Score for prioritizing GWAS variants and their functional contexts across omics data

finding: The SNP rs9457927 was prioritized for the cardiac muscle cell context, located within an annotated open chromatin region defined by a DNase assay. The BTS analysis showed a p-value of 7.1e-4 and prior odds of 5.51, suggesting its significance in cardiac muscle-specific functional genomic contexts.
title: BTS: scalable Bayesian Tissue Score for prioritizing GWAS variants and their functional contexts across omics data

finding: The SNP rs1805264 was associated with differential expression of the NLRP1 gene in human lymphoblastoid cells compared to rhesus macaque. It was found in a <cis only> region overlapping the MIS12 promoter, which showed signs of positive selection and high evolutionary acceleration. Human-specific transcription factor binding activity was influenced by this SNP, leading to changes in pro-inflammatory signaling pathways potentially affecting human-specific immune traits.
title: Human gene regulatory evolution is driven by the divergence of regulatory element function in both cis and trans

finding: The SNP rs13215365 was associated with the modulation of O-GlcNAcylation processes relevant in human cholangiocarcinoma (CCA). This modification involved critical steps in tumor progression, highlighting its role in enhancing cell growth through stabilization of Keratin 18 (K18) expression.
title: O-GlcNAcylation of Keratin 18 coordinates TCA cycle to promote cholangiocarcinoma progression

finding: The SNP rs13215394 was found to have a positive and original finding related to the treatment response in colorectal cancer, particularly in predicting sensitivity to cetuximab across various consensus molecular subtypes. This was highlighted in the context of APC and TP53 mutations, suggesting that specific genetic variations could help in tailoring therapeutic strategies for patients, thereby enhancing the efficacy of treatment for distinct CRC subtypes.
title: Comprehensive characterization of tumor microenvironment in colorectal cancer via histopathology-molecular analysis

finding: The SNP rs72928038 was reported as an intronic variant within the BACH2 gene and was included in the original 95% credible sets.
title: Improving the coverage of credible sets in Bayesian genetic fine-mapping

finding: This variant was associated with coronary artery disease and identified as a cis-pQTL for PLG, representing a genetic connection to cardiovascular diseases.
title: Genetic architecture of host proteins interacting with SARS-CoV-2

finding: rs184670665 was near the gene IMPG1 and showed an association with mean activity levels during sleep, having a p-value of 2.4×10^-10. This finding was novel and did not have previous associations with activity levels during sleep.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: The study identified that LPS stimulation reduces the strength of the association of the rs3104367 genotype with HLA-DQA1 expression, with a q-value of 0.0038. This finding suggested a significant interaction between this SNP and microglial response to inflammatory stimuli.
title: The human microglia responsome: a resource to better understand microglia states in health and disease

finding: The SNP rs13205171 was identified in a study concerning mathematical modeling of targeted radionuclide and chimeric antigen receptor T-cell combination therapy. The research demonstrated that this SNP was associated with significant implications in CAR T-cell therapy efficacy and dynamics as analyzed in the context of glioblastoma cells. The findings suggested that understanding the genetic underpinnings, including this SNP, could enhance therapeutic strategies.
title: Data driven model discovery and interpretation for CAR T-cell killing using sparse identification and latent variables

finding: The research established a positive association between the TREM-1 rs2234237T allele and the development of severe malaria, attributed to higher levels of soluble TREM-1 in the plasma of patients carrying this allele. This finding indicated the SNP's role in influencing inflammatory responses and potentially impacting EV71 infection outcomes as well.
title: TREM-1 activation is a key regulator in driving severe pathogenesis of enterovirus 71 infection

finding: The SNP rs2234246 was shown to regulate TREM-1 protein and mRNA levels and was associated with plasma levels of L-selectin. This regulation suggested that genetic variations in TREM-1 could affect inflammatory responses during infections, including those caused by EV71.
title: TREM-1 activation is a key regulator in driving severe pathogenesis of enterovirus 71 infection

finding: The SNP rs1886248 for the RNF144B gene was highlighted as a sQTL that colocalized with the FingerOA GWAS signal (index variant rs9396861) in both control and FN-f conditions, indicating its relevance to osteoarthritis risk.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: Similar to rs1886248, rs9396861 colocalized with the sQTL associated with RNF144B in the context of FingerOA, suggesting its importance in osteoarthritis pathogenesis.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: In the study by De Wyn et al. (2021), the SNP rs13194783 was found to be associated with the transcription factor Meis2, which plays a crucial role in the adrenergic regulation during the early initiation of MYCN-driven neuroblastoma formation. This finding highlighted the significance of rs13194783 in the context of neuroblastoma development and progression, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus could influence the risk or severity of this type of cancer.
title: 5’UTR translational inhibition of neuroblastoma dependency factors using the CR-1-31-B rocaglate

finding: The SNP rs3798220 was associated with Lp(a) levels, which are correlated with the number of KIV-2 repeats within the LPA gene. However, it only accounted for a minority of the variance in Lp(a) levels, indicating that other genetic and environmental factors might also contribute.
title: A pan-genome approach to decipher variants in the highly complex tandem repeat of LPA

finding: The SNP rs10455872 was found to have an association with Lp(a) levels, similarly linked to the number of KIV-2 repeats in the LPA gene. Like rs3798220, this SNP accounted for only a small portion of the variance in Lp(a) levels, with its effects being specific to certain racial and ethnic groups.
title: A pan-genome approach to decipher variants in the highly complex tandem repeat of LPA

finding: SNP rs9261256 was identified in the dichotomized HDL analysis, contributing to the model.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The rs1800620 polymorphism was found to be associated with Helicobacter pylori infection in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus, representing a significant genetic variant impacting this disease.
title: CytoSIP: An annotated structural atlas for interactions involving cytokine or cytokine receptor

finding: The rs4645843 SNP was linked to symptom burden and quality of life outcomes in lung cancer survivors, indicating its relevance in cancer-related pathologies.
title: CytoSIP: An annotated structural atlas for interactions involving cytokine or cytokine receptor

finding: Associated with immune-mediated diseases like Crohn's disease and multiple sclerosis, rs34421390 demonstrated the largest expression-modulating effect in both resting and stimulated CD4 T cells, where the risk allele was shown to reduce expression.
title: Resolving mechanisms of immune-mediated disease in primary CD4 T cells

finding: The SNP rs6927172 emerged as a key variant at a pleiotropic locus linked to multiple immune-mediated diseases, where it was shown to disrupt an NF-κB binding site, resulting in the downregulation of TNFAIP3 expression and enhanced CD4 T cell activation.
title: Resolving mechanisms of immune-mediated disease in primary CD4 T cells

finding: The SNP rs35771565, corresponding to the SAV D296N in the olfactory receptor 2W1 (OR2W1_HUMAN), was categorized as a neutral variant. This finding was based on the comprehensive analysis which showed that the mutation occurred in the extracellular topological domain of the protein, far from critical functional regions such as disulfide bonds and glycosylation sites. The conserved hydrophilic nature of the amino acids involved in the mutation supported the conclusion that the protein maintained its functional integrity, hence the neutral effect prediction by the ASCARIS model.
title: ASCARIS: Positional Feature Annotation and Protein Structure-Based Representation of Single Amino Acid Variations

finding: The rs72975913 variant was associated with an increased risk of earlier diagnosis of type 1 diabetes, particularly in individuals diagnosed by age 7. It was identified in proximity to the THEMIS and PTPRK genes, implicating these genes in T cell maturation processes relevant for diabetes susceptibility.
title: Thymocyte regulatory variant alters transcription factor binding and protects from type 1 diabetes in infants

finding: The SNP rs6903956 in the ADTRP locus received support from QTL analysis, corroborating previously annotated gene assignments.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: This SNP was associated with multiple non-coding transcripts, revealing the potential importance of ncRNAs within locus 20.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: The association between rs12202017 and TCF21 expression was retained, indicating its role in regulating the gene in various tissues.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: The SNP rs986696979 was associated with ICV volume variability, yielding 0.211% explained variance and 0.0005% in the mean model which demonstrates its relevance in the analysis.
title: Genetic control of variability in subcortical and intracranial volumes

finding: The rs9271593 SNP was linked to a regulatory genetic variant situated between the HLA-DRB1 and HLA-DQA1 genes. It was found to tag the lupus-associated alleles DRB1*03:01 and DRB1*15:01, contributing to increased expression levels of HLA-DRB1, HLA-DQA1, and HLA-DQB1 in monocyte-derived dendritic cells. This finding indicated a noncanonical, antigen presentation-independent mechanism contributing to the genetic risk of systemic lupus erythematosus.
title: The lupus susceptibility allele DRB1*03:01 encodes a disease-driving epitope

finding: The intergenic variant rs141168133, located 19kb from ID4, was discovered to be height-associated. This finding emerged from the analysis of WGS data, indicating its significance in the context of the comprehensive polygenic model.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: SNP rs150556786, an upstream gene variant for GRM4, was also associated with height. The identification of this association was possible only through the combination of WGS data, highlighting its previously unrecognized role in height genetics.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: The single heterozygote for CFB rs641153, a normal sample, exhibited significant ASE within RPE tissue.
title: Patterns of gene expression and allele-specific expression vary among macular tissues and clinical stages of Age-related Macular Degeneration

finding: CFB rs641153 demonstrated significant ASE only in the macular RPE/choroid of a normal sample, underscoring its protective function.
title: Patterns of gene expression and allele-specific expression vary among macular tissues and clinical stages of Age-related Macular Degeneration

finding: This SNP was linked to decreased expression of RNF144B exclusively after FN-f treatment. It was associated with a Finger OA GWAS signal, highlighting its impact in osteoarthritis.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: The study linked SNP rs7771828 with decreased expression of RNF144B after FN-f treatment, underscoring its relevance to OA through association with a Finger OA GWAS signal.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: The SNP rs10457592 was associated with major depression. Similar to the findings for rs10153620, chromatin loop analysis identified the target gene POU3F2, which has relevance to neuronal functions, whereas the eQTL analysis pointed to the gene FBXL4, which lacked clear ties to brain functions. This further illustrated the superiority of chromatin loop data in elucidating the genetic basis of neurological disorders.
title: Robust Hi-C chromatin loop maps in human neurogenesis and brain tissues at high-resolution

finding: The SNP rs1800769 was identified as a significant risk factor for coronary artery disease (CAD) in interaction with rs9458001. In the context of other genotypes, individuals with the CT genotype of rs1800769 displayed either decreased or increased CAD risk based on the genotype of rs9458001. The interaction effect was significant across multiple studies, with a meta-analysis P-value of 1.75e-13, and was replicable in the UK Biobank, demonstrating the robustness of this finding.
title: Cis-epistasis at the LPA locus and risk of coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs9458001 exhibited significant interaction with rs1800769 in modulating CAD risk. This interaction was significant with a P-value of 1.75e-13. Specific genotypes, particularly rs9458001 GG and AA, responded differently to the presence of rs1800769, where CAD risk varied considerably, reinforcing the concept of epistasis in this region. The findings were replicated in multiple cohorts including the UK Biobank.
title: Cis-epistasis at the LPA locus and risk of coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs13205086 was found to be significantly involved in TGFbeta signaling pathways within the pancreatic tumor microenvironment. This signaling was implicated in the adaptive immune cell infiltration and contributed to understanding how TGFbeta-mediated processes affected immune evasion and tumor progression in PDAC.
title: Single-cell immune multi-omics and repertoire analyses in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma reveal differential immunosuppressive mechanisms within different tumour microenvironments

finding: The SNP rs4151651 was identified as a significant genetic risk factor specifically associated with severe ulcerative colitis (UC) with an odds ratio (OR) of 6.00 compared to 1.81 in mild UC. This SNP is located in an exonic region of the Complement Factor B (CFB) gene and was linked to increased expression of CFB correlating with disease severity.
title: An extremes of phenotype approach confirms significant genetic heterogeneity in patients with ulcerative colitis

finding: SNP rs9268877 was associated with clinical outcomes in severe UC as per a previous study, although it was not significantly associated with overall UC susceptibility. Its identification emphasized genetic nuances between mild and severe forms of the disease.
title: An extremes of phenotype approach confirms significant genetic heterogeneity in patients with ulcerative colitis

finding: This SNP reached genome-wide significance with an OR of 1.97 in the combined dataset of UC cases. It was the lead SNP in the HLA region associated with UC.
title: An extremes of phenotype approach confirms significant genetic heterogeneity in patients with ulcerative colitis

finding: SNP rs144717024 emerged as a significant locus in the HLA region with an OR of 12.23 specifically in severe UC cases, indicating a strong genetic contribution to this phenotype.
title: An extremes of phenotype approach confirms significant genetic heterogeneity in patients with ulcerative colitis

finding: SNP rs6916742 was found to be a secondary independent risk locus in the HLA region, with significant associations revealed through rigorous statistical analysis.
title: An extremes of phenotype approach confirms significant genetic heterogeneity in patients with ulcerative colitis

finding: This SNP was replicated in severe UC with a significant association, reinforcing the genetic ties of CFB to severe disease mechanisms.
title: An extremes of phenotype approach confirms significant genetic heterogeneity in patients with ulcerative colitis

finding: Ownership of the rs12614 variant demonstrated reduced alternative complement pathway activity in UC cases, providing insight into the underlying genetic regulation of CFB in the disease context.
title: An extremes of phenotype approach confirms significant genetic heterogeneity in patients with ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs11757081 was significantly associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) with a p-value less than 10 to the power of -15 in a GWAS meta-analysis that included over 3 million individuals. This indicated that the SNP may influence BMI regulation, implicating ZBTB9's role in metabolic homeostasis.
title: Cell-state dependent regulation of PPARγ signaling by ZBTB9 in adipocytes

finding: The SNP rs210192 was significantly associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk, with a p-value of 4.52e-8 in a similar GWAS meta-analysis. This finding suggested that variations at this locus may contribute to an individual's risk of developing T2D, further highlighting the potential role of ZBTB9 in metabolic disease.
title: Cell-state dependent regulation of PPARγ signaling by ZBTB9 in adipocytes

finding: Rs9271171 was shown to regulate HLA-DQA1 and C4A expression in a pleiotropic manner. Excision of this variant in THP-1 cells increased HLA-DQA1 expression while decreasing C4A expression, confirming its role in AD risk.
title: Functional regulatory variants implicate distinct transcriptional networks in dementia

finding: The SNP rs1360780 in the FKBP5 gene was associated with lower weight loss after bariatric surgery, as reported by Hartmann et al. (2016). This finding linked the genetic variant to decreased efficacy of weight loss interventions, which is relevant in the context of obesity treatment and potential improvements in metabolic health post-surgery.
title: Single-cell Chromatin Accessibility and Lipid Profiling Reveals a Metabolic Shift in Adipocytes Induced by Bariatric Surgery

finding: The SNP rs1800769 was associated with elevated serum lipoprotein(a) concentration and contributed to the understanding of population differences in Lp(a) levels. It was found to have a major allele frequency of 46% among African alleles compared to 17% in European alleles, which played a key role in the higher median Lp(a) levels observed in individuals of African ancestry.
title: Protein-coding repeat polymorphisms strongly shape diverse human phenotypes

finding: SNP rs3124784 was identified as a modifying SNP that affected lipoprotein(a) levels. Analysis indicated that it, along with other SNPs and the KIV-2 VNTR, explained 90% of lipoprotein(a) heritability in Europeans.
title: Protein-coding repeat polymorphisms strongly shape diverse human phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs1853021 was found to influence variations in lipoprotein(a) levels. It was included in a set of common variants that contributed significantly to Lp(a) heritability, alongside the KIV-2 VNTR.
title: Protein-coding repeat polymorphisms strongly shape diverse human phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs9399137, located upstream of HBS1L and MYB, was significantly associated with hemoglobin concentration in studies of sickle cell anemia, reporting a p-value of 5.24e-249 and a beta coefficient of 0.0783 in the meta-analysis.
title: Low generalizability of polygenic scores in African populations due to genetic and environmental diversity

finding: This SNP was originally found to be associated with interindividual variation in general intelligence, where the allele linked to increased surface area (SA) corresponded to higher scores on intelligence tests. It was also identified as a cortical eQTL for the FOXO3 gene, a transcription factor that plays a role in neuronal stem cell homeostasis, based on findings from the adult brain PsychENCODE dataset.
title: The Evolutionary History of Common Genetic Variants Influencing Human Cortical Surface Area

finding: The SNP rs2524222 showed a strong association with a p-value of 0.0005, as it was the strongest signal among 4,585 imputed genotypes. This SNP was linked to the increased risk of invasive group A streptococcal disease, representing a significant finding observed in the study.
title: Elevated risk of invasive group A streptococcal disease and host genetic variation in the human leukocyte antigen locus

finding: The variant rs36219699, which denotes the presence of lysine instead of arginine at position 41 in the context of the DQA1*01:03 allele, was associated with disease with a p-value of 0.009. Therefore, this finding was indicative of a genetic predisposition linked to invasive GAS disease.
title: Elevated risk of invasive group A streptococcal disease and host genetic variation in the human leukocyte antigen locus

finding: Similarly, rs41547417, which indicates an alanine replacing a serine at position 130 corresponding to DQA1*01:03, also displayed a p-value of 0.009. Thus, it was recognized as a positive original finding pertaining to the increased susceptibility to invasive GAS disease.
title: Elevated risk of invasive group A streptococcal disease and host genetic variation in the human leukocyte antigen locus

finding: The study found a significant association between the G allele of rs911196 in the fifth intron of ELOVL2 and earlier onset of intermediate age-related macular degeneration (AMD). Specifically, the G allele was correlated with a 4.7 month earlier onset (95% Confidence Interval: 2.1 – 7.3 months) of AMD, with this effect being consistently observed across different cohorts (5.7 months in IAMDGC and 4.5 months in the UK Biobank). This finding highlighted the G allele's significance in the context of AMD.
title: Polyunsaturated Fatty Acid - mediated Cellular Rejuvenation for Reversing Age-related Vision Decline

finding: The variant rs9468304 in the first intron of ELOVL2 was also meaningfully associated with the onset of intermediate AMD; however, the effect size was not as pronounced as that of rs911196. Specifically, the G allele of rs9468304 was associated with a 4.32 month earlier onset of AMD (P=0.0009), indicating its potential role in modulating disease susceptibility, albeit to a lesser degree than rs911196.
title: Polyunsaturated Fatty Acid - mediated Cellular Rejuvenation for Reversing Age-related Vision Decline

finding: The SNP rs2485363 was found associated with eczema and was located downstream of TAGAP, representing a novel discovery in previous GWAS.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SNP rs9271562 was identified as a candidate functional variant affecting the CTCF motif in blood, demonstrating a functional score of 4.1. It was associated with multiple sclerosis through its linkage to rs3129763 and was related to genes from the HLA family, one of which (HLA-DRB1) plays a role in multiple sclerosis.
title: funMotifs: Tissue-specific transcription factor motifs

finding: The SNP rs12203592 in the IRF4 gene was linked to melanoma susceptibility in a Spanish population. This association suggested that variations in the IRF4 gene could influence an individual's risk for melanoma, further emphasizing its role in cancer genetics.
title: Multi-omic signatures identify pan-cancer classes of tumors beyond tissue of origin

finding: The SNP rs6932847 was analyzed in the context of pleiotropic association between Type 2 Diabetes (T2D) and Prostate Cancer (PrCa). It was identified as part of a locus near RGS17 (6q25.3) that displayed convincing evidence of containing SNPs likely causal for both T2D and PrCa. The analysis used Bayesian colocalization tests which indicated that this SNP, along with another SNP 54 Kb away, had similar p-values for pleiotropic association, signaling a strong connection to multiple traits.
title: A Powerful Method for Pleiotropic Analysis under Composite Null Hypothesis Identifies Novel Shared Loci Between Type 2 Diabetes and Prostate Cancer

finding: At the VEGFA locus, rs7767396 demonstrated a strong association (meta-P-value = 6.93 × 10-306) with the levels of cytokines VEGF-A, IL-10, and IL-12, consistent with previous GWAS findings linking it to individual cytokine levels.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: Although rs9294260 was replicated through the analysis, the consistency of its multivariate genetic effects was less compelling, with a 95% CI of [−0.47,0.6] suggesting inconsistency in association patterns. This indicated that the SNP may only relate to a narrow subset of traits among the multivariate analysis.
title: Beyond power: Multivariate discovery, replication, and interpretation of pleiotropic loci using summary association statistics

finding: The SNP rs2781666 was identified in a study that reported it conferred risk for Type 2 diabetes mellitus. This finding highlighted the association of this specific polymorphism with the disease, suggesting it could be significant for understanding the genetic predisposition to Type 2 diabetes.
title: Bioinformatics Analysis of Key Genes and Pathways for Obesity Associated Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus as a Therapeutic Target

finding: Similar to rs2781666, the SNP rs2781665 was also found to confer risk of Type 2 diabetes mellitus, indicating its potential role in the genetic background of the disease. This result aligns with the findings related to other polymorphisms affecting metabolic disorders.
title: Bioinformatics Analysis of Key Genes and Pathways for Obesity Associated Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus as a Therapeutic Target

finding: The SOD2 rs4880 SNP was associated with modifiable risk factors and oxidative stress markers in coronary artery disease, indicating its importance in cardiac pathology.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: This SNP at the promoter of APOM was shown to physically interact with the LSM2 promoter, linking it to SLE-related substrate dynamics.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: Found at the SNRPC promoter, rs7769961 was shown to interact with the UHRF1BP1 promoter, implicating it in nuclear processes targeted by autoantibodies in SLE patients.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: As a proxy for the SNP rs3117582, its interactions were established within SLE-related pathways in proximity to the relevant gene networks.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: Serving a role as a proxy for the SLE sentinel, rs9462027 exhibited context-specific interactions significant to SLE mechanisms.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: The rs805305 SNP of dimethylarginine dimethylaminohydrolase 2 (DDAH2) was suggested to play a protective role in septic shock by regulating DDAH activity, indicating its relevance in sepsis-related conditions.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The SNP rs707939, located in the MHC region as an intronic variant of MSH5, was associated with 48 traits across 13 domains, indicating a high level of pleiotropy.
title: A global overview of pleiotropy and genetic architecture in complex traits

finding: The study indicated that the genetic alterations, particularly in the context of CDK12 mutations, were associated with variations in MHC expression levels. Specifically, it was noted that decreased MHC expression in certain tumors was often linked to loss of heterozygosity (LOH) events impacting the MHC-I/-II and HLA gene cluster on chromosome 6. This finding was contextually relevant as it connected SNP 'rs13205046' to mechanisms of immune evasion in advanced prostate cancer, supporting the notion that specific somatic genomic events contributed to reduced antigen presentation.
title: Quantitative MHC class-I/-II gene expression levels in CDK12 mutated prostate cancer reveal intratumorally T cell adaptive immune response in tumors

finding: The SNP rs13215534 was associated with clinical and therapeutic implications regarding Epstein–Barr Virus (EBV) in HIV-related lymphomas. It was suggested that variations at this locus could influence the risk and progression of lymphoproliferative disorders in HIV-infected patients.
title: Distinct composition of plasma virome in HIV-infected subjects on antiretroviral therapy compared to controls

finding: The rs3813363 variant located in the 5’UTR of SAMD3 was associated with mean reaction time, indicating its relevance in processes related to cognitive speed.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The intronic variant rs111522866 in ITPR3 was associated with episodic memory, highlighting its functional implications for cognitive processing.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: SNP rs1415701 was identified as one of the putative causal variants with a high probability of greater than 0.8 in the analysis performed with XMAP. This finding was consistent across different populations when integrating data from UKBB and Chinese cohorts, emphasizing XMAP's ability to maintain robustness in identifying causal variants across diverse genetic backgrounds.
title: XMAP: Cross-population fine-mapping by leveraging genetic diversity and accounting for confounding bias

finding: The SNP rs6569648 was also identified as likely causal with a high PIP of over 0.8 using the XMAP approach, which integrated data across EUR and Chinese cohorts. This demonstrated the effectiveness of XMAP in consistently identifying credible causal SNPs across various settings, maintaining reliability even with smaller sample sizes when different GWAS datasets were utilized.
title: XMAP: Cross-population fine-mapping by leveraging genetic diversity and accounting for confounding bias

finding: The SNP rs12212740, located in the third intron of the ATG5 gene, was associated with lower pre-bronchodilator FEV1 and a higher risk of moderate to severe asthma specifically in non-Hispanic Caucasian children. This finding indicated a significant genetic relationship between this SNP and the severity of asthma.
title: Autophagy functions in lung macrophages and dendritic cells to suppress TH17 responses and neutrophil accumulation during allergic airway inflammation

finding: The SNP rs510432, found in the 5’ untranslated region of the ATG5 gene, was linked to an increased risk of asthma in children. The G variant allele of this SNP was shown to enhance promoter activity, leading to higher levels of ATG5 mRNA expression in nasal mucosal cells from children suffering from acute asthma compared to those from non-acute and healthy controls. Additionally, this SNP's association with elevated sputum neutrophil counts in adult asthma patients suggested a connection between dysregulated ATG5 expression and neutrophil recruitment in asthma.
title: Autophagy functions in lung macrophages and dendritic cells to suppress TH17 responses and neutrophil accumulation during allergic airway inflammation

finding: The rs2308655 single-nucleotide variant was originally identified in the context of the HLA-B 08:01 allele. This variant, a C to G change, was not present in the HLA-B 18:01 allele and was located 40 base pairs away from the designed HiBit insertion site used in the study. Its significance stemmed from its potential roles in immune response and as a marker in autoimmune conditions such as idiopathic inflammatory myopathies, specifically in how it interacts with the pathogenic type I interferons and MHC class I pathways.
title: High throughput screening to identify inhibitors of the type I interferon – major histocompatibility complex class I pathway in skeletal muscle

finding: This SNP was associated with findings related to post-translational modifications in a Clinical Proteomics Tumor Analysis Consortium (CPTAC) dataset enhanced by cloud computing methodologies. The analysis indicated an abundant presence of modifications and protein sequence variants that could influence various cancer phenotypes.
title: Diagnostic Ion Data Analysis Reduction (DIDAR) allows rapid quality control analysis and filtering of multiplexed single cell proteomics data

finding: The study highlighted that the rs11755527 polymorphism in the BACH2 gene was associated with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) in a Brazilian population, indicating its potential role as a genetic marker for T1DM.
title: Identification of candidate biomarkers and pathways associated with type 1 diabetes mellitus using bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs2844455, located in a 5' UTR region of the ZBTB12 gene, showed a significant result with an AdaptMix P-value of 5.45×10^-8 and was associated with immune response dynamics, evaluating its role in immunity within the Chilean cohort.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: For the SNP rs28724903 at the intronic region of HLA-DMA, an AdaptMix P-value of 3.87×10^-8 was reported, suggesting its involvement in immune response, particularly noted in the Mexican cohort.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: SNP rs6941112, located within the MHC class III gene STK19, exhibited an AdaptMix P-value of 7.57×10^-9 and indicated selection post-admixture within the Peruvian cohort, reinforcing immune-related adaptations.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: The SNP rs4636058, located at 6q22 encompassing SLC35F1, was identified with a significant AdaptMix P-value of 5.70×10^-10 and showed associations with cardiac function. It was inferred to be selected post-admixture in the Chilean cohort.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: The SNP rs9275390 was associated with HLA-DBQ1 and exhibited a positive original finding for its relationship with anticentromere autoantibody (ACA) status in systemic sclerosis (SSc) patients. This finding contributed to understanding the autoimmune characteristics of SSc.
title: Genetic interactions affect lung function in patients with systemic sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs13193976 was associated with maize yield prediction at an early developmental stage. This finding highlighted the integration of multispectral images and genotype data, allowing for effective preliminary hybrid selection in maize, which is crucial for optimizing crop yields.
title: Global Genotype by Environment Prediction Competition Reveals That Diverse Modeling Strategies Can Deliver Satisfactory Maize Yield Estimates

finding: The missense variant rs75932628 in TREM2 was linked to late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). The high-risk allele for rs75932628 was associated with lower serum levels of TREM2 and higher mortality rates post-incident LOAD.
title: Human serum proteome profoundly overlaps with genetic signatures of disease

finding: The analysis confirmed that the SNP rs71542466 was causal for T cell-specific control of HLA-DQB1 expression, significantly influencing the expression levels of this gene in HH T cell lines. Results indicated that clones with the G allele exhibited higher HLA-DQB1 expression compared to those homozygous for the C allele, thus validating its role in the Late-Spike regulatory program.
title: Allele-specific expression changes dynamically during T cell activation in HLA and other autoimmune loci

finding: Variant rs72830851 in DCDC2 contributed significantly to the association with dyslexia phenotypes, particularly after adjustments for verbal IQ.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: SNP rs68182041 was associated with dyslexia-related traits, underscoring its functional importance in the context of DCDC2.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: Variant rs12196880 in DCDC2 was part of multiple haplo-type associations linked to reading performance, illustrating its relevance to dyslexia.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: SNP rs7763196 in DCDC2 showed associations with reading phenotypes, highlighted by its role in contributing to dyslexia risk.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: SNP rs72830859 was implicated in the regulatory mechanisms affecting transcription factors in DCDC2, demonstrating its association with dyslexia.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: Variant rs12198320 showed suggestive evidence of disrupting transcription factor binding in a context related to dyslexia.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: The SNP rs2524093 was associated with increased expression of the HLA-C gene in brain tissues. It was identified as a significant variant affecting HLA-C, which plays a role beyond classical immune functions, suggesting its implications in neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: Similar to rs2524093, the SNP rs2524092 was associated with HLA-C expression, contributing to the understanding of its potential effects on neurodevelopmental processes.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: The SNP rs2844622 was linked to regulating HLA-C expression in brain tissues, emphasizing its role in neurodevelopmental disorders, alongside other HLA-C associated SNPs.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: The SNP rs9393893 was identified in the promoter of ZKSCAN8, a neuronal gene, which is involved in pre-differentiation and associated with neuronal differentiation.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: This SNP was located in the promoter of ZSCAN31, a neuronal gene that regulates neuronal differentiation.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: The SNP rs35353359 was also located in the promoter region of ZSCAN31, involved in post-mitotic differentiation in neurons.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: The SNP rs1005126 was found in the promoter of ZSCAN12, and was shown to interact with other neuronal genes during differentiation.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: Located in the promoter of ZSCAN12, rs4580862 was associated with gene expression changes during neuronal differentiation.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: This SNP was found in the promoter of ZSCAN12, linked to regulatory interactions among neuronal genes.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: Similar to other SNPs in this context, rs1005127 was involved in the regulatory networks governing ZSCAN genes during neuronal differentiation.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with ALM in the elderly cohort, mirroring findings from the middle-aged cohort, and was part of the four genomic loci replicated in the studies conducted on muscle mass.
title: Genome-wide associations reveal human-mouse genetic convergence and modifiers of myogenesis, CPNE1 and STC2

finding: The PRDM1 variant rs2185379 was studied in the context of long-term recurrence-free survivors of advanced ovarian cancer, suggesting a potential association with outcomes in this patient population.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs6570507 was found to be associated with gender body fat distribution. Specifically, it had a larger effect on visceral adipose tissue (VAT) in females compared to males. It was also associated with body fat distribution measures such as waist-to-hip ratio adjusted for BMI and overall obesity in females.
title: ADGRG6 promotes adipogenesis and is involved in sex-specific fat distribution

finding: The SNP rs9403383, which is in high linkage disequilibrium with rs6570507, was significantly associated with trunk fat mass in women, with a P-value of 5.03478e-13. This association indicated that it affected enhancer activity related to adipocyte differentiation and fat distribution, showing no significant association in men.
title: ADGRG6 promotes adipogenesis and is involved in sex-specific fat distribution

finding: The lung cancer risk SNP rs34662244 was located in an intergenic region and was identified as being at the anchor of two enhancer-promoter interaction clusters. These clusters included target genes ZNF165, ZSCAN16, and ZSCAN16-AS1. The data indicated that this noncoding SNP potentially regulated the expression of its target genes from a distance, contributing to higher expression levels of SNP-interacting genes in lung cancer samples compared to normal samples, suggesting a role as a cancer driver.
title: Mapping Multiple Factors Mediated Chromatin Interactions to Assess Regulatory Network and Dysregulation of Lung Cancer-Related Genes

finding: The A allele of rs149644985 was associated with increased chromatin accessibility and increased expression of FABP7 in both neuronal and progenitor cell types. This SNP, along with its linkage disequilibrium (LD) proxies, was found to disrupt the motifs of SMARCC1 and FOS::JUN, indicating a regulatory mechanism at play in the expression of FABP7.
title: Cell-type specific effects of genetic variation on chromatin accessibility during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The C allele of rs144376334, which was in linkage disequilibrium with rs149644985, was similarly associated with increased chromatin accessibility and gene expression of FABP7. Like rs149644985, it also disrupted motifs of SMARCC1 and FOS::JUN, contributing to its regulatory impact.
title: Cell-type specific effects of genetic variation on chromatin accessibility during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The study identified rs370140172 as a significant variant associated with Type-2 diabetes (T2D) in Native Hawaiians. This was demonstrated through a well-imputed 5' UTR variant that exhibited a significant odds ratio (OR = 1.096, P = 1.25×10^-5) after accounting for the number of tested markers. Its frequency in Native Hawaiians was 24.2%, compared to 0% in Europeans and only 0.9% in East Asians, suggesting its potential role in T2D susceptibility specific to Polynesian ancestry. However, replication in a Samoan cohort was unsuccessful due to lower allele frequency and power limitations.
title: The impact of global and local Polynesian genetic ancestry on complex traits in Native Hawaiians

finding: SNP rs7088 was identified on chromosome 2B and linked with resistance to the PFTTT race, suggesting potential relevance for breeding against this pathogen.
title: Identification of novel leaf rust seedling resistance loci in Iranian bread wheat germplasm using genome-wide association mapping

finding: The SNP rs12189774 was confirmed to have notable transcriptional modulating effects in beta cells, aligning with its previously established role in islet functionality.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The SNP rs2881632 emerged as a putative causal variant through MPRA, showing significant allelic effects on transcriptional activity in beta cells.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The SNP rs3777588 was fine-mapped to a low chromatin regulatory element (LCRE) of the gene CLIC5, which is specifically open in Müller glia (MG) cells. The findings indicated that CLIC5 is highly expressed in these retinal cell classes, and the GWAS signal associated with this variant colocalized with retinal eQTL signals of CLIC5. Furthermore, the variant was predicted to strengthen the binding of the transcription factor HSF1, highlighting its potential regulatory function in relation to glaucoma.
title: Integrated multi-omics single cell atlas of the human retina

finding: The SNP rs7768920 was linked with the duplication haplotype impacting the expression of the HERC2P9 gene. The findings supported the hypothesis that this haplotype contributed to the variation in gene expression, particularly significant in sun-exposed skin tissues.
title: Resolving the insertion sites of polymorphic duplications reveals a HERC2 haplotype under selection

finding: The SNP rs1573905, as a proxy for a novel signal at the ADCY5 locus, demonstrated directional consistency with HISLA results when analyzed in the AAAGC and GIANT studies.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The SNP rs73420913 in high LD with rs148899910 was prioritized for functional interrogation at the C6orf106 locus, reflecting a new signal for BMI.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The SNP rs1342330 is an intronic variant with low regulatory scores, associated with the PHACTR2 gene relevant to body dysmorphic disorder.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The variant rs1800462 was noted as a risk variant for thiopurine toxicity related to the gene TPMT. In the context of the study, this variant was genotyped alongside NUDT15 variants in a cohort of 2,398 patients treated with thiopurines for conditions such as acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). Cases that carried TPMT variants were excluded from further analysis to assess the effect of NUDT15 variants on thiopurine toxicity.
title: Massive parallel variant characterization identifies NUDT15 alleles associated with thiopurine toxicity

finding: The SNP rs9349279, located near the PHACTR gene, also showed a causal association with coronary heart disease (CHD). Along with rs3184504, it was identified as an outlier that linked to several traits influencing CHD risk, thereby establishing a broader understanding of the disease's pathways.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: The SNP rs7764984, situated near the HIST1H2BJ gene, was identified as an outlier associated with traits such as self-reported coeliac disease and memory function. This suggested a potential yet indirect influence on schizophrenia outcomes.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways
