finding: The V380L (rs1801582) variant displayed a trend towards positive association with T1R susceptibility, showing a p-value of 0.09 and an odds ratio of 1.44 (95% CI 0.94 - 2.20) for carriers of the 380L allele, indicating its contribution to T1R risk.
title: Pleiotropic effects for Parkin and LRRK2 in leprosy type-1 reactions and Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs1265053 was identified as the most significant signal in the MHC locus associated with atopic disorders. It was positioned near the HLA-B and HLA-C genes, highlighting its relevance in immune response variability in PID.
title: Whole genome sequencing of a sporadic primary immunodeficiency cohort

finding: The rs9273841 SNP exhibited a significant association after conditioning on rs1265053, with its strongest signal mapping to the Class II region near the HLA-DRB1 and HLA-DQA1 genes. This finding underscored the complexity of associations in the MHC locus concerning autoimmune diseases.
title: Whole genome sequencing of a sporadic primary immunodeficiency cohort

finding: The SNP rs2814993 was previously associated with height in a meta-analysis of European populations and an Australian twin study. In the context of the recent study, the association with leg mass was initially suggestive with a P-value of 1.1 × 10^-6 using standard GWAS methods. However, when utilizing the SynSurr approach, this SNP achieved genome-wide significance (GWS) with a P-value of 2.3 × 10^-20, demonstrating that it was significant for all DEXA traits investigated.
title: Leveraging a machine learning derived surrogate phenotype to improve power for genome-wide association studies of partially missing phenotypes in population biobanks

finding: The association of SNP rs2072783 with the gene CLIP2 presented a q-value FDR ≤ 0.11, extending from its prior cis-association with GMPR, reinforcing the utility of transcriptional time series in identifying significant trans-eQTLs.
title: Causal Network Inference from Gene Transcriptional Time Series Response to Glucocorticoids

finding: The rs72928038 SNP was identified as a protective variant associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) in a genome-wide association study (GWAS), where it was prioritized in the BACH2 gene locus. It demonstrated an odds ratio of 0.8663 for the G allele, indicating a lower risk of MS. Chromatin and expression analyses revealed that this variant resided in an open chromatin region intronic to BACH2, which was accessible in all primary immune cells, suggesting its regulatory role. Furthermore, it was associated with increased expression of BACH2 in naive CD4+ T cells and Treg cells, providing genetic evidence supporting its role in modulating immune responses.
title: The chromatin landscape of Th17 cells reveals mechanisms of diversification of regulatory and pro-inflammatory states

finding: The SNP rs9273363, near HLA-DQB1, showed strong interaction effects in T1D risk when analyzed by GLN. The AA allele had a significant impact on increasing risk, as observed in its cumulative contributions to the predictive model, demonstrating that this SNP was crucial in understanding complex interactions in T1D.
title: Deep integrative models for large-scale human genomics

finding: The SNP rs762624, which was intronic within the CDKN1A locus, was significantly associated with body weight, fat-free mass, and energy expenditure in the UK Biobank study. The minor allele (C) showed protective associations with increased fat-free mass, higher basal metabolic rate, and lower HbA1c levels. This SNP was also identified as a significant splicing quantitative trait locus for CDKN1A, where the minor allele increased the expression of a long non-coding RNA isoform.
title: Single-cell dissection of obesity-exercise axis in adipose-muscle tissues

finding: The SNP rs2395655, characterized as missense within the CDKN1A locus, was significantly associated with anthropometric traits such as body fat and fat-free mass in the same UK Biobank study. The G minor allele exhibited protective traits, similar to rs762624, being linked to an increase in fat-free mass and basal metabolic rate, along with a decrease in HbA1c. This SNP was also a significant splicing QTL that influenced the expression of a transcript isoform of CDKN1A, further validating its importance in metabolic phenotypes.
title: Single-cell dissection of obesity-exercise axis in adipose-muscle tissues

finding: The rs9349379_A>G variant was causal for migraine medication triptan and linked to various migraine-related traits, including migraine medications and family history, while also showing unexpected associations with cardiovascular diseases.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The tag SNP for HLA-DRB1*15:01, identified as the largest genetic risk factor for multiple sclerosis (MS), was initially found in an Italian Neolithic individual and saw a significant rise in frequency during the emergence of the Yamnaya culture around 5,300 years ago. This SNP's increase was linked to the migration into Europe and associated immunogenetic changes.
title: Elevated genetic risk for multiple sclerosis originated in Steppe Pastoralist populations

finding: Tagging the HLA-DRB1*15:01 haplotype, this SNP demonstrated the largest change in genetic risk for MS in the pan-ancestry analysis. It indicated statistical significance and highlighted the selective advantage of certain alleles in the Steppe population.
title: Elevated genetic risk for multiple sclerosis originated in Steppe Pastoralist populations

finding: Another SNP tagging the HLA-DRB1*15:01 haplotype, it was included in analyses for evidence of selection and was part of the broader focus on the ancestry stratified signals of MS risk.
title: Elevated genetic risk for multiple sclerosis originated in Steppe Pastoralist populations

finding: This SNP also tagged the HLA-DRB1*15:01 haplotype and was involved in the study's examinations of selection within ancestral populations, strengthening the understanding of its association with MS.
title: Elevated genetic risk for multiple sclerosis originated in Steppe Pastoralist populations

finding: Tagging the largest genetic risk factor for rheumatoid arthritis (RA), HLA-DRB1*04:01, this SNP displayed continuous negative selection until about 3,000 years ago, reflecting different ancestral contributions to RA compared to MS.
title: Elevated genetic risk for multiple sclerosis originated in Steppe Pastoralist populations

finding: SNP rs11751128 was associated with human intelligence and was located in a conserved regulatory region overlapping with the TIAM2 gene, which is highly expressed in the human brain and may play a role in neural cell development. This region was closed in the nucleus accumbens and dentate gyrus but open in the Ammon's horn, reflecting alterations due to METH overdose.
title: Methamphetamine induced regional-specific transcriptomic and epigenetic changes in the rat brain

finding: The SNP rs2046210, located within the genomic region chr6:151485998-151682606 at chr6q25.1, was associated with the transcription factor ESR1, which was noted to be within a 1M proximity of this SNV. This finding was significant as it related to the understanding of breast cancer, showing that the model Enformer enhanced predictions in this context, underscoring the importance of ESR1 in breast cancer through the use of transfer learning.
title: Tissue-specific transfer-learning enables retasking of a general comprehensive model to a specific domain

finding: The SNP rs185805779 G>A in the gene GCNT2 was classified as pathogenic, linked to cataract 13 with adult i phenotype, showing an allele frequency of 1.52% in the Vietnamese population, significantly higher than its frequencies in East Asia and global populations.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: Research found that the PPARD rs2016520 (T/C) polymorphism affected the therapeutic efficacy of nateglinide in Chinese patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus, highlighting its relevance in treatment response.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The rs2781666 SNP was identified as a risk factor for Type 2 diabetes mellitus, establishing a genetic link important for understanding susceptibility to this condition.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The rs2781665 polymorphism also conferred a risk for Type 2 diabetes mellitus, reinforcing the connection between ARG1 gene variants and diabetes predisposition.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The variant rs76773039, which corresponds to the L83I mutation, was linked to morphine tolerance and dependence. It was reported to affect morphine efficacy, increase receptor internalization, and increase morphine tolerance.
title: Understanding and predicting ligand efficacy in the mu-opioid receptor through quantitative dynamical analysis of complex structures

finding: The variant rs201310502, associated with the T120M mutation, was reported to affect the response to tramadol.
title: Understanding and predicting ligand efficacy in the mu-opioid receptor through quantitative dynamical analysis of complex structures

finding: The SNP rs2076295 was highlighted as a co-localizing eQTL for the desmoplakin (DSP) gene, affecting its expression in lung tissue. This SNP co-localized with a lung function phenotype (FEV1/FVC) and was implicated in interstitial lung disease (ILD) as well. It served as the lead SNP in the FEV1/FVC trait analysis within the UK Biobank, suggesting a link between altered DSP expression, lung pathology, and obstructive sleep apnea.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy to discover and interpret GWAS results for sleep-associated traits

finding: The missense variant rs1042044 was identified as the lead variant within the GLP1R locus, associated with BMI with a PPA of 71.6%. This variant correlated with various others indicating multiple potential causal variants.
title: A Unifying Statistical Framework to Discover Disease Genes from GWAS

finding: The SNP rs13215258 was positively associated with miR-199a-5p expression, which was found to correlate with an increased frequency of cardiovascular disease (CVD) in chronic kidney disease (CKD) patients. This association highlighted the role of miR-199a-5p as a key player in kidney-heart crosstalk, particularly relevant for understanding cardiovascular outcomes in CKD.
title: Circulating microRNAs as biomarkers of chronic kidney disease and its association with renal and cardiovascular outcomes in non-dialysis patients

finding: The PGx variant rs2500535 in the UST gene was linked to the efficacy of nortriptyline in patients with major depressive disorder. This variant also exhibited a dominant mode of effect, where individuals with the A allele experienced less improvement in depression symptoms when treated with nortriptyline. The variations were predominantly within groups, with 93.5% observed within SIRE groups, and the variant was especially common among individuals identifying as Hispanic.
title: Population structure and pharmacogenomic risk stratification in the United States

finding: The SNP rs369580, located at 6p21.32 near TNXB, exhibited a genome-wide significant association with PSP (OR 1.43, P=8.11×10^-10), marking it as a novel locus in the study.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: The SNP rs12197948 located at 6p21.1 near RUNX2 was associated with increased RUNX2 expression in various brain datasets, signifying a strong link to PSP.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: The SNP rs4714854, closely linked with rs12197948, is located within RUNX2 and borders an enhancer region, relating it to the expression of RUNX2 in microglia and oligodendrocytes.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: The SNP rs2523524 at 6p21.32 near C4A was highlighted for its association with increased C4A expression while also showing colocalization with eQTLs, suggesting a role in PSP.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: The pQTL rs9501393 was linked with Endothelin-converting enzyme 1 and impacted RNA binding and function, particularly associated with a missense variant in SKIV2L.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The missense variant rs449643 (p.A1071V) in SKIV2L was in strong linkage with pQTLs that have implications on RNA binding functions.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: At the BACH2 locus, the 'A' allele at the top eSNP (rs72928038) was associated with decreased BACH2 expression and increased risk of autoimmune diseases such as thyroid disease, celiac disease, multiple sclerosis, rheumatoid arthritis, and type 1 diabetes. This was consistent with prior studies linking BACH2 loss-of-function to immunodeficiency.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: The SNP rs62399063 was identified as a variant associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D), and it was shown to be situated at an LSD1-bound site interacting with the IER3 promoter in human islets. This interaction suggests its role in the regulation of gene expression related to glucose homeostasis.
title: Nutrient regulation of the islet epigenome controls adaptive insulin secretion

finding: The SNP rs60755019 was associated with significant eQTLs in blood with the ADCY10P1 gene. However, the original study reported its closest gene as TREML2.
title: snpXplorer: a web application to explore human SNP-associations and annotate SNP-sets

finding: Associated with participation metrics in a general sense, indicating roles in participation influence.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs3088442 in the solute carrier family 22 member 3 gene was shown to be associated with coronary heart disease, indicating its involvement in inflammatory responses triggered by lipopolysaccharides.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNPs rs3129882 and rs4248166 in the HLA-DRA gene were investigated for their lack of association with sporadic Parkinson's disease in a Central Chinese cohort, indicating genetic variability.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This SNP was identified in association with IL-1β levels in the human leukocyte antigen locus. The presence of two independent association signals in the conditional analyses indicated potential complexity in genetic regulation of immune responses.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies seven novel loci associating with circulating cytokines and cell adhesion molecules in Finns

finding: The SNP rs504594 was linked to an eQTL with HLA-DRB1, connecting it to both developmental and neurodegenerative stages of PD progression, implying its significance in risk reduction.
title: Establishing gene regulatory networks from Parkinson’s disease risk loci

finding: Associated with a reduced risk of PD, rs9261484 was implicated through an eQTL analysis involving HLA-DRB1, reaffirming its relevance in PD context.
title: Establishing gene regulatory networks from Parkinson’s disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs75932628, associated with AD, was located only 100 bp away from the 3' end of circTREM2_1 and circTREM2_3, suggesting a potential relationship between this genetic variant and the expression or role of these circRNAs in AD pathogenesis.
title: A TREM2-derived circRNA is upregulated in the entorhinal cortex of Alzheimer’s disease patients

finding: The SNP rs143332484 was identified as a risk factor for AD and was located just 55 bp from the 3' end of circTREM2_2, indicating its possible involvement in the development of AD through its relation to circTREM2 expression.
title: A TREM2-derived circRNA is upregulated in the entorhinal cortex of Alzheimer’s disease patients

finding: The SNP rs7772537 was associated with atrial fibrillation, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.08 and a p-value of 1.2E-8, indicating a significant contribution to the risk of this condition. It was found to interact physically with the promoter of TBC1D32 over an 850-kb distance and resided within a transcription factor footprint.
title: Dissecting Regulatory Non-Coding Heart Disease GWAS Loci with High-Resolution 3D Chromatin Interactions Reveals Causal Genes with Pathophysiological Relevance to Heart Failure

finding: The SNP rs1919875 also emerged as an independent atrial fibrillation signal with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.08 and a p-value of 3.0E-11. It illustrated interactions with GJA1 over a 400-kb distance while being in an open chromatin region.
title: Dissecting Regulatory Non-Coding Heart Disease GWAS Loci with High-Resolution 3D Chromatin Interactions Reveals Causal Genes with Pathophysiological Relevance to Heart Failure

finding: For rs9296736, an association with the MLIP gene was noted. This SNP's link with liver enzyme measurements diminished significantly upon methylation-adjustment, suggesting that surrounding methylation patterns are critical in its association with liver-related health risks such as cirrhosis and cardiovascular disease.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: As a known risk allele from HLA-DRB1, rs4947332 demonstrated a significant association with RA, contributing to the overall genetic risk landscape, highlighted by an OR of 4.23 when interacting with rs5997893.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: The TNFAIP3-related SNP rs7752903 was significantly associated with RA, consistent with previous findings in GWAS studies, enhancing its relevance in inflammation and immunity related to RA.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: Rs4285314 located in miR-3135b was identified among novel miRNA SNPs significantly associated with RA, with a P-value of 1.10×10-13, indicating its strong implication in the disease.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: This SNP in HLA-DRB9 was identified as a risk allele with an OR of 1.72, reinforcing its association with RA in the studied cohorts.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: Rs9275376, situated in HLA-DQB1, showed a significant association with RA, consistent with findings from prior genetic association studies.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: The SNP rs9461218, located in an intronic region of the SLC17A1 gene, exhibited a significant genetic association with urine Lac-Phe levels. This association indicated a decrease in urine Lac-Phe levels (beta = -0.242 +/- 0.023, P = 9.9e-26), where the non-effect allele was G and the effect allele was A with an effect allele frequency of 0.22. This genetic signal mapped into an extended linkage disequilibrium block that included SLC17A2, SLC17A3, and SLC17A4, but no association was observed with blood Lac-Phe levels. In addition, it was noted that the SLC17A1-4 locus was significantly associated with various cardiometabolic traits in the Type 2 Diabetes Knowledge Portal.
title: SLC17 transporters mediate renal excretion of Lac-Phe in mice and humans

finding: This SNP was associated with the gene SLC17A1, which showed spatial expression in the proximal tubules across all human kidney tissue sections studied. The finding was significant in the context of chronic kidney disease as it was part of the 21 high-quality SNPs identified that overlapped with reported CKD-associated SNPs.
title: Spatially resolved transcriptome profiles of mammalian kidneys illustrate the molecular complexity of functional nephron segments, cell-to-cell interactions and genetic variants

finding: Similar to rs765285, this SNP was linked to SLC17A1, which demonstrated expression in the proximal tubules. This association contributed to the identification of genetic variants related to chronic kidney disease, with this SNP included among the 21 high-confidence CKD-related SNPs.
title: Spatially resolved transcriptome profiles of mammalian kidneys illustrate the molecular complexity of functional nephron segments, cell-to-cell interactions and genetic variants

finding: This SNP also correlated with SLC17A1, exhibiting spatial expression in proximal tubules. It was regarded as one of the significant SNPs contributing to the genetic understanding of chronic kidney disease, being part of the same group of 21 high-quality SNPs associated with CKD.
title: Spatially resolved transcriptome profiles of mammalian kidneys illustrate the molecular complexity of functional nephron segments, cell-to-cell interactions and genetic variants

finding: This SNP was associated with SLC17A1, reflecting its expression in proximal tubules. It was among the 21 high-confidence SNPs identified that overlap with previously reported SNPs for chronic kidney disease, underscoring its relevance to the disease state.
title: Spatially resolved transcriptome profiles of mammalian kidneys illustrate the molecular complexity of functional nephron segments, cell-to-cell interactions and genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs190947828 was identified as being associated with cystic kidney disease, which is an inflammatory pathology driven by TNFα. Carriers of this SNP showed elevated levels of TNFα production in macrophages, linking this genetic variation to the disease.
title: Systematic perturbation screens decode regulators of inflammatory macrophage states and identify a role for TNF mRNA m6A modification

finding: SNP rs777492465 was also associated with cystic kidney disease in the context of TNFα-driven inflammation. This finding suggests that carriers of this SNP might experience an increase in macrophage-driven inflammatory responses contributing to the pathology.
title: Systematic perturbation screens decode regulators of inflammatory macrophage states and identify a role for TNF mRNA m6A modification

finding: The SNP rs140068132 was included in a previously identified 71-SNP polygenic risk score (PRS) for breast cancer in Latina populations. In the current analysis, this SNP contributed to the performance of a 180-SNP PRS that was evaluated in a study of U.S. Latinas and Latin-American women, suggesting its association with breast cancer risk in this population.
title: A polygenic risk score for breast cancer in U.S. Latinas and Latin-American women

finding: The SNP rs149197213 within the ADGRF5 gene was associated with suicide death, with a high predicted deleterious impact, reflected in its CADD PHRED score exceeding 22.
title: Rare protein coding variants implicate genes involved in risk of suicide death

finding: The SNP rs1819333 was associated with multiple CpGs, including cg20406979, with a strong association marked by a P value of 7.60 × 10^−25, located 314 nucleotides upstream from the transcription start site of RNASET2.
title: Methylation Quantitative Trait Loci are Largely Consistent across Disease States in Crohn’s disease

finding: The SNP rs2504105 was identified as a credible regulatory SNP influencing DAAM2 expression, which is crucial for Wnt signaling in bone metabolism.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs2504104 was involved in the expression regulation of DAAM2 and associated with transcription factor binding that may impact osteoporosis risk.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs2504103 was included in the clustered SNPs affecting DAAM2, indicating its potential role in modulating bone mineral density.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs75932628 identified as c.140G>A; p.R47H was found to be a highly penetrant variant in TREM2, significantly increasing the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease (AD). In the study, it was shown that individuals carrying this variant exhibited disrupted TREM2-centered co-expression relationships in the brain, which were important for regulating microglial responses to neurodegeneration and other pathologies associated with AD.
title: TREM2 impacts brain microglia, oligodendrocytes and endothelial co-expression modules revealing genes and pathways important in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs9349407 was identified as significantly associated with Alzheimer's Disease susceptibility. Specifically, analyses involving a large sample size (54,936 samples) confirmed that this polymorphism in the CD2AP gene was linked to late-onset Alzheimer’s Disease (LOAD). Further investigations in a Chinese population supported these findings, reinforcing the idea that rs9349407 risk variants could contribute to LOAD through mechanisms affecting synapse function and actin dynamics.
title: The Alzheimer’s disease risk gene CD2AP functions in dendritic spines by remodelling F-actin

finding: The SNP rs12203592 was associated with a C-to-T mutation that created a ZEB/SNAI-like motif, negatively contributing to the MEL (melanocytic) topic score of the IRF4 enhancer. This SNP was linked to phenotypes such as freckles, brown hair, and high sensitivity of the skin to sun exposure. The presence of this repressor motif decreased the MEL prediction score, and mutating this motif led to an increase in the topic 4 prediction score. This indicated that the ZEB/SNAI-like transcription factor binding motif functioned as a repressor for the MEL state.
title: Cross-species analysis of melanoma enhancer logic using deep learning

finding: This SNP was linked to American ancestry and was a significant finding in the pooled analysis only.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: The SNP rs4896735 at the UTRN locus showed evidence of association with serum urate levels. It had a P-value of 2.0 x 10^-4, establishing its significance in both European and Japanese populations.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control

finding: The SNP rs675209 at the RREB1 locus was associated with increased gene expression of UTRN and had significant enhancer activity.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control

finding: The SNP chr6:26370572:C:T was associated with context-specific expression quantitative trait loci (eQTLs) identified using the SURGE method. Specifically, this SNP highlighted a colocalization with the GWAS signal for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), demonstrating that it plays a role in the genetic regulation pertinent to this autoimmune disease context.
title: Uncovering context-specific genetic-regulation of gene expression from single-cell RNA-sequencing using latent-factor models
